text:
I had two bottles of Pliny at Wades Wines Tasting Room in Spring 2017, and loved it. This is a flagship West Coast IPA, and stands up to it's reputation. Although local breweries are producing Doubles as good, if not better, I wouldn't turn it down. Strong and smooth, but with some bitterness I could do without. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2017 From tap at APEX, Portland. Big tropical fruit and pine aroma with grapefruit, sweetish fruits, orange, biscuity malt, pine resin. Flavour is moderate sweet with a long medium plus bitter dry-ish finish. Body is medium. Great balance, big tropical fruits, truly one of the finest IIPAs. ♡♡♡ Enjoyed again from tap at Toronado, San Francisco. Just as good.
Bottle into glass. Piney grapefruit aroma. Pours a clear golden with white head. Medium bitter taste. Smooth texture. Good IPA.

American classic. Pours light and clear. Lots of hops in the aroma: resin, pine, a bit of kerosene, some citrus, no tropical notes. The aroma predicts a dry and hoppy beer, which the taste confirms. Bitter, dry, great west coast IPA. In the times of sweet NE IPAs, this one is a very nice refreshment. Thumbs up!

510ml bottle - thanks Helen proximally, and random visitor from S.F. ultimately!
Bottled 29 days ago, thats one of the freshest US hop-oriented beers Ive ever had. Pale gold, crystal clear, brief loose head. Pretty fruity hops, but some sweaty stankiness too, and a promise of bitterness. Once the chills off, some caramel appears too. Light palate, crisp carbonaton, but not lacking fullness. Oooooh, thats a very pleasing taste - very citrussy/lemony hop forward, would not be surprised to see citra several times in the hop schedule - but with a very pleasant balance and drinkability to it. Like the bitter bite, makes my teeth slighty metallic. Light malts gently support the hops, but play second fiddle. Strange for a hop-forward beer to be better in the taste than the aroma, but Im very happy its so. Finish gets more bitter, more herbal, and even with a bit of seared pork fat in it, which I particularly like. Really picked up after the aroma.

I recently bought 2 bottles from April 2017 production and tried them on two separate occasions. In short, this IPA is OK but I wasnt impressed and felt underwhelmed with all of the hype about it. The best part is its fragrance - very floral. Taste is like a common IPA with plenty of hop flavor, fairly bitter, and light/watery mouthfeel. Didnt really detect any creaminess. Probably its better on tap and would be curious to try it but I wont be making the effort to find this in bottle again anytime soon.
On Tap at Penn Taproom. Gold, white head. Pine aroma. Full malt profile, rich hop flavor. Full palate, dry cloying finish.
Clear dark yellow, off-white lacing foam head. Nice hoppy aroma and strong bitter taste. Long lasting aftertaste. A through hoppy beer. (Houston 201705)

At Russian River Brewery ( packed at 3:00 Thursday!) 1.070 OG 8.00 ABV 
Pours golden yellow with no head. A quick burst of floral, citrus and pine blended to a velvet creamy finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

500ml bottle consumed in a bottle share, thanks to Sam. Pours golden clear, foamy white head. Leaves substantial lacing. Looks like a nice barrel aged saison. Smells nice. Piney, floral, citrus nose. Small aroma but pleasant. Tastes old school hops,. Piney, floral, malty and caramel. Small citrus finish. Dry and clean aftertaste. Bitter and crisp mouthfeel. Honestly I wanted to hate this beer. After all the hype I couldnt believe it was any good. Figured it would be an overrated west coast IPA. It is. but not as bad as I had thought. I still dont understand how anyone rates this above a 4 though. Its good but not great.
Great beer! Extra smooth for IBU of 100. I only got a sample wishing I had more. Hard to find around here.

(On tap @ Toronado SD, April 3/17) Pours a clear medium gold with an average white head and lace. Aroma is longer on resinous herbal and conifer notes than many modern IPAs, like pine and fir, grapefruit and citrus oils, lemongrass, some sweet orange and light tropical fruit notes, a hint of pretty clean and lightly sweet malt poking through the resin. Flavour again showcases lots of pretty hefty but flavourful hop resins, more pine needles, herbs, grapefruit peels, sweet orange, grass, lightly sweet and clean but definitely present pale malt backbone. Fairly high resinous bitterness, not totally palate scouring but quite a grip in the finish. Medium bodied, average carbonation, slightly slick. A really nice balance for a bitter resinous style of DIPA. Its not a million times better than other good examples, but it is definitely very good.

Bottled 3/10. Pours a clear golden yellow with a white head which dissipates quickly. Hints if apricot amongst the citrus aroma. Dry and crisp with piney hop flavor. At first I thought this was a bit over hyped (east coast bias), but with this my last of 3 bottles I've come around. Glad I waited to rate it.

John L - Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

pours a clear golden orangey yellow. aroma is of delicate flowery meadows and fresh cut grass. does not drink like most double IPAs, so smooth and mellow. great mouthfeel. flavors of balanced honey, hops, hint of malt, and bread. this is a brew worthy of its acclaim.

Nice clear golden, white foam. Aroma is clear and resinous, Im already sold. Very balanced and good hops. Green herbs and fresh resin. Taste displays more of resinous greatness, super clean, super refreshing. Really feels like hoppy sparkling water. Great stuff. Long resiny and smooth finish.

What can be said that hasnt been said already about Pliny. Its a legendary IPA, and for good reason. Its appearance and aroma are beautiful, goldish orange, with a hoppy pine scent. The taste is awesome, smooth and malty, slightly sweet, notes of caramel and just an all around treat for the taste buds. As a stout lover, I appreciate this IPA not just for what it brings to my mouth, but what it doesnt bring too. Its hoppy, but not overwhelmingly so, and a bit more malt flavor than most Imperials. Keep Pliny cold, and drink it fresh. From a bottle, consumed within 24 hours of purchase. All around excellent, masterfully crafted (and marketed too) IPA.
Es una cerveza muy rica y por eso es que tiene una gran fama, esta muy balanceada

De Russian River(USA) esta Double IPA de nombre Pliny the Elder, la productora de este mito cervecero es originaria de Santa Rosa California, se tienen como los creadores de la ahora muy popular American IPA y de este estilo, durante mucho tiempo esta cerveza fue considerada la mejor Double IPA del planeta por su buen balance entre malta y lúpulo, tambien era el estandarte de la costa este, La cerveza Pliny the Elder (Plinio el Viejo) recibe su nombre en honor al viajero, naturalista, historiador, escritor y director romano Gaius Minor Plinius Caecilius Secundus, a quien se adjudica el haber dado el primer nombre botánico para el lúpulo: Salictarius Lupus, que significa lobo entre los matorrales un nombre muy apropiado al crecimiento salvaje que el lúpulo desarrollaba entre los sauces, con un nombre legendario y una fama envidiable dentro del ámbito cervecero, veamos que nos espera.
En apariencia es una cerveza con buena corona de espuma de tamaño mediano, muy clara, perlas de compactas a medianas, buena retención, bien la adherencia en el vaso, color dorado muy claro con destellos amarillos, ligeramente turbia, cuerpo medio, muy agradable en vista.
En aroma es realmente única tiene notas pináceas, florales y cítricas a toronja, cascara de naranja, ligera nota a guayaba, hay un toque de dulzor restringido seguramente propiciado por las maltas, la intensidad es mucha, en cuanto estilos IPA, IIPA y otros en donde los lúpulos son el ingrediente estrella se debe procurar tomar la cerveza lo mas fresco posible puesto que después de los primeros tres meses las propiedades del aroma y amargor de este ingrediente comienzan a degradarse.
En el paladar es muy equilibrada el amargor esta bien presente pero no es tan agresivo y se nivela con la malta y el dulzor que otorga, los sabores que se pueden identificar son pináceos y florales, resina vegetal, cítrica como toronja y cascara de naranja, guayaba, ligero toque a miel, en cuanto a textura porta cuerpo medio muy sedoso, deja una capa sobre las mejillas similar a el aceite muy posiblemente sea propiedad del Dry Hopping, una cerveza que sin lugar a duda ya no es la mejor IIPA del planeta aun asi su receta no a envejecido y tiene propiedades muy particulares que no e encontrado en otras cervezas del mismo estilo ademas su nombre forma parte de la mitología cervecera, sin duda un clásico que se tiene que probar por lo menos una vez en la vida si te interesa la cerveza de verdad, yo espero volvérmela a encontrar igual o aun mas fresca, esta botella que llego a mis manos fue envasada el 23/11/2016 y la ingerí el 14 de febrero de este año.

Great IPA, even better marketing. I believe its been said before...there are quite a few Great IPAs out there...but you could Definitely do worse. My Hats Off (if I had a Hat On) to Russian River Brewing.

Gylden klar skum hvid 
Citrus grape blomst malt 
Bitter meget sød lidt 
Oile livlig

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2017 Nu taa, pirmkart shoks par to ka balanss off. Jaa laba iipa, loti laba karbonizacija, bet nebija wow momenta vispar. Vienigais kas ir pecgarsa- ta ir ilgaka ka jebkadam alum kads dzerts. Kivi, grape miza un mazliet flora, komplekss bija ok.
Poured from the tap. Clear golden orange with white head. Grapefruit and pine hops, mild caramel, hint of skunk, great blend, smooth character.
Easy to see and taste why this is rated so well. Lots of hops from beginning to end! Pine scent keeps the nose busy.

Sampled from bottle at Maakuns. Big thanks!! Clear gold with thin white head. Sweet malts, big citrus and fresh exotic fruit, big weedy and skunky hops. Explosive aroma. Moderate sweet and bitter, nettly hoppiness gives it a crisp spicy edge. Medium body, nice smooth and cool malty feel. Soft carbonation. Great stuff.

Bottle shared. Clear golden with white head. Grapefruit, apricot, light dank weeds, sweet malts. Good balance between the hops and malts here! Great match between aroma and taste. Medium sweet and bitter. Over medium bodied with slight creamy sugary feel. Very good.
Amazing Brew, One of the Best IPAs out there. Notes of citrus, pine, and resinous hops. HOP BOMB

Poured from the bottle into a pint glass to drink. The beer had a mostly clear gold color with a very slight amber hue and a very large foamy white head with extremely long-lasting retention along with modest cling and lacing. Its aroma was dominated by fresh citrus and pine scents, featuring light grapefruit and perhaps watermelon, with touches of lemon, straw, and a bit of barley. The taste was a strong bitter blend of different citrus flavors along with an influx of pine and spices and slight touches of watermelon and grapefruit. There was also a very subtle malt character, lending just a touch of caramel and sweetness. The beer had a very filling and thick mouthfeel with a lot of density, character, and ample carbonation for a heavy swallow. A fairly drinkable beer, which masks the relatively high alcohol content exceptional well; excellent beer, as advertised!
Really good but a little overrated. Plenty of other great IPAs out there. Still, you could do a lot worse.

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, orange, tropical fruit, pine, hops, citrus and grapefruit.

Appearance:

Clear/hazy golden/amber beer with heavy yeast and with a slight/medium white/off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, orange, tropical fruit and pine; ends slightly bitter and dry with hops, citrus and grapefruit.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Great aroma and palate, with an even better flavour. Shamefully this beer is filtered to oblivion. The appearance takes the biggest hit thanks to this, but I bet that the other aspects would have been better as well if they did not make that decision.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2017 Pure gold, color and beer!  Foamy white head with a lot of soapy lacing. Smells dank, piney, grapefruit citrus and a bit tropical along with some sweet biscuity malts. Bitter and yet wonderfully balanced. Creamy smooth palate. One resplendent beer.
This is just magic. Great dank hop aroma, heavy bitterness, alcohol well hidden behind the hops. Love this stuff.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2017 Several times on tap& bottles at Toronado bar SF, brewerys taproom etc.: pours golden clear with foamy white head. Aroma: intense hop aroma with rich piny, fruity, citrusy notes. Flavor: ceispy, biscuit like malt backbone & intense rich hop flavors with big cart of juisy tropical fruits & pine. Hop bitteness is high but perfectly balanced with malt backbone. Body is medium, texture velvetly, carbonation is medium.

TAP. - lively golden pour with foam head.. Punchy piney hop nose, some golden malt as well.. Thick sap malt body, caramel & syrup goes into piney hops, finishing a combo of the malts & hop stickiness.. sourced Russian river brewery

Bottle - 500ml. Golden body with a huge, white foamy head. Awesome hoppy aroma with citrusy and tropical fruits hints. Its sharp, well balanced hoppy taste carries citrusy, woody, and herbal notes. Ends with a long bitter finish. Fantastic!
AMAZING!! by far my favorite IPA. Great taste, great price, great all around beer
Poured from bottle. Light caramel colour. Good nose. I had this ages ago at the brewery and have fonder memories than from the bottle but still very nice. Enjoyably hoppy.
Pours nice a golden. Pretty hoppy but easy to drink and smooth on the palate.
Full pints at the tap room, easy drinkable DIPA a pice of history that each hophead might to taste almost one time.

Full on Americn hops in both aroma and flavour. Massive grapefruit pine, and heavy bittrness. Despite being massively hopped this manages to maintain some balance and softness around the edges. A good beer.

On tap at RRBC 101016. The Pliny was the only reason to my trip to California, and it made it well worth 13 hours on a plane. In my eyes its the classic west coast IIPA...incredible well balanced... Clear light golden with a beautiful white head, aroma and taste is grapefruit, honey and pine resin.

Excellent IIPA! Pours a light orange with a golden hue, off white head that clings to the glass leaving tons of lacing rings. The nose is accented with delightful grapefruit and citrus fruit notes, light caramel notes, mild pine needle notes and a light alcohol presence. Sweet caramel and bready malt notes up front with a heavy citrus fruit that smacks you mid palate before the bitterness hits. Bitterness is short lived and leaves a delightful balanced taste of caramel and citrus hops. Syrupy, medium to full bodied palate, light carbonation. A very fine brew!
definitely lives up to the hype. smooth, cirtrus hops, well balanced and overall balanced feel. no doubt a solid imperial IPA.
Fairly traditional style US IPA. Poured a clear golden with a large frothy white head. Aroma of huge citrus hops. Medium body, flavour of sweet caramel malt and grapefruit. Well balanced.

Ámbar limpio y espuma marfil. Aromas intensos de piña, fruta de hueso, albaricoque, pomelo, balsámicos, menta, pino, fondo maltoso. Cuerpo meloso y denso, muy jugosa con sabor de pomelo, pino, menta, con un final de amargor resinoso largo y equilibrado.

500mL bottle Bottled 04.26.16
Deep golden body, creamy dense white head hangs around
Lovely resiny hop nose - pine, elderflower, ripe peach/nectarine, passionfruit with delicious biscuity, toasty, bread crust malt.
Body is spot on - chewy, slick & resiny with hops, good weight but doesnt feel like an 8%er.
Malt shines through more on the body - that lovely toasted bread/brioche sort of malt, pale caramels & sweet biscuits, hops compliment this with notes of stonefruit, passionfruit, pine needle & savoury spice. Firm, lingering bitterness, very well balanced.
Not as fresh as I would have liked but it doesnt detract too much from what is an amazing beer!

Bright copper-golden pour, crystal clear. Nose of resin/pine, ripe grapefruit, Valencia orange, hints of pastel candy, gently sweet and reserved biscuity malt. Flavor is extremely balanced. I can see why so many have loved this. Its nothing complex, new, or extreme. The gently sweet malt backs a hint of pine and resin, grapefruit and orange, and floral lemon zest, all in harmony. Even a warming alcohol sensation begins to develop, but its somehow endearing. All in all, Pliny is all about the balance. Textbook west-coast.

This is the only double IPA I will only drink! Great beer, fresh aromas and really have a developed flavor. I prefer out of the keg verses the bottle as there is a different flavor to me between the two.

500ml bottle from the Bierkoning Amsterdam
Aroma: A lot of fruity scents in the aroma, tropical fruits and some grapefruit to be exact. No grassy scents, but there is a slight caramel feel. Resin comes out when warmed. Anyways, a great aroma!
Looks: Copper with off white head and some lacing
Taste: Dry and fruity, some resin, very intense tropical fruity hoppiness. Medium bitter, very nicely balanced bitterness. Amazing fruitiness. 
Feel: medium body, medium carbonation
Overall:Benchmark IIPA for me! Loved it!

Tap at Royal Oak, San Francisco.
Clear dark amber. Strong hops, citrusy. The flavor has perfect balance, high bitterness, light sweetness, piney, caramel malt. Very nice.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2017 On tap at the brewery. Great pine and citrus aromas. Mouthfeel is perfectly balanced between malt and hops. The finish is malty sweet and ends dry. Overall a top 5 DIPA and worthy of the chase.

Pours a transparent amber with a sizable, frothy white head. piney, tropical fruits, perfectly balanced. Medium carbonation, excellent mouthfeel. Just an overall well-balanced beer, definitely deserving of its high rating.

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2016 Attractive, slender 510 mL bottle gifted from a gracious coworker whom had been touring San Fransisco previously.  Kyle, seriously - tusen takk, min venn! 
  The pour is an effervescent golden rod with weighty foam atop. Leisurely, it frosted downward to the liquid after three minutes of settlement.
 
 
-------- the last 4½ years, this beer was absent from my alcoholic consumption.------ />
 
Right up to the lip of the snifter, chives and a gloriously obnoxious Columbus hop layer become overly apparent on the nose. This introduction is followed hesitantly by honeydew melon, paper pulp, dried jasmine, white tea, pine cones, saturated cardboard, apple cores, and stale crumpets.  I took a sip, and gulped it down - I experienced the same flavors, but bitter & Valencia orange peels, lavender, gym socks, and mint overwhelmed my tongues processing. A rebound peck carrying unripe kiwifruit, wildflowers, and marsh sage participated in my swallows examination.
 An exceptionally clean, delicious fill. I consider this to be a wonderful, enigmatic IPA, though I certainly became perplexed on its bitterness - which wasnt intense by any means, but pushed more of a "hop vagueness" in a way I didnt know how to respond to it.  I remember this as a juicer beer, with tropical fruit (guava, pineapple, papaya) notes and American yeast galore.  Incredible how things have changed so quickly.

Backlog, pite kilkanaście razy. Świeże wymiata. Fantastyczny aromat, dużo żywic i owoców, w smaku zdecydowanie wytrawne, z potężną, a jednocześnie niesamowicie przyjemną goryczką. Jedno z najlepszych IPA jakie piłem.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2017 Panel RR Rami Rami is drinking a Pliny the Elder by Russian River Brewing Company at Chmielarnia MarszałkowskaPanel3 nie bucha aromatem ni kuta, poltora miesiaca czuc. Ale w uscie jest faktycznie klasa, ladnie wywazone, gladkie, wchodliwe, goryczka fajna, krotka i milaOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

510ml bottle. Clear amber with a frothy white off-white head. Flavors are biscuity cereals, honey, caramel, pine resin, peach, mango, grapefruit peel/flesh and alcohol with grassy and floral notes. Medium body, moderate carbonation, oily texture.
Pliny is delicious, though overrated. I would say AleSmiths IPA or bells hopslam is just as good. Smooth as can be with fruity melon-like finish.

Why doesn't everyone make their ipas with such balanced hop/malt ratio? The hoppiness is mild, but actually ADDS body to the beer, while being a very bitter beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rating #500: Hazy golden with little white head. Aroma is butter, tropic fruit, some resin. Taste is really everthing and nothing, boozey, sweet, a spicy pepper stuff while swallowing. Very balanced, yes, but I dont get it fully. The finish is still full of resin bitterness that sort of clogs your throat.

(bottle) slightly opalescent deep golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of herbal hops, brown sugar and mango purée, with some notes of vanilla, light black pepper, watermelon and red onions. flavour is mostly mango, pale malts and onions, slightly resinous, with a light touch of physalis, pears, some more sweet vanilla and a light-bitter finish. medium- to heavy-bodied with average carbonation. awesome!

Bottle, 2 months old. Herbal piny, spicy aroma. Hazy golden, offwhite lace. Great balance - orangepeel, pine, light tropical and fruity chewy malt. Relatively sweet but not cloyingly so, grassy, flowery which cuts through nicely. fullbodied, sweet. Nice fruity profile which finishes on a spice note. Dangerously drinkable.

Pours deep gold into a shaker. Bright white head with excellent retention recedes to skim surface. Pine, weed and citrus aromas. Soft with sweet caramel and weed upfront turning to hot pine before the lasting grapefruit pith finish. Nice.
Pours golden with a thick white head. lots of soapy lacing. Aroma has tangerine, pine, grapefruit and malt. Flavor is the same. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Dry resinous finish. Nice.

On tap at Toronado in North Park San Diego. Served in a full pint glass. No head. Light golden amber. Deep golden malt backbone. Lots of pine and grapefruit. Some spice. Bitter sweet finish. Not as great as I had hoped for.
500 ml bottle. Hazy amber orange with white head. Piney, with zest grapefruit, tropical fruit and marmalade. Dry with medium bitterness and medium carbonation.

Bottled on 8/16/16 ... drinking 9/11/16

My first sample .... Thanx Steve Franks. 

The aroma is piney & resin. A slight soft sweetness and dry finish. A chewy grassiness in the middle. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Multiple 500 ml bottles ordered from Blackwell's Beer Run. Pours deep golden with medium white head. Flavours exceptionally balanced with citrus, sweetness, and pine. Excellent!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ive had this beer many times on tap and by the bottle and it never disappoints. Its a well balanced beer. I can never get enough of the aromatic citrus smell from the head. The moment you try it, youre hit with the great bitterness any imperial IPA must have, after the beer goes to the back of your tongue, youre met with one of the most smoothest and freshest finishes any beer can offer. Is Pliny the Elder the best beer in the world? Thats up to you. But what it definitely is, is a well balanced beer that I know you will enjoy. Cheers!

Bottle from Russian River 
Wunderbar ausgewogenes Double IPA. Die Balance zwischen Bitterkeit, Fruchtigkeit und Drinkability ist großartig. 
Davon will man auf jeden Fall immer noch eins trinken.
8/5/16 bottle. Pours a clear yellow color with a small white blanket. Centennial hops and pine tree Medoum bitterness, sweetness, and long bitter finish. Very good and crushable dipa.

ASPETTO: ambrato chiaro, limpido. Schiuma bianca, fine, abbondante e decisamente persistente. AROMA: complesso e intenso. Fruttato (frutta gialla e tropicale), floreale, un tocco bi biscottato e caramelloso, e ovviamente tanto luppolo. GUSTO: allattacco è dolce (biscotto, caramello) e fruttata, per poi evolvere subito in un amaro erbaceo e floreale non invasivo. Lamaro permane ed esplode nel retrogusto. Carbonizzazione bassa (lavrei preferita con più bollicine). Corpo medio. CONCLUSIONE: forse la migliore Imperial IPA che ho assaggiato fino ad ora (se la gioca con la Victory DirtWolf). Fama meritatissima!

On tap at Russian River. Pour was amber with nice off-white head. Aroma is piney and citrusy. Taste is much the same especially hitting the citrus notes. Whats striking about this beer is how balanced it was with just the right amount of malt. Finish bitter but not too much so. Outstanding.

Bottled 500ml. -Huge thanks Domagoj for sharing. Clear golden coloured, medium sized white head, pine in the nose. Moderate malty, piney, decent grapefruity hoppy, mild caramel and touch of alcohol with strong pleasant bitterness in the finish. Decent brew but not the best Ive tried. Glad to finally rate it.

As soon as you start pouring you get kicked by the splendid Aroma of this beer. You start thinking on flowers, pines, herbs, oranges, grapefruits, little pineapples.... Great hops combination on just the right amounts. Gold with Orangy tones and a white crown. Good retention. 

I was expecting a very bitter taste, but actually is not that intense. Dont get me wrong... it is bitter, but its not harsh. You can taste a little bit of malt sweetness, but youll be overwhelmed by the citrics fruits flavors (mostly grapefruit). This is not the place if your are looking for yeasty flavors. Youll get a strong bitterness on the after taste... lingering... dry but pleasant.

Light with regular carbonation. Very easy to drink, and very inviting, so watch out... its a 8%.

If you want a complete shake of the senses, Pliny The Elder is the way to go. (D)IPA lovers... this is the beer.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2016 500ml bottle bottled 28/07/2016. Tasting with George. Pours a clear golden with a white head. Aroma is tropical fruits, malty. Taste is resin, medium sweet, tropical fruits and piney hops. Piney hops, slightly sweet aftertaste. Excellent balanced beer, THE Imperial IPA, classic.

42 días de ser embotellada, servida en un Spiegelau IPA. APARIENCIA: de color ámbar con algunos destellos naranjas a contra luz, se observa cristalina y media alta actividad de carbonatación; corona de espuma color blanco de buena retención, copiosa y de burbujas compactas. AROMA: notas cítricas de los lúpulos utilizados es lo que domina; cáscara de toronja y naranja, atrás algo de piña, notas herbales y resinosas, "dankness" pero muy balanceado, ligera presencia del dulzor de las maltas. SABOR: de entrada un amargor intenso, que a pesar de eso no se siente agresivo, le siguen las notas cítricas de los lúpulos, cáscara de toronja y naranja es lo que más destaca, además de notas a piña, algo de "dankness" y muy ligeramente el dulzor de las maltas pero todo muy balanceado. El retrogusto queda un amargor intenso pegado al paladar con una larga permanencia, muy seco pero no se llega a sentir agresivo. SENSACIÓN: cuerpo medio ligero con sensación oleosa, mediana carbonatación.
RESUMEN: excelente DIPA, muy balanceada.
Like pure hoppiness this is a perfectly balanced dipa. Great bitterness but also lovely and smooth. Great beer.
Bottle, as fresh as bossible in Sweden. Fruity hoppy aroma, yellow colour, hoppy taste. Nice

Purchased at brewery, youve heard it all before, balanced, smooth, tropical, hops, the perfect ipa, to experience the freshness you have to go to the brewery and have it on tap. The best.. Pours golden , nice lacing, if you love beer and die, this is what God pours in Heaven..

On tap at the brewery. Worth the wait in line! A beautiful golden colour - how a double can be this clear is beyond me. Smells lightly of pine, and some slight citrus. Wow, so good. I cannot explain how awesome this is to taste. As they say, lives up the hype. Clearly one the greatest out there!
look.....it live up to the hype and is brilliant. I want to move to California just so I can drink this all the time.
Draft in Davis, CA. Deep copper color with thin head. Aroma and taste had a lot of grapefruit. Not particularly bitter maybe because it did not seem piney to me.
One of the best ipas out there. Tough to find unless you live on the west coast.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2017 On tap at Hollingshead Deli, Orange, CA, 6/27/2016. My first Russian River beer. Orange-golden color. Super clear. White head. Aroma of citrus, caramel, and pine. Floral notes. Taste is similar to nose. Has a bitter, hoppy, clean finish. Very good.

The famous and well-lauded beer from Russian River! Sure... it is damn good, smooth as silk, yet, I cant say with good conscious it is good as its reputation proclaims. It has a thick, almost alcohol, middle that distracts from the hop profile. What is to say? Very good, but somehow couldnt meet my lofty expectations. 510ml bottle

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2017 Aroma: piney and fruity; complex; Appearance; clear orange pour with white head that dissipates slowly; Taste: strongly hoppy but balanced with wonderful malt backbone; Palate: medium body with very long, very bitter finish that slowly builds; Overall: can definitely see why its so appreciated; would absolutely get again if wanting a west coast iipa.
Rerate at brewery: original rating 4.3. Taking it down to a 3.9. Still really like it, but may have been overly generous last time.

Light orange colour, white head. Aroma of grapefruits, citrus and biscuits. Taste is medium bitter, light sweet, very well balanced. Light to medium body, slick texture, soft carbonation. Thanks to Freddy for the bottle
Bottled. Pours clear Amber. Thick foamy head. The smell is super hoppy. The palate is thick and foamy and sticky. Huge hoppy taste. Citrus grapefruit berry. A little piney malt backbone. Awesome dipa
Bright, fresh pine and citrus. Fresher the better. Always golden to dark orange in color. Beautiful malt back bone to compliment the hops. The godfather that started it all! Long live Pliny!
Second day in a row at the Monks Kettle in San Francisco. Great aroma, reminiscent of Arrogant Bastard, but slightly less upfront. Great beer.

Appearance- clear light yellow
Aroma- dry, hoppy. No essence of citrus or grapefruit
Taste- dry, hoppy, slightly bitter but balanced. Very good dry west coast IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From the source. Lovely orange Reddish hue, nice foamy white head. Aroma of caramel, pine, alcohol. A benchmark for the style but notes of spearmint.

Bottle dated 5/11/16 straight from the brewery. Pours a very clear gold color. Amazing that there are a ton of hops in this and its this clear. The hops are quite the star here but has a very malty backbone that just shines. Love it!!

Bottle, 500ml. Consumed fresh (7 weeks after bottling). Clear golden with a frothy offwhite head. Aromas of fruity and floral hops, caramel, resin. Full bodied with moderate carbonation. Medium sweet, heavy bitterness. Deep roasted and hoppy character into a stinging bitter finish. Legendary beer.

Bottle, 500ml. A clear golden beer with a medium size white head. Aroma is of citrics, especially grapefruit and lemon, hops and floral hints. Taste is bitter with a perfectly balanced hoppy finish. Medium bodied, smooth and astrigent with a floral and malt character. An extraordinary Imperial IPA.
Sample at brewery. Malty floral aroma. Heavy but not over powering floral hops. Full bodied. Hint of alcohol but smooth

Fruity, hoppy aroma, fresh squeezed grapefruits, orange peal. Cristal clear, super lacing. Taste super dry, fresh, juicy, hoppy. Pleasant crisp bitterness in the back. No sweetness at all. Super nice long aftertaste. No wonder this beer is legendary, years ago it was probably mind blowing. Now its just awesome.
!!!!!!!!  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Bottle, thanks to Misterburd! Clear golden yellow with large off-white foamy head, floral hops aroma, medium carbonation, delicious sweetish balanced hops taste, smooth body, long flavorful hoppy finish. This is as good as it gets for a DIPA!

A very solid DIPA. This beer is really much lighter in color than I expected, and is a crystal clear golden with good head and nice hoppy aromas. The beer is very drinkable despite being 8% alcohol. Its not overly sweet like some doubles can be, but is a great example of DIPA.

Enormous thanks Alberto for sharing this! Finally! Golden body with a small white head. Light hop-driven aroma, pine, vaguely citric. Herbal, piney but fruity too taste, strawberries, tropical fruit, somewhat dry and sweetish. A solid, slightly too excessive malty backbone.... oof. its very good but I have to say that I expected far more.

On tap at Beachwood bbq seal beach. Clear golden lots of lacing. Fruity citrus piney aroma. Heavy hard n hoppy. Long lasting fantastic iipa. Really manageable bitterness but still deep and even a bit like chewing hops. For the style this is the best.

14 days old bottle, august 27th 2015. Finally got the chance to have a Pliny, I was wondering if it could justify the hype, after all its a double ipa, a style there is released about one zillion new brews of each day. This is supposed to be one of the kings on the hill. The fruity hop aroma works well with the crisp malt. Fruitness is dominating with strong tropical notes, flowers, resin. Taste has a nod of sweet malt, mostly hop driven as well. Bitterness comes through easily, making a dry and crisp yet fruity beer. Little to suggest this is a strong double as the malt and sweetness is hidden away behind the hops here. Zesty and full of resin I conclude the hype is more or less justified.

Popped into the Russian River Brew Pub in Santa Rosa on a trip to northern California. One of these led to a couple more plus the purchase of a growler and a case of bottles. This is the holy grail of IPAs. It is arguably the best IIPA Ive ever had. A rich goldern color with a lovely frothy white head that lasts to the bottom of the glass. A hoppy aroma with notes of citrus, pine and an ideal amount of malt, citrus-y with a perfect balance of hops and malt. Delicious!

Bottle dated 4/26/16. Pour is clear golden with a nice fluffy head. Aroma is quite delicious: peach, mango, pine, grapefruit, mild sweetness, really nice. Lots of bitterness on the tongue, but that pine and grapefruit make a strong showing as well. Dry finish, a gem of a West coast IPA.

510 ml (?!) bottle bought in Mill Valley, CA. Clear dark golden in the glass, mid size white head. Very fruity in the nose. Taste starts smooth, fruity, malty, followed by a more floral hopy sequence. Nearly creamy texture. Nice not too bitter aftertaste. Enjoyed it!

Draft at RR. Peach, mango, grapefruit with a dank soapy sweetness. So well balanced. Tastes like fresh weed smells (more so than any other IPA). Every time I think maybe this is maybe slightly overhyped I am proven wrong. This is so, so good. Blind Pig is nearly as amazing but this is still the gold standard.
On draft at the brewpub, massive piney aroma, floral, resin. Nice amber, orange colour. Head fades quickly. A lot of bitterness on the back end. Really good stuff.

finally... bottle shared by a friend. had this one after blind pig. poured a deep dark golden colour with a white head. nose of crisp malts, caramel, slight bitter pine notes, hops, harsh, citrus, grapefruit, and dried fruit. taste is a bit harsh, sticky, and bitter. a world class west coast ipa, but i prefered the blind pig over this one

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2016 From a pint bottle. Tried to get hands on this for over a year. Pours clear golden with substantial head. Smell is fantastic with nice big piney and citrus. Drinks heavy pine with less citrus similar with finish. It is very balanced for a 8 percent beer. Very solid one, although didnt blow me away after searching for almost a year to have this one. More I drink of it more Iike it.

Big thanks to my co worker for bringing this one back from CA to IN. 13 days in the bottle when I popped the cap. Wonderful aroma. Juicy hops. Exactly what you want from a big IPA. A blend of citrus and tropical. Flavor is dense with hop deliciousness. Its moderately bitter, touch of sweetness. Not sticky or overly so at all. I could do with more bitter, less sweet but its a beer I would buy all the time if I could. Love it.

Gold, clear, white fluffy head. Aroma of pine, fresh hop cones, tropical fruit. Taste- drinks easy for a 2XIPA. Very well balanced, these are the two things that I notice first. As far as flavors go, can't say it blows me away but no question it's well crafted. Like the aroma, you get the pine and light tropical fruit and something like rosemary and thyme, herbal flavors. Improves with every sip. Not the best I've had but very nice!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ Russian River Brewing, Santa Rosa, California (20.04.2016)   

Chmiele: Amarillo, Centennial, CTZ, Cascade, Warrior, Simcoe 

Pliny pachnie jak cały las tropikalny zamknięty w szklanym kielichu degustacyjnym! AROMAT DOSŁOWNIE MIAŻDŻY intensywnością! Jest to coś niebywałego i niespotykanego na co dzień.
Zapach jest maksymalnie złożony i bardzo głęboki. Przewijają się tutaj wszystkie możliwe właściwości chmieli: cytrusy, owoce tropikalne, kwiaty, żywica, sosna, korzenność, żywiczność. W smaku ogromnie czysty cytrusowo-tropikalny profil. Goryczka średniej siły, bardzo krótka, znika przed kolejnym łykiem. Oleista faktura i potężna pijalność!
Perfekcyjny balans słodów i chmielu. Jeśli jakieś piwo w stylu Double IPA zasługuje na 5.0 to musi być właśnie Pliniusz Starszy. Balans słodów i chmielu jest niebywały. Wszystko tutaj zagrało jak należy. Piwo kompletne od A do Z.

Cant believe I somehow missed rating this. Bottle 4 weeks old. Clear gold, with heavy lacing. Nose is juicy grapefruit pith, some honey when it warms, light greeness and pine. Taste is dry on firm malt backbone, with long bitter grapefruit pith finish. The archetype for a reason.

Fucking, duh. It tastes like god made this beer especially for you. You want more before youre done drinking it. It makes you happy to be alive. Piney. Fresh. Vibrant. Balanced. So balanced. Clean. Its everything you heard. It lives up. If you like IPAs, this is your new girlfriend. Drink it. Before the guy sitting next to you does.
Good but not spectacular. Pleased to have tried it but wont go out of the way to get it again.

Bottle. Aroma is tropical fruits, mango, orange, citrus, pineapple, hints of pine, some herbal notes. Deep golden, clear, nice frothy white head. Medium sweetness, medium bitter, taste is grapefruit, orange, orange zest, tropical fruits, floral notes, nice bready backbone, some alcohol. Medium body, medium carbonation, long delicious finish with beautiful bitterness and some warming alcohol. Extremly well brewed DIPA with lovely integrated bitterness. Definetly up to the hype!

Simcoe to the face and a slight malt backbone come from this crystal clear pale golden brew with little white head around the edges of the glass. The flavor at first is sweet then bitter with a grassy note and creamy finish. This full bodied brew offers a good balance between malt and bitter with a nice finish of hop flavor.
genialny posmak owocowo tropikalnie, dodatkowo mega fajny owocowy aromat, troche mniej ciała mogło by miec ale ogolnie klasior

Undoubtedly one of the top beers out there, or at least one of the top beers that I have had. The taste is top notch and mouth feel makes wonder whats that water all about in the Russian River Valley

Bottle with massive thanks to Cloin! (Bottled 210116 in correct uk format) - Amber pour with white head. Aroma and taste is sweet malty and fruity, with some pleasing tropical grapefruit and peachy notes, splash of citrus across the palate, big solid caramel malty backbone, very easy drinking for the abv, overall as a massive DIPA fanboy this scores very highly, but falls "just" short of heady which I have also had recently, but this is still a real show stopper. Gorgeous!

Pours a deep dark orangish amber color. Aromas of big hop action, sweet malts, and more hops. Flavor has some bready maltsy tastes with nice grapefruit and floral hop taste. This is one hoppy sumbitch.

Finally got to try this one! Bottle poured into a tulip glass. Medium off-white head that slowly dissipates. Amazing aroma of pineapple, mango, citrus, and earth. Ahhh the hops! This brew assaults your palate with citrusy piney hops and ends with a smooth finish and almost no hint of alcohol. It was a bit more bitter than Stones Enjoy By IPA to me, and thats why the taste does not get a 10. A truly great double IPA. Check it off the bucket list.
UPDATED: APR 2, 2016 Enjoyed as part of the massive 28 beer flight and four bottles at/from the brewery. Unique beer on all level. Pliny, Dark Lord, and Heady are the Trinity...

Pliney the Elder, need I say more...yes. Floral aromas. The Pliney flavor is so unique, water, yeast strain, etc. Strong hop structure. One of a kind taste. Drink it any time you can get it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours ember. With a little head foamy head. Hoppy nose with a bit of citrus. A little thicker mouth feel. Leads with a bit of molasses and finish with mild hop bitter. Very smooth. Very good very well balanced.

Lived up to all the hype!!! Scored a 3 week old bottle. Very smooth yet still punches like a 80 IBU beer. Abv was almost not noticeable for a imperial. Loved every sip.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fantástica cerveza directa de lal fabrica , al primer trago no sorprende tanto como uno esperaría , pero a partir del segundo y tercero va sacando todos sus matices , ligera pero con cuerpo , notas de resina fresca , buena espuma!

On tap at Churchill's Pub & Grill in San Marcos, CA. 

Clear, golden color with an off-white head and excellent lacing. 

Aroma of citrus, tropical fruit, pine, pineapple and caramel. 

Aroma of citrus, tropical fruit, pineapple, caramel, grass and pine. 

Medium/full body and medium carbonation with a satisfying mouthfeel. 

So what's the big deal? Another west coast DIPA. Except this one is borderline perfect for the style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Drank it on October 21,2015 from a bottle that was bottled September 30, 2015.

Look: Beautiful honey golden color with a thick head. Pretty fine head with good retention and lacing.

Smell: Citrus. Citrus. Piny. Piny. Malt backbone can be felt as well. Again, more citrus.

Taste: Resinous bitter grapefruit and orange rind flavors are very front and center. But its so well balanced that other tastes begin to seep in. Excellent. I would say its the perfect taste.

Feel: Medium body very smooth mouthfeel. I personally like less-carbonated beers, but this was very nice too.

Rating #4999. Many thanks to the ubergenerous Fergus for gifting me a bottle of this bucketlister! 510ml bottle, 8%, drunk within 4 weeks of bottling. Amber orange, pretty clear, thick foamy white head, full lacing. Aroma is grapefruit, soft caramel notes, some mango, lightly floral. Body is smooth, rounded, soft carbonation. Taste is straw, grassy, grapefruit, some pine, toffee malt, floral finish. No booze showing up - smooth drinking. Not a flashy wow what a flavour beer - its more a wow I could happily drink 10 bottles of this 8% beer sort of beer. Thanks again for this one Fergus, which I may never have otherwise been able to try.

Bottle shared by Chuckie. Poured clear golden amber with off white head and some lace. Notes of pine, malt, grapefruit, caramel and sweet hop. Lots going on. Bitterness is prevalent and more earth comes out as I chew. Still bitter though and mildy sweet.

On tap at Obreins in san diego. Appearance is vibrant sunshine gold color. Very inviting beer. Aroma is typical iipa. Huge hops aroma. Passion fruit and tropical notes mostly. Taste is really nice. Very smooth and not overly bitter. Kinda one dimensional with not alot of malt characteristics to pick up on. Palate is spot on. Has medium mouthfeel with sweet upfront and finishes sour. Overall an outstanding beer. I expected more depth of flavors but still amazing!

Bottle share with Theydon on 4th March behind Titan. Poured clear golden with a nice white covering medium carbonation. Nose is strong pine citrus grapefruit. Taste is pine grapefruit citrus straw wheat hoppy biterness. No wonder its a top rated beer! Excellent stuff.

Draft at Tornado. A pretty translucent gold color, head was white but had dissipated. Aroma of pine, grass, apricots, lemon. Lemon peel, unripe oranges, straw, pineapple. Smooth. No biting bitterness. Pretty excellently balanced. Warming. Boozy aftertaste but mildly. Reminds me a lot of Bodhi which is saying something for Bohdi.

Nice 1" head.. eggshell white with alot of lace and stuck around forever.. brew is only slightly hop hazed golden straw.

Nose is wonderfully fruity hoppiness.. citrus.. pine.. pineapple.. you name it.. reminds me of Flintstone Vitamins my mom made me take as a kid..

Flavor is a huge fresh hop smack in the tongue.. not nearly as bitter as expected.. very balanced with an obvious battering ram toward the hop flavors.. minerally and fruity hops.. pine and grapefruit zest without a bit of pith.. finish is looong and fruity.

Bottle. Pours a nice, clear gold color, with a big, foamy, off-white head. The aroma is grapefruit, butterscotch, lemon peel, and a bit of rye. Pretty bitter, with just a touch of sweetness. Medium body, crisp, sharp, and surprisingly clean. The aftertaste is long and bitter, but surprisingly pleasant. This is a nice, crisp IPA. The hype made this kind of disappointing, but its still a seriously good beer.

Clear yellow orange pour with a nuce white head and great lacing. Aroma is strong pine and grapefruit rind with some sweet citrus mixed in. Taste is pine, resinous, citrus rind, and a bit herbal. Strong lingering bitterness. Medium body that finishes dry.

On tap at Mohawk Bend in tulip glass. Aroma is intense pine, grapefruit, citrus, floral, with malt presence. Appearance is clear, golden yellow, nice sparkle, finger-width white foamy head with fair retention, attractive lacing. Taste is as nose--strong pine, citrus, grapefruit, herb, floral. Palate is light-to-medium bodied with thin texture, with pleasant lively carbonation, finish is dry, crisp pleasant bitter. Overall, strong aroma and flavors, complex and fires on all cylinders. Long live Pliny the Elder!

Served on tap at falling rock. Clear golden color with a white head. Hops floral grapefruit aroma. Hops citrus tropical fruit flavor. Well balanced. Medium light body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Notes of floral, pine, and citrus aroma. Light golden hazy color that will only tempt you to have another sip! Overall taste is very clean, smooth, and slightly bitter with notes of resin and pine. All hops are blended to perfection. One of the best IPAs around! Must have!

Thanks Rob for this very brew Ive been waiting for so long to try! Dégustée en apéro en revenant du spa. Je me sens privilégié, ma spatule de risotto aux queues de homards à la main, de déguster une fraîche représentante de la mère de Heady et de presque toutes les IIPA que nous connaissons aujourdhui. Pliny était effectivement bien en avance sur notre époque. Liquide très doré, presque cristallin et bien mousseux. Jai les deux pieds dans locéan de la côte ouest avec une forêt de conifères pour seul témoin. De la résine et beaucoup de fruits. Je sens que ce liquide au corps visible ne se laissera pas boire sans mot dire. En effet, le liquide est collant en bouche et présente des notes organiques de pain au levain. Lamertume nest pas tranchante mais provient dun zeste dagrumes qui se mêle parfaitement au pin. Texture beurrée, rondeur appréciable et alcool tout-à-fait imperceptible. Je ne peine aucunement à imaginer que cette bière fut à lépoque, une réelle révélation!

510ml bottle. 1/25/16 bottle date (19 days old). Appearance: crystal clear golden orange, with a thick slightly off white head. Nice lacing. 
Aroma: Strong fresh fruity melon and citrus, with a bit of pine. 
Taste: Light malt sweetness with a touch of caramel, turning to a strong, juicy, grassy, resinous hop flavor. Only the lightest touch of citrus comes across. Bitterness slowly builds into strong crescendo. 
Mouthfeel: Light body for the style with a moderately high carbonation. 
Finish: Very dry with a strong grassy bitterness. 
Overall: Probably the easiest drinking, most refreshing IIPA youll find. Lighter malt base than most but still balances the strong bitterness well.
Had it at class today, and all over its the perfect beer for me! Wish it was easyer to get more of.

From notes (many bottles on many occasions). Theres a lot of hype. Theres a lot of bias. But Id say that the actual beer in the bottle lives up to the hype and justifies all of the bias. Its decidedly "old school" with a noticeable, firm bitterness and a hop schedule thats far more pine than "fruity" or "juicy", but its just so well done. Its perfectly clean and dry, which allow the hops to be showcased, and its still just about the archetype of what a DIPA should be.

Id say this is a nostalgic beer for me and thats why the rating is so high, but its way more about the beer. Its got the hoppy start and a very tasty finish. Youd expect more bitterness given the happiness but it is very smooth on the back end.

poured from a bottle. Nose is potent from an arms length away with a big variety of stone fruit, citrus and grapefruit leading the aroma and flavor. Some subtler notes of juniper and pine. Wonderful beer that has the obvious credit to being on top.

It's perfect. Seriously. Perfectly hopped with the right balance of pines and citrus. Your palate dries from the bitterness and leaves a piney palate. The aroma is strong and smells of citra hops.

It's not just hype. 

Bottle in SoCal.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

What separates this imperial IPA from all others is its cohesion and secondary attributes. In a world where most IPAs are designed to explode your face upon first sip, the Pliny is a lesson in what a properly balanced imperial IPA should drink like. No discernible flaws. Not too much or too little of anything. Its an IPA that is shockingly smooth by any standard with a crisp, clean finish. 100 IBU beer without a trace of bitterness. Magical how well integrated this beer is.
Its just perfect. Perfect look. Perfect taste. Perfect smell. And perfect bitterness.

Worth the hype. Much more subdued than the deScription implies (40% more malt and twice the hops). In the hands of an amateur that would translate to "thick, sweet sticky cat piss", but that's not what has happened here. The aroma is so pleasant- Pine, wild flowers and citrus. The flavor is big, but not malty. Light, bright and a little spicy. The finish is what gets me. Just like that, it's gone. No lingering hop resin or hairy tongue like some cheap ironically over hopped bullshit hipster IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The aroma is astonishing. An earthy pine resin bouquet of hops. Amber alight with a unobtrusive and diminishing head. Did I mention that the aroma is astonishing? Taste of candied malt...ghostlike and disappearing. Hops appear in its stead...crisp and bitter...And again the aroma! I find myself in a pine hewn cabin deep in a wood, prostrate on a woven wool rug while the hops grow into the walls and eventually consume my being. And suddenly the vision is adrift. The finish so clean. So dry. An apparition really. One I want to experience again!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rating #1571 20.03.2015 Birthday Brew Tour Stop #4 - PizzaPort Ocean Beach. The hype has killed me, killed me, killed me. Pours a darker amber, with a bubbly tan head. Aroma is citrusy, grapefruit hops predominant. Taste is extremely hoppy, lots of cool grapefruit notes - mild tropical, mild pine, mild orange zest. Extraordinarily balanced - the sweet, cookie dough malt met with doses of bitterness, and they all linger into the finish.Lovely DIPA.

Great beer, I mean great by the balance. Really standard well made west coast IPA so you shouldnt expect some hazy Vermont-MA IPAs. Citrus, piney, tropical fruits aroma with some malt backbone. Little bit boozy and kind of salty but the great balance and hoppiness make this beer the best IIPA in the whole world.
UPDATED: JAN 21, 2016 Draft. Pilsener pour. A: bitter fruity, exotic fruit, carrot, lime, strong malt character. T: follows aroma, gentle but strong bitter development with light fruity aftertaste.

Had way better IPAs disappointed lacked hopps tasted flat..traded in BEX for dogfish120IPA and Firestone Walker Parabola. 

Better ones are zombie Dust, Half Acre Vallejo,and Bells Hopslam.

If I were a lesser man Id give this beer a perfect score...alas I am not. With the that said this concoction is superb. It is ba look balance personified...Luke Skywalker. I have been for several years now more than critical of the IPA style and if hoppy beers in general. Its today...in Hawaii. This fucking thing rules me. Enjoy.

On tap at backcountry pizza and tap, Boulder CO. Good spicy and floral aroma that belies a fair amount of malt in the background. Appearance is an absolutely stunning light Crimson color with no head. A 5 all the way. Tastes very sharp and hoppy with a little sweetness to balance it but still comes out on the hoppy side. Good palate, a little more carbonation than I like but it works here. Overall I wouldn't say that it's the #2 DIPA in the world but it was good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours golden with white head. Aroma is citrus happiness. Taste is citrus that is also balanced. Excellent IPA.
One of the best beer Ive ever drank. Ive drove 4000 kilometer with it in my car to bring it back home, and it was incredible

This beer is absolutely perfect. Super hoppy but theres no residual bitterness. I picked up a bit of a spice(cinnamon) note in this which made this beer very enjoyable. No surprise from the illustrious Russian River Brewing Company!

Non the freshest one but ... Wonderfull. Aroma of tropical Juice, some stone fruit, some caramel, a little bit of Pine needles. Pale golden with a great white head. Flavour is the same of the aroma, with some tropical Juice and stone fruit followed by strong malt presence. Great body, wonderfull mouthfeel, oily beer, smooth.

Draught at Toronado, San Francisco. Almost clear golden ale, slim foamy white head. Really fruity with dominant orange zest, citrusy, grapefruit, resin, big malty base: extremely well balanced. Aftertaste keeps building and building in fruity orange, sweet bitterness. Big body, medium carbonation, oily mouthfeel.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2017 Fresh bottle served in a tulip. The beer is a crystal clear golden orange with a thick white head that leaves nice lacing. Aroma is all tropical and citrus. Hints of pine and caramel are present too. Really intense and nice. Flavor is citrus right up front. Lots of orange and grapefruit, as well as some tropical flavors. Pine kicks in to round it off with a nice caramel backbone. Its very sticky and refreshing. Awesome IPA.

Update. Original bottle was 2 months old. Had fresh. Aroma and overall +1

Wow. One of the best IPAs. Very well balanced bitterness and sweetness. The aroma is strong! Strong alcohol level so not drinking a lot of it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: very strong hoppy aroma with piny and grassy notes.
Taste: strong bitterness with moderate malty body.
Flavour: its all about hops with soft pale malts.

Very good.

Bottle into snifter. Pours a clear light copper colour with a finger of white head. Aroma is passion fruit and pine. Taste is tropical fruit with some pine. This bottle is a month old and this beer is definitely one of the best.
At the brewpub, lives up to the hype. Great hops backed by fantastic malt. Worthy of the accolades.
Amber color, good head, Nice aromas of citrus mango and pine, , in flavor is very tropical also with pine verynice bitterness.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2016 Tap to pint glass @ Russian River Brewing tap room@ Santa Rosa,CA
Appearance: Light amber,clear, white medium foam, lacing
Aroma: Very fragrant, very nice hoppy aroma
Taste: Mild bitterness, sweet long lasting aftertaste
MF:balance
OA: Exceptional beer, very good reason to travel to Santa Rosa(among other reasons, mainly the beers at Russian River.
Drank: August 2015

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2016 Clear amber pour with a tall white head with relatively good retention. Complex and pleasant smell, quite delicate, with notes of citrus, pineapple, mango, caramel and pine - this beer has everything. Extremely well balanced taste, bitter and sweet. Citrus, exotic fruit (pineapple again), pine, honey. Medium carbonation and a very soft and smooth mouthfeel, almost a bit oily, it goes down very easy. The aftertaste is mildly bitter, with notes of pine. An extremely well balanced and drinkable beer.
Keg at Apex. Pours golden orange with a thin white head. Aroma of Hops and grass, taste the hops in it but it is well balanced. A great beer

Kinda perfect. Really well balanced. A bit more malt than a lot of IPAs, but not a super hop bomb, despite the 100 IBUs. Nice malt build and not s hopSuper IPA/APA flight with John (Schlafly TIPA, Founders Harvest Ale, Pliny the Elder, Zombie Dust, Alpha King, Sierra Nevada Celebration ale). Thx Ibrew2or3 for continuing to knock out top 50 for me!.

Poured from bottle 10/2/15 thanks Willrunforbeer my last beer in Vegas. Pours golden orange with a nice white head. Aromas of fresh hops malt and hints of grass. Taste is hop citrus pine and floral. A perfect harmony of flavor.

Thanks for the bottle share Jon. Pours a clear golden orange with a small off-white head. Grapefruit and citrus notes on the nose with some light grain and caramel. Medium body with a nice fresh, citrus character and good balance between malt and hops. Bitter finish with some light pine that lingers.

Bottled, blind test RULE taproom. Very pale, fine refreshing fruity and citrus aroma, taste isnt so good - good start with some fruits but then lot of bit hars bitterness, which becomes but annoying. Middle wasnt so bad. A good beer but not the best DIPA ive drink.

510 ml bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki, from trade with bytemesis. Thank you Mike! Clear golden color with white to off white head. Malty and hoppy aroma, citrusy fruity, orange, grapefruit, tropical fruits, pine, caramel. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Super hoppy aroma poured orange with nice lacing and big pine hop aroma. Taste extremely bitter that is good. Fresh bitter. Awesome beer.

Bottle shared with jheath99.Ive waited for years to get my hands on Pliny the Elder and now my beer goal has been achieved! Pours transparent gold with frothy white head. Aroma of citrus, pine and grassy notes. Tastes very strongly of bitter hops, citrus, pine and floral notes. Bitter hoppy aftertaste. Its the perfect IPA. Excellent beer

Aromat intensywny, chmielowy, dużo nut zielonych, trawiastych i tytoniowych. Piwo jest zaskakująco lekkie w smaku i wytrawne, goryczka średnio-wysoka, fajnie zbalansowana i niezalegająca. W tle lekkie nuty alkoholowe. Pozostawia tytoniowy posmak w ustach.

0.51 l bottle from Firma Bier, bottled in September 2015. Clear, golden orange with a medium large, creamy, almost stable, white head. Sweetish, fruity-floral aroma of passion fruit, mango, orange, honey and some pine. Sweetish, fruity-resiny taste of passion fruit, mango, orange and pine, accompanied by notes of honey and caramel. Rather long, medium bitter and grapefruity finish. Medium to full body, very creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Overall with a massive malty backbone and a balancing, punchy hop bite. Lovely on the palate, super-fruity and juicy as well. Very good!

Bottle at tasting, one month after bottling date. Golden pour. Fresh aroma of citrus, pine, grain and some caramel. Hoppy fresh taste, with lots of citrus, mild peach, pine, grassy herbs, mild cara and a dry finish. Good dipa.

From Bottle. Golden in color, excellent lacing. Rush of citrus and pine at the start, light ale flavor mid palate filled by little bitter rush. This is a great Imperial IPA, part of my love of it is the hype it bares within the community. And further I feel my rating is also biased because of its scarcity, but I have yet to find its equal in style at any local american store in a bomber.

Sometimes you are just lucky. A more fresh Pliny than this one is hard to find in this side of the world. Bottled just 2 weeks ago and arrived in Sweden for me to enjoy. And I did. Aroma is sweet malty with grapefruit and pine needles. Taste is grassy, piney and yet with a balanced sweetness towards the bitterness. Its hard not to give this a top rating, and if I didnt, I would just be another hipster who wants to be different. Excellent Imperial IPA this one, even if there are several that are more easy to find.

Everyone cleared their palate with copious amounts of water before trying this one. A shared 16.9 oz. bottle poured to snifters displaying a clear & bright, golden hue, with presentable, bubbly white head foam, and clingy spots & strands of lacing. The nose started out dank, then pleasantly pungent notes of citrus as grapefruit & lemon, with a bit of resinous backing. Light to medium bodied, with decent effervescence to the carbonation, just a hint of mellowing caramel sweetness, and a mild alcohol presence, the taste also included a healthy & lingering, citrusy & earthy hop bitterness, but 100 IBUs? Not blown away, but quite smooth, and balanced in all the right places.

Easily the best beer I have tasted so far. I had to go back and get a second pint during a tasting to enjoy it again. I will certainly keep coming back for this delicious brew. Mild aroma but packs huge flavor! I'm surprised it has an IBU of 100.

À la fois douce et amère, chargée de résine de conifères mais laissant également deviner des petites baies rouges en arrière plan. Cest très facile à boire, il ny a rien de démesuré et la texture est douce et soyeuse. Lalcool est parfaitement camouflée. Je dois par contre dire que mes goûts au niveau de la bière ont changé depuis quelques temps et les (D)IPA ont davantage de difficulté à atteindre le sommet de mon palmarès. La Pliny est une bière réussie mais qui, à mon avis, ne vient pas réellement changer la donne pour les amateurs de bières du Québec, situés si près des géantes vermontoises.
Big pine mango hop aroma. Taste sticky n sweet, finishes with big hop oil mouth costing hoppy bitterness.

Opened within a month of bottling, and kept it refrigerated at all times. Poured a cloudy golden yellow, and the head was quick to dissipate. I took a quick whiff and while subtle, there were a lot of hoppy and earthly tones that meshed really well. The first sip hit me with a traditional IIPA feel of sharp bitterness and flavor, but the finish was ungodly smooth for its style. The hops linger a little bit afterwards, not enough to be annoying, but just soft enough to its easy to remember the flavor long after youve finished with the sip. Overall a wonderful beer, although the effort put in to find it is a little off putting.

From a 510ml bottled on 082115. 25 days old bottle. In a large tulip. 

Aroma: Pine, lots of pine. Not a lot of dank, this is different than heady. Little on the citrus side, just a little grapefruit rind. This is the father of all the floral, spicy and herbal dipas. Not too hoppy, and thats why perhaps you hear once in a while how this is very disappointing beer. There is a significant present of nice bready malts in here. 

Appearance: Clear bright golden in color. Nice little white foamy head. Those bubbles are just so beautiful to watch. Has a nice carbonation for a dipa. 

Taste: malty, sweet and bitter. Piney and spicy. Little herbal finish and nice little dryness. Wonderfull and complex.

Palate: The mouthfeel reminds me a lot of Blind Pig, very unique, and hard to articulate. Oily, sticky and very lively. 

Overall: Pliny is unique. The mouthfeel, the carbonation, the spicy/herbal/piney notes here are unique. Dont call this beer overrated because its not better than heady or other east coast ipas.

Amber color. The nose is full on malt and hop assault. Citrus, pine, bread, candied apples jump from the nose. The mouth shows some caramel notes with prickly hops character. The hops are very sharp in this beer and the bitterness. This is really a well made beer but fairly malty and some what sweet. I appreciate its craftsmanship, but I wouldnt be reaching for this all the time. Give me a San Diego IPA over this anytime.

sample at beer bloggers conference, courtesy of jay brooks, cheers!
clear apricot golden amber with fluffy beige head. Super fruity tangerines and mango on the nose, moderate body, not overly bitter but super hop-forward in flavour and aroma, amazing balance.

Russian River Pliney the Elder has a very thick, off-white head, a hazy, orange-gold appearance, some bubbles, and heavy lacing left on the glass. The aroma is of sharp, resinous, hop oil and white bread. Taste is of sweet, white bread, white bread crust, and very bitter hops. Mouthfeel is high medium and slick, and Pliny the Elder finishes puckering and decently drinkable (although, you will feel it in your head). RJT

Shaker showing dark amber with a finger of clean white foam.

The nose shows a lot of grapefruit, resinous pine, and notes of cannabis.

The palate is full bodied and well carbonated. Shows a lot of resinous pine, slight background of grapefruit. Strong IPA bitterness on the end. A lot of spicy zest throughout.
Bottle from Imazato. Everything I thought it would be. Perfect pine and tropical aroma. Perfectly balanced, no alcohol profile.
What more can I say that has not been said? Big hoppy aroma of pine and tropical fruits. Taste fresh and very hoppy delightful bitterness with and exceptional clean finish.

In a word....... resinous 

On tap 

Appearance ...cloudy gold.. modest head and lacing 
Aroma - pine and citrus
taste - remarkable balance citrus elements initially then strongly resinous which lasts...
palate considerable body 

I had two......
Bottle, pours dark gold, resinous nose with tropical fruit undertones, big hoppy body is surprisingly well balanced by smooth golden malt.

From the tap the pour is clear golden with a light head, the aroma hoppy up front citrus, the taste is a little sweet lightly hopped a little pine bitters and a clean citrus, the finish is clean and mouthfeel is thin. Great beer.
MMMMM Piney hops with medium sweetness, medium bitterness, average carbonation, golden, frothy, resin, herbs,

Refrigerated 0.5 L brown bottle, bottled July 23, 2015, from misterburd poured into a glass. Clear golden with medium/big white head. Aroma is very nice herbal hops, medium body, low carbonation, and good small-bubble lacing. Taste is tropical fruit, herbal hops, pine hops, and bitter finish.  Good beer, but thought I would like it more.
Bottle. Medium amber. Solid head. Awesome hoppy original aroma. Good hoppy palate. Balanced. Good hop variety. Delicious.

Smell is fantastic. Candied oranges. Mouthfeel is soft and undercarbonated. Flavor is bitter coming in and going down. Slightly boozy. More burnt orange on the taste. Also peaches. I agree with another reviewer that it reminds me of Maine Beer Lunch. I actually prefer Lunch.
Nice hop and citrus scents, very light in color. Nice hop flavor, maybe a bit subtle. Kind of reminds me of Maine Beer Lunch

On tap at Monk's Cafe in Philly. Finally! Pours gold with a nice size white head. The aroma is grapefruit, lemon and pine. Flavor is a wonderful hop blend, with lasting bitterness in the finish. This beer is wonderful and lives up to the hype. 8.50

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle @ Maxi. Thanks for the hook up. Clear orange, medium white head, nice lacing. Aroma, hoppy, pine, floral, apricot, peach. Taste, hoppy, pine, grapefruit, lime, malty background. Really bitter.

Bottle; pours clear gold with a slightly off white head; tropical fruit aroma with some malt and pine; taste is a little bit bitter with tropical fruits and some caramel notes with malt; finish is bitter with more tropical fruits; very good
Crystal clear golden, ample white head. Pine resin, grapefruit. Bubblegum. Bitter, good malt backbone. Clean medium body, slight alcoholic hotness. Long finish. Classic, excellent.

Pour golden clear yellow with nice white head. Aroma of yeast, hops, herbs and citrussy. Flavors of citrus hops herbs and spices. Full nice strong flavours of hops, very nice IPA. Nice bitterness and citrussy flavours. 
Very pleasant.
Different size bottle 500 ml??? Cracked and smelled huge hops. Pine citrus and mango. Flavor of fresh squished hop cones in your hands. One of best hop head beers I know of. A must try.

Bouteille de 500 ml offerte par mon ami Martin. Un gros merci. Arôme: Une bombe de pin. Apparence: La couleur est orangée-dorée légèrement voilée avec une très faible densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Fort goût de pin avec une pointe de pamplemousse. Longue durée de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Présence de pin en arrière goût. (Rating #6428)

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2015 Slightly hazy golden. Aroma is tropical fruit, pine and dank notes, smooth malts. Taste: hoppy, subdued smooth malts, silky body, super drinkable at 8%. Strong and smooth bitter finish. In the end, nothing stands out, except the perfect smoothness and balance. Excellent.

Wow! The father of all DIPAs does not disappoint. SOme biscuit notes on the palate otherwise a light malt backbone to this hopmonster. Hop bitterness is at the front of the palate and aroma is all pungent, resin hop. This is the gold standard for DIPAs
Crisp, refreshing with a beautiful golden color. Very well balanced hops and would pair well with any food.
First had this in Cali, very hard to get in shops but worth the hunt. Nice clean finish.

Perfect golden color with small foam layer. Fresh hoppy (piney) smell. The taste is bitter sweet, with a thick mouth feeling. Forest pines with an awesome bitterness-sweetness balance. Calm, sweet, bitter and dry aftertaste. This beer is not very edgy or overwhelming in a particular matter, but the decent mixture is just convincing.

How: Bottle, 16 days old.
Where: From hackbock, thanks!
Appearance: Clear dark golden colour with a bubbly off-white long lasting head.
Aroma: Tropical fruit, grapefruit, citrus, floral.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Hops, fruit, a bit bitterness, tropical fruit, citrus.

Bottle thanks to Morgan! Sunset orange pour with a nice bubbly head and spotty lacing. Nice hoppy aroma and fresh grapefruit and piney taste. Medium body and a medium dry grapefruit finish. The alcohol is hidden but it does sneak up on you.

Pours vibrant amber with a small head.
Nose shows pine, resinous hops, clean malt and soft herbal notes.
Flavours include more of the same resinous and piny hops. Incredibly well-balanced with a hint of sweet clean malt.

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2016 Had this beer multiple times and every time it was amazing. Not because it jumps at you with something in particular but because of its perfect balance and extreme dinkability. Almost clear golden color, white head. Resiny, green, hoppy aroma. Really good combination of malt and classic hops with pine and grapefruit pith. Medium body and carbonation. Extremely drinkable and tasty.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2015 Been waiting to try this. Came so highly recommended that it was a question if it could live up to the hype. Not disappointed. Great taste and very enjoyable. Hard to find but worth the effort.

Bottle.

Big, frothy head. 

Pours completely clear and golden. 

So hoppy nose! Grassy!

Really stingy bitterness and whole bodied beer. Malty and round, with very piny hops! Pliny the piny!

Its good, but didnt live up to the hype ive heard.

Notas aromáticas agradables e intensas. Cítricos, en dónde destacan la naranja y mandarina, así como ligeras notas herbales. 

Color amarillo brillante, completamente filtrada, carbonatacion media, buena espuma y retención. 

En boca, frutal, amarga y muy agradable.

Al paladar es una cerveza intensa, sabores fuertes pero bien integrados, el amargor y los cítricos son primordiales, sin embargo es posible percibir un ligero dulzor de la malta.

En resumen una cerveza muy bien integrada, frutal completamente, amargor intenso, algo alcohólica y aún así, fácil de beber.

Not worth the hype, but still good. 510ML bottle to cervoise glass. Pours clear light amber, thick frothy head, good lacing. Aroma of pine, candied fruit, flowers, earth, metal, wet hops, and dank. Taste is pine, grapefruit and citrus rind, licorice, raisins, candied fruit, sugar, roasted malts and dank. Finish is dry, metallic, hop-bitter and apricot. Mouthfeel is light-medium, with lack of carb.

Was shocked when a friend brought this and surprised me! Aroma is very nice, mild grapefruit, hoppy, mild alcohol, taste is smooth and complex, grapefruit, hoppy bitterness, alcohol, resinous, mild to moderate finish, very dry, lived up to its hype. Have never given a 5 but I found nothing wrong with this beer. 5/5.

From memory from a tasting about 3 weeks ago. Strong hop aromas of citrus and pine. Very nice, surprisingly balanced flavours of grapefruit and base malt. Not as assertively bitter as I was expecting.

Gyllene klar ljus färg, med stora & små vita bubblor. Tappad för en månad sen. Fantastisk humledoft! Fantastisk komplex & makalöst balanserad. Oljestruktur, granbarr, grape & Citra på ett balanserar pottpurri! Grym!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A: Grapefruit, forrest, juniper T: Grapefruit, pine O: 2 weeks fresh. Creamy mouthfeel, very nice hops! I really enjoy this one! Wow!!

This lives up to the hype. Simply the best IPA I have ever had. I wish it came in 12 oz bottles rather than a pint, but that is a minor complaint. Oh yeah, I also wish Russian River hadnt stopped distributing to Washington State! 😀

Aroma is roasty malts, passionfruit, grape fruit, citrus, lemon grass and honey. Taste is pale caramel, honey and sweet malts paired with a fabulously smooth but somehow still quite complex. Appearance is a clear gold with a medium pearl head that retains quite well. Excellent beer.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2015 Rating #900. On tap at Toronado San Francisco. Aroma is huge grapefruit and pines. Taste is soothing sweetish grapefruit, some pineapple, some grass, resinous. Just how you imagine a DIPA that does everything right and nothing wrong. The bitterness is perfectly balanced, the carbonation is low but still present. Lives up to its reputation but more for its great craftsmanship than for being special.

Bouteille 500ml, gracieuseté de tom10101, un gros merci Tommy pour cet extra! Couleur orangée claire voilée, mousse blanc cassé majestueuse laissant une belle dentelle. Arôme de houblon résineux, pamplemousse, malt, pin, zeste de pamplemousse, un peu floral. Goût de pamplemousse, malt, agrumes, houblon résineux, un peu sucré, bonne amertume toute en longueur. Carbonatation moyenne, corps moyen-dense. Bel équilibre entre les saveurs, ça se boit tout seul.
Bottle. Pour is clear gold with a thin head, aroma is fruity, sweet. Taste is fruity, sweet, light bitter. Good but not fantastic
Fast klare kräftig goldene Farbe, ordentlich weißer Schaum. Geruch sehr hopfig, grasig bitter, citrusfrüchte. Geschmack sehr hopfig, angenehm grasig bitter, citrusfrüchte, blumig, trocken im Abgang.

Bottle. Hand carry from CA. Pours gold. Nose is unreal: grapefruit, lemon, pine, angel tears. Flavor is a masterfully complex hop blend, with the perfect amount of lingering bitterness in the finish. This beer is so insanely delicious.

500 mL bottle poured into a pint glass.

Beautiful white head with lacing that clings to the glass. Golden with just a bit of haziness.

 Hoppy, citrusy, barely a hint of malt. Strong grapefruit smell. Clearly a hop bomb.

Fresh orange and grapefruit flavors and a bit of pine. Slight sweetness, but it stays behind the hop flavor. Very little bitterness in the start. The bitterness lingers with the finish. A little grassy in the back. 

Medium bodied and drinkable for its size. Tingling carbonation adds to the freshness and brightness.

The standard of DIPAs.

500 ml bottle. Pours orange with tall, long lasting, fluffy white head and nice lacing. Aroma is of citrusy hops, tropical fruit and bready malt. Body is full and tangy. Citrusy, herbal hops dominate the flavor while bready and caramel malt and tropical fruit provide some balance. Finish is long, massive, very bitter, grapefruity. Amazing brew.
3 weeks old bottle sent from tradepartner in California. Fresh, and delicious. Pineapple, fresh cut grass and piney moutfeel topped with a tropical fruit salad. Such a insanely great brew!

Draught @ Russian River. Pours clear golden with a long lasting fluffy white head. Aroma is pine, tropical fruits, apricot and citrus . Flavour is sweet, medium bitter and dry. Full bodied, incredible smooth texture, soft carbonation. Finish is well balanced and highly drinkable.

Semihazy golden body, white small head. aroma has nice tropical fruit punch, apricot and some caramelly oiliness. quite nice light hoppiness, perfectly balanced. flavour has some candy, but stays very dryish indeed. hops are dominant, mainly just fruits over fruits. quite a punch. very fresh. no alcohol present.

Bottle from Zitzke. Haven't had this in 6 years or so. Nose is clean hop and grain. Crisp and dry with good hop burst. Hop isn't too acrid and although no real sweetness to cushion it, the bitterness is muted enough to feel like part of the mix. Good. Real good sir.
Waited a long time for this one. I expect much more from this is one. Quickly disappearing head and a lighter Color than I expected.

Imperial IPAs are always too fulsome for me, the cara malts take over and a diacetyl/eggy nose ends up making it too much for me... Untill i drank a Pliny. bottle is 2,5months old. Superb hoppy aroma, slightly caramel and a bit of alcohol. Taste is the same, incredible mouthfeel, very soft. A very nice long bitter aftertaste. Sweet but not too sweet, hoppy but not overhopped and a nice alcoholic feel. Damn. I understand why this is worlds best impIPA... How can one go back to the regular stuff after this!

12 oz pour from chilled tap into a nonic pint glass at Russian Rivers restaraunt and tap house. It took 40 minutes to get in the door, but it was worth it. Golden and clear with a fluffy white head and aggressive and enjoyable carbonation. Nose is citrus, pine, and flowers. Body is full and creamy with a crisp finish. Taste starts with a blast of citrus, then some pine, then a lot of hops bitterness and some tropical fruit. Leaves pine and tangerine on the tongue with a plesant lingering bitterness. Nice sweet malty backbone behind everything. Lots of complexity and lots of layers. A whole bunch of hops tastes. Definitely one of the best imperial IPAs Ive had, though I wouldnt say the best outright.
Bottle from Marco. Hazy gold with a full white head. Aroma is fruity hop. Flavor is malty, grapefruit, pine, constant bitterness. Lively hop bitter finish.
