Melhor DIPA que já tomei, justifica a lenda. Tomei em São Francisco no Urban Tavern

Thanks to Drew and Priority Mail - Brew date 4/21/15- Pours a nice light gold/yellow with a big white head. Nice piney and floral aroma. Hoppy, mild bitterness , well balanced. This is a nice easy beer to drink. maybe a little over rated by some but I would defiantly drink this again anytime I had the opportunity.

Tap at the brewery with commonshawn, rosskyle, and wildcard. Beer #2 at a seriously awesome brewery. Pint glass. Lighter in color than anticipated with gold and orange starring. Minor white head with great lacing. Grapefruit on the nose...very refreshing. Another nearly perfect beer. Bitterness offset by a sweetness and alcohol presence. Aftertaste has pine and resin but perfectly resides in the mouth. (I dont even know what that means but its a good thing) Highly recommended.

Tap at brewery with commonmac and rosskyle and wildcard. Dark gold with white head. Very hoppy clean nose. Perfect balance of hop and sweet and alcohol. Some citrus pine resin. Very clean. Basically the perfect double ipa.

Many thanks to Werckmeister for this bottle! Bottles 27.02.15.  Very floral in the nose. Leaves, Grapefruit. Fresh and smooth beginning. Sweetish fresh body. Very smooth. The sweetish body is a bit too hich, but the hops are great piney and floral. Fresh, nice bittered. smooth. Sweetish-bitter aftertaste. Fresh. Great brew but not too exceptional!

Nose is fruit, peach, apricot, with slight boozy. Great flavor, soft pine, resin, with very mild notes of biscuit. Early sweet, mild bitter middle, with a dry bitter finish. Brilliant, thanks to Benny B for hauling it back to Minnesota for me.
on draft in SF. color was perfect for an IPA. Smell not overwhelming but pleasant. a little too much bitterness for my liking, but not bad. Not my favorite IPA out there but still a very good one.

Finally got to try this. Thanks Brian for bringing this back from California. Bottled on 4/21. Perfect golden body with a wonderful white head. Tons of pine in the aroma. Puts you right in the mindset of walking in a pine forest. Huge bitter pine flavor with tons of citrus taste. So good. Seems like an excellent balance of pine and citrus, probably leaning more on the pine side. Oddly, there was still some left in the bottle after the bottle share, so I went back for seconds..

Amazing floral aromas, sweet. Pours with a thin head. Very interesting mouthfeel, almost slippery. Very pleasant flavored and a nice finish that isn't too danky like other DIPAs. Big thanks to Bill for bringing this, traveled 2100 miles, still drank within 2 weeks of bottle.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at APEX. Surpyising subtle. Aroma is grapefruit, minerals. Taste is good, very subtle again, nice balance of malt. Not too hoppy. Nice.

Draught at the Russian River Brewing Co, Santa Rosa, CA.
Clear golden colour with a small white head. 
Fruity and piney hops... dry bitterness... super balanced hoppiness in the aroma. Strong but smooth. Amazing balance. Dry hops in the flavour. A bit more aggressive hoppiness in the flavour but still extremely balance. Tasty and smooth. Two pints were not enough.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2015 Bottle received in trade..thanks Patrick..golden orange pour with a fluffy white head..aroma of grapefruit,pine,caramel,resin,tropical fruits..initially bitter,hoppy but gives way to grapefruit,mango,earthy sweetness..was worth the wait..top notch.

Bottle: I believe this was the second beer I ever traded for, many moons ago. What a time it was. Under two weeks old, too. Golden-amber color, pours with crystal clear clarity... Wow. Soapy, thick, bright white head nestled on top. Insane aroma of pineapple, citrus rind, orange zest, floral leaves, semi-dank pine, a hint of perfume, a touch of white pepper, mango, a touch of honey & crackers. Flavor is hop-city; wet, bitter, assertive, but never harsh. Loaded with pine, resin, & hop oil. Tons of pineapple rind, mango, grapefruit pith, some lightly sugar crusted orange peel. Malt backbone balances nicely without distracting from the hops; lightly toasted biscuits & crackers. Finishes with a very faint sticky hop resin & bitter citrus peel. Absolutely blew me away years ago when I first tried it. While Ive had some better DIPAs since that time, this is still a goddamn fantastic rendition no matter how you slice it.

Bottle thanks to Bill Young. Pours clear golden with a big frothy slightly offwhite head. Aroma of hops, light grassy hops, malt, grapefruit, orange peel, citrus, peach, pine, light pineapple. Taste is hoppy, grassy, piney, citrus, grapefruit, peach, malt. Very smooth but pretty disappointing overall. Overhyped much, obviously!

Couldnt find this beer in Texas and now that I live in California Im swimming in it! This is just an excellent IPA - packed with hops but perfectly balanced. Beautiful golden color and floral aroma add to the experience.

It lives up to the hype. Its not leaps and bounds above what else is out there anymore, but its still a fantastic DIPA. Pine, resin, citrus, near perfect balance. This beer is fantastic and worth seeking out.

THIS IS THE PLINY ELDERS, SO GOOD!!! I MAKES HOME BREWING ALL TEH TYMES FOR MY FRIENDS AND THEY SAY A PLINY IS AS GOOD AS THIS PLINY. HOPS ARE BITTER AND SMELL WOWS IN MY NOSTRILS. BEST EVER, SAID THIS ONE BEER REVIEWINGS AND I THINK SO...TO. WAHT MAKES THIS SOO SPESHAL IS PLINY HAS perfECT HOPS LIKE CALIFORNIA CAN ONLY. ALL OTHER BEERSs TRY TO BEE PLINY BUTT THEY FALE THROUGH. MY GIRLFRIEND SAYS PLINY IS OKAI BUT SHE IS A DUMB AND DOSENT LIKE REAL BEER WITH HOP. I NO BETTER ThAN THAT WOMEN. DRINK PLINY IF YOU AM A BEER PERSONS!!!

Shared bottle with k0mpsa, 1000 times thanks. Delicious tropic fruits and perfumes on the nose. Light, transparent golden color. Superbly smooth and lenghty, creamy palate with loads of delicious toasty flavors. Lives to its expectations.

Bottled. Great Thanks to Shawn Burns, california. Almost clear deep golden color, white head. Balanced aroma has hops, fruits, lemon notes, pineapples. Big balanced hoppy body, fruity, lemon and tropical fruity notes. Nothing to add, just perfect dipa.

Hops are carried from the aroma to the taste. Clear colour White head. Taste is heavy bitterness with a hint if sweetness. Solid body but still refreshing. Long aftertaste, bitter with some dryness.perfect balance of taste and drinkability.

by far one of the best ipas ever lots grapefruit and pine needles and extremely fresh and crisp dont over pay for it meaning no more then 10 bucks Stone Enjoy by series i think is better but i wouldnt pass on this one either

Tap, Monk's Kettle. 
Pale copper, yellow hue, crystal clear. Big resiny, columbus, centennial(?). Just enough caramel (~c40) to give substance, but still drinkable. Bit of leafy, medicinal lingers. 
Excellent dipa. Not what the hype makes it out to be, but a benchmark representation of style.
UPDATED: APR 28, 2015 Just a great IPA plain and simple lives up to the hype. Its a darn shame this beer is not easier to obtain so more beer lovers of IPA?S could at least try and enjoy this beer.

bottle at home from trade with amazinwrldfood, many many thanks for this one Rob. dark yellow, clear color. medium big off-white head. very nice smell of pines and fruits, mango, oranges, light grapefruity, very light sweetness. medium to full body, rather bubbly carbonation, almost a bit too much, slick mouthfeel, taste of pines, fruity, mango, oranges, grapefruit, grass, citric, light astringent, light sweetness. light dry and light to medium piney bitter finish. nice pine notes on the aftertaste. wow, was really looking forward to this one. Drinks very good and tastes very fresh, greatly balanced brew. Definitly lives up to the hype. Bottled on 03/07/2015.

Bottle, four weeks old, muled from San Francisco (City Beer, I think) by Button the Mule, my best mate and drinking partner for the last 25 years. And its ridiculous that I didnt get to share it with you, Joe. Never even got to say thanks. Youve left us too suddenly, and too soon, and youll be missed like youd never have believed. As for the beer, I think youd have approved. Its fresh, juicy, clean, and pithy bitter in all the right places. Theres an elegant sweetness to it. Its a grower. Its delicious. Theres a phrase youd have used to describe it! Cheers Kid. Ill see you for a pint another time.

Bottle, filled on 02/27/2015  Big thanks to Werckmeister for this. Golden body white head. Aroma is citrus, fruits and pines with some malty caramel and biscuits in the background. Taste is also fruity, citrus and also perfect complemented by the malts. Aftertaste is also perfect balanced hop bitterness with malts backbone. Great brew.

Bottle, thx Klimaet ;) Pours cristal clear golden with big frothy, slight off-white, head. Aroma is hops! Juicy ones. Tropical fruits, pineapple, some dank and malty backbone. Taste is more piny, tropical fruits, grassy, mango, peach. Malty sweetness to balance out the bitternes. Lively body and super dry and bitter finish. This one has to be drunk by the case to live up to its full potential. Very well balanced and no presence of alcohol. Did have a all fresh one, this is a avergage score.

Visual: Pours almost clear luminescent amber, very small dissipating head, a super thin layer of micro retention, zero activity.

Nose: fragrant orange-citrus-grapefruit hops, with oils (lvl-7)-pungency

Attack: creamy-silky mouthfeel, bursting flavourful hops, tangerine, crisp bite

Mid-palate: sharp compounding bitter hops, (lvl-4)-sweetness, (MAIN) grassy, caramel malt, biscuit

Finish: bitter orange peel exhale, resin, very subtle hop bitterness, lingering bitter hopped finish.

Summary: So smooth. Oh so smooth. Very easy-drinking for an 8%er. Bursting tangerine hops flavour is all I can say.
For all the hype I'm sorta underwhelmed. It's a little to bitter. I had it on tap at the brewery.
Nice floral fruity aroma. Hoppy but well balanced. Fairly bitter through the middle and finish. Malty backbone is very present. Not the hop monster I expected. Excellent.

510 ml, bottled 02/27/15, from a trade with Werckmeister. Thanks a lot Stefan for this major want! :-)
Bright, dark yellow, moderate hazy body, with a medium, creamy, white head.
Very fresh, fruity aroma of citrus, apricot, peach, pineapple, pine, biscuit, some candy, some vanilla.
Taste is as fresh and surprisingly smooth, with citrus, grapefruit, pine, apricot, peach, pineapple, some grass, biscuit, honey, vanilla.
Medium, creamy, velvety mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes smooth, bitter, quite zesty, a bit grassy, with lots of smooth malts again, some comfortable alcohol warmth and long-lasting, lovely pine notes.

Wow, amazing! Not a hop-forward, bitter monster, like many other DIPAs, but the most balanced beer you could imagine, what I always prefer. Incredibly drinkable for the ABV, with the lovliest, fruity and piney hops and a wonderful, smooth malt backbone. I completely understand the hype, this is close to perfection!

Bottle, about one month old. Served at approximately 40°F, warmed to about 42°F by hand. Head is off white and slightly creamy. Wish I could of had a less aged bottle. Malt profile is good but hoppy bib utter. I hate the ratebeer iPhone app. I cannot see what I am writing anymore. Thanks dicks. Fix your crappy interface. I like the beer. Beer good. Ass hats.

Brewed on 3/19/15; opened and consumed on 4/18/15. I must say for New Hampshire getting to try this within 30 days on the born on date is pretty good. Light orange almost honey in color with a pretty solid frothy head that dissipates to a bubbly cap on top. Streaks of lacing transform to spotty in nature all the way down the glass edges. The aroma of pine, resin, citrus, and floral hops is rather subdued with nothing too overpowering. Flavor profile for this Imperial IPA is quite delicious. The pine and resin start off the flavors with a very nice grapefruit taste finishing the profile. Solid bodied and only a slight bitterness on the back end of the palate with a nice creamy mouthfeel. Overall, Pliny the Elder really does live up to the hype and is an awesome example of an double imperial ipa.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2015 Poured into the obligatory ipa glass. Hazy goldenrod color with a frothy exactly white head. The aromas are pungent with tropical fruit, peach and apricot with some lemongrass and clean hops. Taste is complex. All kinds of flavors including the aforementioned fruits with some grassy notes and a nice malty sweetness. I wish I lived closer to RR...
Pint at RR. Huge pine aromas, lemon zest, grass. Very smooth on the palate, dry bitter finish. Super drinkable. Great beer despite the hype.
Bottle. This had a thick but enjoyable body that was pleasantly surprising. Each ship produced layers of fruity hoppy goodness. The balance is extremely well done.

Draft. Clear radiant deep golden. Creamy white head. Really clean moderate bitterness. Great balance. Smooth and supple. Bittersweet. An array of hops all in unison. Everything just flows together. Does not go down like a beer of its size. Elegant.

510ml bottle into tulip. Minneapolis. Bottled 4 weeks ago. 

Pours golden-orange in color. Slightly hazy. Beautiful white head. 

Aroma is just great. Tropical : mango, pineapple, citrus. A hint of apple. A hint of resin. 

Taste is very well balanced. Bitter, but not at all excessive. Sweetness to counter. 

Medium body. Mild carbonation. Soft texture. Long finish.
on tap at the brewery; light amber color; great citrusy hop aroma with pine notes; fantastic citrus hop flavor with pinenotes on a light malt base; very well balanced; an outstanding IPA
Some of the hipsters with which I work think this beer is overrated. I think it might be the single most delicious liquid Ive ever tasted. Fresh to death. FEEEEEEEEEED MEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE
One of best IPAs very big in fresh grass hops and resin pine. Flavor is equally as hoppy fresh hoppy, flavors of mango happiness and big fresh pine on finish.
Sharp bitterness at the start that rides out to a smooth finish. Strong grapefruit, pine and soft malts are especially well balanced. Incredibly drinkable. I dont want this to end.

Pours a beautiful pale orange. Aroma is strong hops with pine, orange, citrus and grapefruit. Taste is very bitter from beginning. Crisp followed by lingering grapefruit aftertaste. Truly an amazing beer!

Bottle. Pours a vibrant orangish amber with a thin layer of off white head. Taste is amazing, strongly bitter up front that fades into a nice citrus with some malts. Aroma of grapefruit, oranges, and hops.

From bottle in blind tasting. Clear light orange color with white frothy half finger head. Tons of grapefruit, mango, pineapple, Smooth creamy body. Nice bitter finish, slightly sweet, medium carbonation, long lasting grapefruit pith finish. Well balanced and very enjoyable.

This is definitely worth the experience. Great hop based beer with a smooth and delicious finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Im almost amused by a total score any less than a 4.5... what the hell were you all drinking?! I agree with jbuskirk, just send me more! Unreal drink-ability for a double IPA. Fantastic!
UPDATED: APR 7, 2015 On tap. Great crisp and hearty beverage. Light spice balanced hops. Something that bites with abv

What can I say about Pliny the Elder that hasnt been said by better thinkers and drinkers than me? Its freakishly balanced? Nope, someones sure to have said that. Its the perfect mix of spicy, fruity, grassy, piney, and citrusy hops? Nah, someones definitely mentioned that. Its delicious. Got me, again. Im at a loss on this one. I just want more. Someone give me more.

(Thanks Stefan "StefanSD")

Bottle.

A- Citrus, hoppy, cheese, floral, stone fruits.

A- Amber color, hazy liquid, white head.

T- Bitter, citrus, pine, balanced.

P- Medium body, average texture, medium carbonation, smooth balanced finish.

O- First off I have to give a huge thanks to Stefan for not only sending me this but sending me a fresh bottle. Had it only two weeks after bottling. I am also not an IPA fan so this made me nervous, thinking Im drinking one of the best beers in the world and I might not like it. Well, true to myself, I personally wouldnt rate this as one of the best in the world, but for an IPA, this was solid, and one I could drink, and not want it to be over. Very balanced and a very good representation of what I wish this style would be more like.

On tap at Pizza Port, OB. Fresh, resinous pine and grapefruit peel, with lemon and apricot accents. Clear gold under a lasting, pristine, lacy sheet. Flavour is extremely hoppy with tons of apricot and grapefruit pith and assertive bitterness is not over the top. Malt backbone is base malt with some carapils silkiness. Medium body, medium carbonation, midway between crisp and smooth.

caramel, nuts, toast, roasty, resin, floral, grass, spruce, citrus, herbs, barnyard, earthy, leaves, smoke, golden, cloudy, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish,

Pours light orange with a citrus and orange aroma. Big body of hops that finishes with a dry oaky flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

17oz bottle bottled on 2/4/15. Pours gold in color with very little foam. Hoppy nose with piney and resiny aromas. Hop forward palate with a good malt backing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from a very friendly guy. Hoppy smell with citrus and tropical fruits. In the background I find a malty aroma going towards cookies. Similar taste with a sweet cookie and caramel finish. Very easy to drink with a high "hinkability". No harshness at all. It feels like the hops are a bit aged even though the bottle was just over a month old. Still a great beer though. Nice to see a beer that lives up to the hype.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours light amber, nose is floral, orange, taste is bitter, fruity, but a bit flat having been opened a couple days.

(Russian River Pliny the Elder) Bottle 510 ml, from a trade with stawn, thanks! Served into a shaker, ABV 8%. 26 days old.
Bright golden orange colour on the body, clear. Good sized white head, thick enough with very good retention, leaving heavy lacing on the glass/
Great aroma with lots of citrus, pine, floral notes.grapefruit, some tropical fruits too.
Great taste, even better than the aroma I dare say. Lots of fresh hops, lots of pine, plenty of floral notes, still some citrus and grapefruit, , some fruity touches on the very finish. Not an extremely bitter one, instead one with a well balanced bitterness, and a long-lasting one.
Medium body, mildly dry on the palate. Nicely carbonated. Extremely high drinkability.
Great beer, words fail me.
Pliny the elder Pours a vibrant gold. Prickly fruity citrus hop nose. Wonderfully soft med-full body. Great hoppy biscuity taste with citrusy hops. It lives up to the hype.
Bottle. Light copper pour with a clean white head. Citrus, biscuit, seaweed, pine. Full body. Dont feel the alcohol. Few beer with umami finish along with slight bitterness. Really good
That's the best Californian IPA ... A lot of aroma hops. balanced between bitterness and maltness
UPDATED: MAY 24, 2015 This beer was my fav from California"..................................
On tap at Tiger! Tiger! San Diego. Nice earthy hops aroma. Light balanced bitterness. Nice hopy-grapefruit finish

6th Feb 2015 and I finally get my hands on a bottle of this beer. 3rd Belgian Beer Board website bottle exchange in De Bierboom, Brugge. The bar owner Rudy had been given two bottles of this and kept one for the exchange evening. He knew I wanted to try it, so early on in the evening he palmed me the bottle for drinking later. At midnight with only about six people left I broached the bottle and we all had a decent sized sample. 
Poured a golden amber with a weak white head. Aroma was citrusy hops and semi-sweet malts: mild tropical fruitiness hints also. The taste was more malty than the nose intimated with a biscuit like flavour, tempered with a fruity backbone. Expected a hoppier, bitter tasting brew to be honest, liked what I had though and the hops were always in the background waiting to pounce, even though they didnt.

This is my style of brew. This one was about a month and a half old. Still very sweet and tasty. Great looking brew as it pours a golden yellow with a wonderful white head. Good lacing. Enjoy the gem and get one fresh. The fresher the hops the better.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2016 Ive had this beer numerous times on tap & bottled, so Ive updated htis review quite a few times. Pours a golden color with a sticky white head. Aroma is mango, pineapple, grapefruit, pine, (maybe papaya?), bit of dankness. Absolute tropical fruit bomb. Flavor is tropical fruit, mango, pineapple, grapefruit, lots of biscuit and honey malts. An explosion of tropical fruits. Amazing that this beer is pretty much as good as they say. Not that bitter. Less hoppy version of Younger. Needless to say it?s Amazing. RR can do hoppy beers amazingly well. Its their forte. Although one of hte best things about this beer is that you can just walk into the brewery, any time, and stop by the to-go counter and get this. Its their flagship beer, and its always there. That to me makes it pretty awesome. Sure its tough if youre from literally anywhere but NorCal, but still, thats something special.

Beautiful color, great beginning notes, superbly balanced! Not the best, but definitely a good beer worth a try! I came across it by accident about a week ago at this place while talking about it to a friend. facebook.com/hoppysfoodmart apparently they just started selling it or something.

It is a complete beer, although I wasn't particularly impressed. I've certainly had better. Great beer, but I wouldn't put it in my top 50

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A nose of pine and fruit, a malt backbone enough to keep bitterness to a balanced minimum, and practically no alcohol, despite being 8.00% ABV. The flavor introduces some grapefruit and citrus notes, but what sets it all apart is its incredible balance.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2016 Bottle at home form, aligator thank you :). Clear golden/yellow body with a medium white head. Aroma and taste hops, fruity, grape with piney notes.. Hides alc very well. Best IIPA ive ever had! Good stuff.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2015 Bottle @ Pi bar, San Francisco - CA. Color: hazy golden beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: hoppy blast with high complexity. Grassy notes and fruity presence as pineapple and mango. Taste: as the smell, this is a hoppy blast. Hoppy exposition on mouth, oily sensation on tongue. Fruity and high grassy notes. Very expressive beer. Aftertaste: high bitterness and oily finish. Very amazing IPA, this is a hoppy explosion with a good choice of hops pot.
-----
On tap @ Toronado, San Francisco - CA. Color: clear golden beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: fruity and grassy domination. Notes of exotic fruits as mango and pineapple. Hoppy blast. Taste: hoppy blast and well balanced with the fruity taste. Pineapple and peach notes. Finish as mango. Really tasteful. Easy drinkable if you enjoy IPA. Aftertaste: fruity and wet bitterness with alcoholic finish.

Tap. Clear golden beer with a large white head. Aroma is fruity with notes of caramel, citrus, pine needles, tropical fruit and peaches. Flavor is fruity with notes of caramel, citrus peaches, pine needles and pineapple. Very smooth.

1 month old bottle thanks to Steffen!! Pours a crazy clear golden with a soapy, white, medium sized head. Aroma has fresh pineaplle and mango fruity hops, a medium malty sweetness, but is surprisingly weak overall, compared to my expectations at least. Taste is a nice blend of sweet and bitter hoppy. The same pineapple and mango fruity notes, that is a result of the balance between malty sweetness and fruity hops. Have to admit that im slightly disappointed though this is dangerously drinkable with very well hidden alcohol. Glad i finally tried this. Medium carb and medium body. Glad i finally tried this!
Great balance after all, hoppy presence, good bitternes but i expected much more flavour about a beer Like this. Maybe its not so fresh
Simply the best beer I ever had, just tasting this beer is making my next vacation going to Santa Monica and visit these people, They seem to know what they are doing.

Bottle, just over 1 month old. Delightfully hoppy and piney with a bitter kick, but not overpowering by any means. Oily mouthfeel. Nice lingering aftertaste. Not sure it lives up to the hype, but this is an excellent IPA regardless.

Ah the west coast IPAs. This is one of best if not the best. Hoppy oily hoppy pine and super pungent oily grass. How they do it. Although tons of hop aroma there is no young Cabernet type of young bitterness, just a great fresh hop flavor. Real important to me to achieve a perfect rating. Excellent.

Bottle, drinked when was one month old. 
Color is clear goldy orange. White frothy head, but settles quite fast. Aroma is very intense, piny and fruits like pomelo, grapefuit. Sweet malty, floral notes. Taste like hoppy bomb, lots of fresh, luscious white fruits. High level of bitterness, malty sweetness, very well balanced. Aftertaste is long resin/piny bitterness and noble alcohol note, Medium to full body, oily texture. Average carbonation. Superb beer, one of the best Ive ever try.

Appearance: Bottled on "100614", so presumably about 3.5 months old then. Orange golden, clear. Small bubbles. Some creamy white head.
Aroma: Hops and fruit.
Taste: Lots of hops, but not overpowering. Light fruits in there. Hides alcohol. Good, but not my favourite style.
Bought: Trade with Gregory - thanks!, 510 ml
Info: 23/1-2015
Very accessable for a heavy ipa like this, little alcohol kick. But still soft.

Thanks to my parents for bringing home a couple of these. Pours a clear, slightly carbonated golden with a big, frothy, full white head that settles very slowly. A potent aroma consists of plenty of pine and and grapefruit, along with grassy hops and resin. The taste is a bit drier with quite a bit of bitterness to it. Pine and grapefruit remain dominant. There are tropical hints of pineapple, orange, and apricot in here, along with some malty caramel. The aftertaste is a long resiny grapefruit. IPA in the world Medium to full in body, sticky in texture, and lots of carbonation in here. The alcohol content hides itself rather well. I also enjoy the fact that this one isnt sweet. Im not sure that I would proclaim this is the best beer in the world, its easy to call this an excellent IPA. Im very happy to have tried this.

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2015 12 oz bottle at home.  Just a perfect IPA. Hoppy, without being intrusive. But hoppy nonetheless. Not boosy. Crisp. Extra sharp. Delicious. Substantial grapefruit notes. Balanced. Superb finish. I wish I had more. MUST HAVE MORE!!!
user_location: West New York, New Jersey, USA

text:
Hops: Amarillo, Centennial, CTZ, and Simcoe.
07.18.14 bottle date.
Drank it freshy fresh on 07.23.14.

A: Red grapefruit and pine. Very hop forward.

A: 1/2 finger head that retains well. See through amber/gold body.

T: Grapefruit, pine, and hop resin dominate. 

P: Creamy and crisp. Lots of carbonation.

O: With all the hype that surrounds this beer, I expected angels to come down and deliver this directly into my mouth once the cap was popped. Instead, a much harried and disheveled RR employee put it on a table surrounded by a maximum capacity crowd of bratty hipster wannabes. To cut to the chase, the beer itself was disappointing. It was good, but it wasnt as earth-shattering as the hype claimed it to be. Granted, it is an older IIPA, but there are better IIPAs now.

[Bottle] Brilliant bright copper pour with about an inch of foamy white head. Big and fresh floral and citrus aromas. Grapefruit, biscuit, flowers, resin, black pepper and sharp bitterness in the flavor. Sticky mouthfeel. Well hidden alcohol. Fantastic balance. A very solid beer, and probably even better on tap I am guessing.
UPDATED: JAN 13, 2015 Botella de 50 cl, en tienda XXXII. Color dorado. Sabor a lupulo, citrico, ligeramente afrutado, resinoso.

Local 44, Philadelphia tap: pours orange with a white head. Aroma is a bunch of grapefruit and pine. Taste is moderately bitter. Very aromatic. Excellent balance. I was a tad underwhelmed given all the hype. Still very good.
smooth caramel malty backbone...grapefruit, apricot, resins, tropical fruit, grassy...leading to a very dry finish. Fine Dipa indeed.

Bottle pour split at home. Tried a couple times, about time I rate this. Much thanks to Tyler for sharing. Pours a cloudy yellowish color with an oily fizz head. Big pine and hops aroma. Initial bitter flavor but balances well with the sweetness. Ton of hops. Long lasting palate of cool pine, slight mint, and bitter hops. Overall a solid IPA, though its no secret. Wouldnt call it one of the very best, but this really is a special IPA, Good stuff.
UPDATED: JAN 4, 2015 Bottle pour at home, light golden pour with a white head. Taste and smell of pine, with a bite on the tough. Yet a very smooth beer. Very good stuff.
The simcoe hops and smooth drinkability for an 8% beer help make it one of my favorite beers. Incredibly bitter yet well balanced.

Draft at the brewpub..Pours clear gold with little head but great lacing. Aroma is citrusy hops, strong grapefruit, straw, grass. Taste is similar with a bitter finish, with a bit of black pepper. I drove an hour and a half from Hayward to try Pliny. Worth it? Yes. Some day I wont live in Utah where a real draft pint is forbidden.

Bottle aquired by Jirka and shared at Beergeek. Cheers. This was a special one poured nice and fresh. Clear Gold with a luscious White head. Aroma is overflowing with pine and citrus. Difficult to imagine a more intense distillation of hops than this. Tastes equally dramatic. Tropical fruit and pine. Even with this dense hoppiness, the bitterness is restrained and extremely palateable meaning I could actually drink these until the cows came home. If I could ever score enough bottles to make that a possibility. This is the finest IPA ive tasted. Hype matched.
Super flavorful mayhem punches you in the face right when you drink it. Worth the search. Aroma is truly unlike anything Ive ever smelled before.
Overheard a guy say, "Im kinda underwhelmed, I mean the best thing you can say about it is that its perfectly balanced". Lol. Fantastic IPA

Backlog rating. Colin Brings The Goods tasting at Kernel tap room, London. It pours an unclear light golden color with a large white soapy head. Aroma is intensely hoppy, fresh, crispy, and piny, with notes of grapefruit, dank, grass, citrus peel and resin. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter, not much in the way of booze. Notes of pine cones, toffee, citrus leaves, grapefruit peel, light dunk, bread, biscuit, orange zest. Finishes lightly bitter and dry, quite citrusy. Overall, delicious, even if Colin says its past its glorious absolute peak days. In any case, many thanks Colin for such great generosity, cheers!

520 ml Bottle. Tasted on 12/19/14. Bottle courtesy of Espo. Bottle date 11/12/14. Outstanding aroma from this one with great floral & citrus notes. The taste was balanced with tons of hop flavor without being overly bitter. A great beer overall.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Quintessential IPA. I've been waiting and waiting to get my palate around this beer, and the time has finally come. Pure delight from the first sip to the last.
Pours a nice deep gold color. Smells floral and hoppy. Tastes amazing! Tastes bitter and hoppy, but no over done on either end. Such a shame that we dont see this more than once a year!

This beer is all about freshness. From the many warnings on the label to the date of bottling printed on the bottle (purchased from the brewery) which was less than a week earlier. And the aroma and taste all speak about it. Thats what makes the brew special but other than that, I did not find it particularly outstanding. Still worth trying it.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2014 Nose of floral citrus. Taste is  grapefruit, citrus peel and pine balanced with subtle caramel and sweetness. Rich depth of flavor and mouth feel. Finishes wonderfully clean and dry. Impressive the way the flavors blend so coherently. Alcohol and hops well hidden in richness of flavors. Bitterness only at the finish. Uncommon and outstanding. Not an everyday brew.

Hard to find the words...Pliny is simply the best, the Platonic ideal of Imperial west coast IPA. A beautiful orange, with thin white head and continuous little streams of bubbles. Aroma is citrus, hops. Taste is powerful grapefruit and pine balanced with subtle caramel notes. Nice depth of flavor and mouthfeel; delightfully chewy. Finishes wonderfully clean and dry. Hard to analyze as the flavors merge so coherently here. Alcohol perceptible only in richness of flavors. Near perfect.

(Embouteillée le 1er septembre, bue le 1er décembre - Est-ce que 3 mois est trop vieux pour une Pliny? Lets see! Chose sûre, dès que jen ai une fraîche entre les mains, je révise mon évalutation) - Bière dorée, limpide, scintillante; elle mousse avec retenue. Le nez offre toujours de joyeux houblons, encore assez vivants (jirais même à écrire quils frétillent, mais jai peur quon me taxe dover-poétique). En bouche, les houblons sont relativement résineux et fruités. Je ne sens pas leur âge (évidemment, jécris avec aucun comparatif de fraîcheur). Le profil aromatique est excellent. Parfait? Non! Mais définitivement au-dessus de la moyenne supérieure. Nous avons affaire à une double IPA dexception qui mérite amplement sa réputation. Désormais, quon men serve une fraîche!
On draft. Aroma-free? (At least here.) Nice lacing. Flavors of grapefruit, orange, hazelnut (walnut?) and something bitter and chewy at the finish. Flavors come in waves. Still a classic.
On tap at Burgers and Brew in Sacramento, Ca. Terrific flavor, semi sweet to balance the bitter. Looks like gold poured in a glass!

Draft at Stone Liberty Station. Pours clear bright gold with a bubbly white head. Tastes like strong sweet orange citrus, caramel, sweet grapefruit, and very light pine and very light hop bitterness. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like sweet citrus candy, pine hops, and caramel.
On tap oro limpida agrumata agrumato fruttata secca bel amaro deciso resinosa lunga

On tap at Hamilton's in San Diego. Aroma is grapefruit and grass. Flavor follows and finishes super clean and crisp. Very nice beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle pour into tulip glass. Bottle dated 10/28/14. Head is made of small white bubbles, aroma is extremely hoppy with hint of citrus. Taste is quite smooth. Tastes exactly how an IPA should: crisp and fresh with lingering hoppy flavor. I was afraid that I may have kept this one in the fridge a little too long, but found no heavy signs of degradation. Top notch IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

GABF week, 2014; at Falling Rock. I was excited to finally try this beer; and on tap at that. Bitter hop aroma and flavor. Intense hops, giving some hop burn. Citrus and pine qualities, but also sweet malt making it heavier on the palate than the Blind Pig I had a few minutes previously. Very likely the worlds best Double IPA.

Flaska från bottlerock. Gyllengul kulör med fint vitt skum. Stor härlig doft av färsk humle och tropiska frukter. Kompakt nästan parfymig. Smak av passionsfrukt, ananas, gräs. Avlutas med en rejäl beska.
Flaska på BottleRock. Ljust gul med lite vitt skum. Doft av tropiska frukter med mango i topp. Liknande smak med finfin efterbeska.

Bottle thanks to Ignace & co @ De Hopduvel! Pours a golden yellow with a white head. Aroma is piney hops. Taste is a sweet tropical fruits at first then followed by resinous hops and weak tropical fruits. This beer is unbalanced in favour of hops and that is distinctly noticeable. Great beer!

pours gold with white head. Strong, earthy hops on the nose. Complex green hop, earth, and candied citrus flavors. A big malt presence keeps the fresh hop flavors from being overwhelming. Exceptionally good.
On tap. Pours gold with light head. Beautiful aromas of tropical fruit, grapefruit, light pine, peach and light malts. Flavors of bitter orange, pine, other light fruits. Very long bitter finish.

50 cl bottle Pours beautiful clear golden beer with a small with head. Aroma of pine and tropical fruits. The malt profile is very discreet allowing the hop flavours and aromas to come forward. Very balanced and complex with medium carbonation. Very high drinkability. Love this!

I was able to try this from a tap in South Philadelphia. Aroma was not as fragrant as I had anticipated, very decent but rather hyped, imo. Great appearance, nice lacing, taste was not as strong as I had anticipated. Overall, Im glad that I was able to try this in pint form, but had raised expectations from hype Ive heard and read.

Bottle from a friend who returned from the brewery. Bottled 10-21-14. Pours a clear copper color with off white head. Head lingers nicely in the glass. Aroma is a huge hop bouquet, with tropical fruit notes hints of pine. Earthy, fresh. Taste is nice grapefruit peel, tropical fruits and a bit of pine resin. Malts balance it out, but the hops are definitely the feature here. A clean, solid bitterness throughout. Palate is medium body, medium carbonation. Juicy, not dry. Alcohol is not really detectable. Overall, a great beer. Lived up to the hype for me.

What a stroke of luck to get some Pliny, without being a trader. Ive heard about it from a good friend (who never brought any back) and Ron has heard about it too. He is a good friend that DID bring some back. Big nose of tropical fruits and a bit of grapefruit. Clear medium yellow, with nice small bubble (2.5/5). Palate is most excellent. Velvelty, lots of hops body, but very balanced and perfect, does not overwhelm. Start clear, taste a bit of the fruit. Very very drinkable. IIPA number 100 by stroke of luck. Thanks again Ron!

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2015 Vom Fass in der Brauerei, relativ hell im Glas, wenig schaum, süßlich hopfig in der Nase, frisch im Antrunk, wunderbare fruchtige hopfenaromen mit wunderbar ausbalancierter bittere. Sehr schönes Bier

From a trade with leftyhyzer. (Thanks!) Poured from a 2 week old bomber into a tulip. Clear gold with a nice white head. Aroma is floral hops, with a bit of citrus. The taste reverses those a bit, with the citrus (especially grapefruit) more dominant than the floral. Very light and effervescent, especially for a double. Not boozy at all. Very, very good, although I dont think it quite lives up to the reputation (but given the reputation, that may be impossible). Definitely worth having, and if you live in a place where you can get it easily, would easily be a staple in my refrigerator. But its not worth giving a bunch away in a trade to get.

500 mL bottle. Pours pale orange with a small but persistent white head. Smells fantastic, with pineapple, resin, lemon and fresh straw. Tastes fantastic. Complex. All of the hop flavours, along with booze. Nice bitterness. Light for a double. Very drinkable. Outstanding.

On tap at the Brewpub and later a whole bottle. I had this 1st of the 15 beer sampler tray even thou they had it marked for last. I just could not wait. Pours light hazy golden/amber color with white head. Aroma is juicy fruity citrus, tropical fruit and resiny pine. Light syrupy mouthfeel. Flavor starts off citrus followed by pineapple and mango flavor and finishing with grapefruit and resiny pine bitterness. High expectation for this brew and it delivered.
Reputation for a reason, not much to say that hasn't. Opens bitter and finishes a bit more balanced. Very solid, even at 2 weeks old

Bottle from Full Throttle Bottles in 2012. Slightly cloudy, pale on pour. Modest amount of head, with small bubbles, white colored. Clear, pale gold, medium, creamy, white head. Strong floral and hops notes, with grapefruit and other citrus as well. Taste is an exemplary balance of sweetness with a long bitter finish but not overpowering. Really top notch balance. Medium body, alcohol tones, long, long finish, medium carbonation. Fantastic DIPA - the standard bearer.
Poured from odd sized bottle...bomber anyway...huge hop oily hop aroma...perfect...the flavor is equally as oily...I loved this style of oily hoppy lupins. perfection

Aroma: floral hops, tropical and citrus fruits. Appearance: clear, pale gold, medium, creamy, white head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: light bitters continue, grassy hops, some flowers again, getting slightly dry in the finish. Overall: fantastic IIPA, light, yet very subtle complexity in both aroma and palate. Bottle from Pizza Port Bottle Shop, Carlsbad.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2016 500ml bottle poured in a pint glass.
A: Pours a slightly cloudy orange color forming a big and creamy white to beige head with good retention that leaves some lingering lacings in the glass. 
S: Great nose: Incredibly grassy-earthy-herby-flowery hops. Never ever felt such a fresh perfume of citrus and flowery hops in a beer. Grapefruit and pine. Strong caramel malts backbone. Really unique. 
T: Taste is just perfect. Very refreshing and easydrinking considering the 8% ABV. Strong and persistent (but not aggressive) bitterness. Great bittersweet balance. 
M: Full body. Medium carbonation. Persistent grapefruit and pine in the aftertaste.
O: Extremely drinkable and refreshing beer. Very bitter but, at the same time, smooth and pleasant. Perfect IIPA. 
[ BA Review @ 12/15/2010 ]

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2016 On tap, poured into a snifter. Warm aromas of pine, citrus, and caramel come through. It pours an oily, clear, buttery yellow with a micro bubble white head. It leaves behind an ample web lace and a medium ring with a ight dusty surface. The taste is a mellow, medium bitter and medium sweet balance. The beers texture is oily and a bit sticky with a medium body and decent, buzzy carbonation. Grapefruit and pine finish the beer with a touch of caramel. Its clean and refreshing with notes of pine and bread crust in the slightly burnt aftertaste.
Very fresh, hoppy nose out of the keg. This beer is about the hops, with the bitter being the predominant flavor. Maybe could have used more malts to balance it better, but a great hop-head beer.

Hipster Mercedes Benz. Usually over rated, but still one if the best cars and brews. Oily hoppy lupin madness. Great bubblie great roundabout throughout the whole Bronson. Will kick you in the rear if you pound these. Usually pretty available, but got to know the shops. Dont see it on tap.

Clear dark gold with a medium white head that leaves lots of lacing. Strong floral, herbal, grapefruit, and resinous pine in the aroma. Very light body has some sweetness upfront, with some moderate hop flavor leading to a crisp, bitter finish. Flavor lingers with the bitterness for a while.
Shared bottle to tasting glass. 4 months of age on it. Lots of malt sweetness to balance out the hops. Finishes bitter but not too long lasting.
Poured at GABF. Perfect IPA, all theoils aromas and flavors are overwhemingly awesome. I love the grass and citrus. Finished dry and delicious.

Poured from a 500ml bottle dated 09/30/2014. Aroma is nice and hop forward with a nice, light cracker malt profile. Hop aroma has a lot of citrus Noyes, especially grapefruit and some light pine resin. Medium strong tropical and stone fruit notes and light hints of alcohol. Pours a fairly clear golden orange with a fairly large, moderately thick, slightly off white head that exhibits nice retention. Moderately high lacing and medium small legs. Flavor has a light sweetness with some cracker and biscuit notes. Moderately high hop bitterness with a light alcohol note in the finish. Moderately high hop flavor with grapefruit and orange with dome lighter pine and hop resin notes. Medium tropical and stone fruit, especially peach and mango. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. Overall, one of the best DIPAs on the market. Well balanced hop character with a nice fruity character and balanced bitterness and resin. Nice malt notes and alcohol presence as well.

I just can't say enough about this craft. This experience got me to actually brew and every single year I make it a point to fly from the Philippines to the US to have my fix. Its my benchmark IPA. A true 'Magnum Opus' ! Bravo!

Aroma: hay, citrus, spruce, woody
Color: orange, amber, clear
Head: minimal head, white foam
Taste: WOW, light sweetness, very bitter, citrusy and piny. Its delicious!
Mouthfeel: Full, creamy, fizzy, bitter long
Bottle. Clear gold with a thin white head. Aroma is tropical fruit, citrus and resin. Taste follows. Light crisp mouthfeel and quick finish. Very excellent.
The perfect DIPA? Bitter and sweet perfectly combined. Pearls in your mouth. Rich but never lazy. Just delicious.

Draft at RRBC. Clear deep gold, fading white head. Huge sweet citrus and tropical aroma with green dank underripe fruit notes, some rich toffee beneath. Tastes of sweet caramel and toffee fudge then plenty of juicy orange hop flavour, bitterness, green dankness. This beer is not a punch in the face, its a green hop hug. Too drinkable.
Fantastic IPA..grass cirus and excellent hoppy aroma. Falvor is awesome malt and predominate hop flavor. Excllent.

Excelente imperial stout americana. Bem difícil conseguir essa. Cor dourada, com média formação de espuma branca. Aroma matador de lupulo fresco, pinho, resinoso. Na boca, corpo médio, com amargor refrescante, com lúpulos cítricos se sobressaindo no amargor e sabor. Dulçor na medida certo. Pinho, grapefruit, maracujá, tudo junto numa fantástica explosão de lupulo. Final seco, amargor durável e agradável. Álcool muro bem inserido para uma DIPA. Excelente breja, a melhor DIPA que já tomei!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

on tap. Orange foamy pour. Aroma heavy peaches and pine. Tastes the same - good representation of the hops. Good clean resinous finish. Nothing out of the ordinary - just a solid double ipa. way overrated.
Huge hop flavor and bitterness, but not tongue scorching. 8 percent is complete deception. One of if not the most drinkable double ipa Ive ever had. Awesome brew.

Enfin gouté, merci Julien! Une excellente Double IPA qui existe depuis lontemps et a été très influente, tellement que javais limpression dy avoir déjà gouté! Parfaite balance etre caramel et houblon, pas très agrume, un peu de pin, bel équilibre.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2015 Blind tasting, of Double IPAs & Single IPAs. 

List of Double IPAs, in prefered order: The Crusher, Heady Topper, Pliny The Elder, Deviant Dales 

List of Single IPAs, in prefered order: Focal Banger, Grapefruit Sculpin, Mralité/Blind Pig 

A  Very distinctly clear, a bit more toward orange, weaker head compared to the others.

S  Straight forward grapefruit, quite dry, some alcohol to it, very classical west coast.

T  Taste is a bit thin compared to aroma, doesnt live up to it... This one is very balanced and no distinct bitterness, it delivers a decent hop kick with floral grapefruit and citrus. 

M  Quite thin, very sessionable, and refreshing.

O  Total of four people, 3 rated this one as third out of 4, one shared last, the hop intensity is A LOT lower, and its more balance focused.
A piney Double IPA that is sure to not disappoint. Do not age this beer!
Delicious IPA the quintessential classic, one of my favorites. Upon opening Pliny bursts with smells of fresh tropical fruit.

From the bottle marked 071614 so it was about a month old when I tried it. Received in trade from a non-RB member. Pale yellow-amber pour with a big lingering head,. Carbonation bubbles. Lots of floral and piney hops on the nose and a malt grabber to balance. Full body. Loads of hop bitterness in the taste. What more can I say that no one else hasnt?

Bottle 1 pint, huge thanks to my beer buddys Alberto for sharing, Matt for organising and Gene for bringing it to Belgrade.Tasted at Belgrade tasting Vol.3.Pour it golden colour a little bit cloudy.On the nose very floral hops.Perfection.Taste of pine, grapefruit, hops and tropical fruits.Great thank you guys so much.
Exquisite balance of a hoppy IPA and a sweeter maltier brew. Definitely all kinds of complexity and a fairly aromatic experience.

Transfer from BA review on 6-27-13-

 Poured from bottle into a pint glass

 Appearance  Pours a clear golden color with a two finger nearly pure white head. The head has a fair level of retention, slowly fading over time to leave a very nice level of streaky lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell  The aroma is heavy of a citrus aroma being both sweet and hoppy at the same time. The sweet citrus is of tangerine and orange while the hoppy is of grapefruit. Mixed with these smells is a bready aroma as well as a bit of caramel and some pine hop smells. Overall the aroma is citrusy, but yet still maintains a nice balance.

 Taste  The taste begins with a smooth bready and sweeter taste with the sweetness being of a caramel, tropical and citrus fruit flavors of orange and tangerine. With these flavors so too comes some grapefruit hop upfront, which starts out at a moderate strength and grows stronger to the end. Along with the grapefruit increasing some pine hop flavors also come to the tongue while the caramel flavors, that were initially present begin fading. In the end with the hop increasing and the sweet decreasing a nice crisp and mainly citrusy hop flavor to be left to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the thicker and creamier side with a nice smoothness throughout. The carbonation is on the slightly lower side which when combined with the creamier body of the brew and the nice balanced sweet and hoppy taste overall create a very easy drinking feel. 

 Overall  A very tasty IPA no doubt, but not as amazing and overshadowing of other IPA of its strength and class as many make it seem, which is likely driven by limited availability/distribution. It is certainly well worth a try though if you get a chance.

Bottle in Belgrade with huge huge thanks to luttonm and travlr. Pours orange/golden clear with a white foam which leaves a fantastic lacing and draft. 3 months old bottles: nose of pine resiny, pineapple and grapefruit skin. Simply amazing. Mouth: citrus peel, orange, balanced bitterness, dry feel cleaning the mouth from bitterness. Simply great!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

510ml bottle into an IPA glass. Lovely citrus hop aroma with slight pine resiny notes and a hint of tropical fruit. Pours golden amber colored with a thick soapy white head and very little lacing. Smooth, slick mouthfeel with a good amount of malt and excellent citrus and tropical fruit flavor to start. Finishes dry with a bit of pine resiny hop flavor with just a hint of bitterness. Refreshing, flavor ipa with excellent balance and without the harsh bitter bite. Fantastic ipa!

Stor takk til Asle Bjørn for denne! Aller siste flaske (bottled 07.08.14) på RBHD-samlinga på Mosterøy: klar gylden med medium skum. Et mesterverk i smaksrikdom og friskhet i yndefull balanse. En aroma man bare kan drømme om. En syntese av alt som er godt innen stilen, og med en intens renhet og klarhet. Ganglag for sjelen, et fyrtårn å navigere etter.
On tap at toronado, san francisco. Hoppy without going to excess,  moderately bitter finish. well balanced.  Nice double IPA.

Thank you to my friend dsandanto for getting this one for me. Pours light hazy golden/amber color with white head. Aroma is juicy fruity citrus, tropical fruit and resiny pine. Thick light syrupy mouthfeel. Flavor starts off citrus followed by pineapple and mango flavor and finishing with grapefruit peel and resiny pine bitterness. High expecttion for this brew and it delivered.

Golden with thin lacy head. Sweet tropical fruit and some piney hops in the aroma. Taste is tropical- mango, citrus, pineapple. Malty but not sweet. Bitter but not biting. Finish is warming bitter with citrus and malt linger.  Thanks Dan for sharing!
An odd, French cheese stink on the nose. Very pungent. Harsh bite and flavor. No idea why it's so popular. A particularly bland hop hit of an IPA.
Bottle - Pours golden w/ white head. A nice hoppy and piney nose. The taste is well balanced between the hops and malts with nice citrus notes. Overall, its solid!!!

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2016 The archetypical double IPA, the follow-up to Blind Pigs version which is still kept alive by Russian River as a tribute to Vinnie Cilurzo, the man who started this young beer style at the end of the previous millennium.  Tasted this almost ten years ago when my palate wasnt as experienced as it is now so I was looking forward to re-rate a fresh bottle, generously shared by Jan yesterday.  Lightly lacing, moussy, off-white, stable head over a clear, warm old gold coloured beer with orangey hue and vivid sparkling - remaining clear even with the last drop added, so apparently this has been filtered, contrary to e.g. Heady Topper, that other DIPA superstar.  Aroma of green tea and even green tea-coloured noodles, yellow grapefruit, toasted onion, green olive, dry cookies, marihuana, unripe mango, green banana peel, pineapple, biscuit, bitter orange - in all: dank alright, but fairly restrained in comparison with many younger DIPAs.  Clean malty fruitiness in the onset, hints of unripe green kiwi, raw pineapple, green banana and a hint of yellow passion fruit with a slight green olive-like umami touch; softish carbo, supple and resinous yet full mouthfeel.  Lightly biscuity malt base with a subtle nutty edge is mixed beautifully with a long, resinous, spicy hop bitter finish yielding lovely grapefruit, pine, pepper and toasted onion aromas retronasally.  Long lasting bitterness as is to be expected from the style, but nothing too harsh.  This is a DIPA which excels in elegance and restraint - yet at the same time remains very generous.  I like a fresh Heady Topper even more if a comparison must be made, but this is surely a top notch example made with utmost care and passion.  Incontournable, as the French say.

Bottled 07.08.14. Clear golden. White head and lacing. Wonderfully inviting aroma of citrus and tropical fruits, with malt sweetness and citrus bitterness well in harmony. Similarly fine taste and aftertaste. Very refrishing with a superb drinkablility.

Pours a beautiful crystal clear golden orange with a nice big off-white head. It sort of sparkles in the glass. Aroma is pine/citrus hops and just the perfect amount of malt. Taste is absolutely incredible. Most IPAs and DIPAs dont quite get that balance right. Most have that little bit of astringent bitterness that makes you pucker a little. Pliny nails it. This is not a "hop bomb". It is an exquisitely crafted, perfectly balanced DIPA. Pliny compels you to keep drinking it. The mouthfeel is medium, not too thin, not too thick. The finish is outstanding. It is INSANELY, deceivingly drinkable. A lot of people claim that this beer is overhyped, but to me, this is the gold standard by which all DIPAs should be measured. Ive had it twice, and both times I finished the beer in about 10 minutes. It literally made my mouth water and I couldnt stop myself from taking sip after sip.

On tap at Parry's. A very special beer, indeed! Pours dark gold with a creamy white head. Good lacing. Smells of pine resin and citrus and hops. Great mouthfeel and carbonation. Tastes big a hoppy. In fact the hops are so complex that one can taste all three varieties if you try. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap @ Russian River. Golden color, white head. Big hop-aroma coming from the glass. Citrus, pine, some pineapple maybe. Overwhelming but not annoying. Crisp mouthfeel, medium dry, and that fruity hopflavour that makes you order another one. Second best IPA for me, i guess, behind the Heady Topper. I wonder how Pliny the younger would taste ....

Bottle. Nice caramel popcorn, toast, floral hops that is well balanced and not overwhelming. Light bitter taste with a hint of malty sweetness. Clean finish and light lingering bitterness that builds. This is a great beer consistently but is very delicate. With the privilege of drinking this beer through the years I have been able to try it as fresh at it gets at Russian River and skunked. Makes my summer better every year.

I waited a long time to try this on draft. Special road trip from San Fran on 16 Aug, 2014. Had on draft at Russian River. Toasted with my buddy AJax. Perfect aroma of floral hops, grapefruit, orange and lime pith. The flavor is just as strong and bright as the aroma. 
This brew does have a subtle amount of pale malts but this is secondary to the array of hops. Grapefruit peel, light grass effects, with the floral hitting near the back side. Of course it is not just floral in the finish, lots of pine there as well to round off the myriad of hop flavors. I feel no reason to ramble and write a huge ass rating, this is wonderful and a trip into flavor town. Glad I held off from trading for a bottle and sampled it from the source.

On draught at 2014 saraveza iipa fest - pours clear golden with medium head. Nose is of pine. Hop, pine. Taste is of pure hop and sweet malt. Nice and oily hop finish.

There is nothing left to be said. This is obviously one of the best beers available and is certainly the best beer I have ever had. The perfect balance of malty and hoppy.
Awesome beer and one well worth the hype surrounding it. Everything you expect out of an IPA and more, whatever you heard about it is true

the beer of all beers. stop all this overrated name calling and go grab one.

Sample @ Quintessence 2014. Ambrée IPA très savoureuse. Nez citronné résineux léger froment, orge moyen très houblonné. Corps fort complexe à la fois biscuité, panifié voire légèrement rôti. Saveurs caramélisées dune ambrée acidulé développant des arômes de grains avec un léger mieleux. Bel équilibre entre la forte amertume et le maltage complexe. Wouaw Trop bon!
I had a chance to try this very hard to find beer, here on the east coast, a few weeks back. Wow, talk about a hop explosion. O me o my.
Pour from a bottle is a nice clear gold with a white head. Aroma is a soft floral. The taste is nice smooth grapefruit.

Pours clear gold with white head. Aroma is amazing citrus and floral notes. Probably the best IPA I have ever had. I didnt expect this to live up to the hype but it totally did. floral, citrus, very little pine. This is it. amazing.
Øl fra flaske. Rigtig dejlig duft. God, men lidt tynd smag med blomster artige toner.

Draft, Cafe Citti and Russian River. Copper in the glass, light head. Incredibly hoppy aroma, citrus, floral, and resin, with a little caramel from the malt. Taste follows the nose, with resiny citrus hop flavors, but here they are balanced by the malt on a medium body. Ideal carbonation, and a clean bitter finish. To me, the standard for the style. A perfectly balanced DIPA.

On tap at UoB Sacramento. Beautiful light honey color with light thin beige head. aroma of pine, lemon, tangelo and dankness. Flavor is crisp and clean and delicious. Beautiful balance of bitterness and fresh hop flavor. Glad I sought this out.

Fad og flaske: Drukket tre gange som pint, taster og flaske: Orange klar øl med flot skumhoved. Let kattepis i duften. Lidt for gammeldags med for megen bitterhumle i forhold til moderne IPA: Men når det er sagt er det klart hvorfor den er så højt ratet. Superlækker frisk. Dejlig øl.

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2015 I started this glass with a light gold liquid, half a finger of soft white head and an explosion of fragrance from the bottle. The hops-permeated aroma is fantastic; smooth and piney, and I find myself enjoying the citrus in the form of orange rather than grapefruit. Sweet, but not cloying, bitter, but not overwhelming. The malt/hops balance is amazing here, and I understand now why I have been searching for this for so long.
The palate is also very nice; dynamic and almost sticky, without the stickiness. A medium body, a smoothness, and a lasting consistency.

On tap at the RR Brewpub.

A: golden amber; excellent clarity. Godd white head leaves a little bit of sticky lacing. 

Aroma: mild for style -- like an IPA or even an APA; great sweet hoppy smell. Some light malts evident.

Flavor: some light malts and a excellent mix of hops. Excellent lingering aftertaste. Clean. 

Feel:; smooth; light body and light for style; good near medium carbonation. 

O: excellent; wonderful hop load.

I was skeptical - I was wrong. Pretty much the perfect DIPA, in that no one thing stood out: total balance. Nice deep amber color with a short thick head. Wonderful syrupy mouthfeel. Balance and restraint in the the aroma and taste. I caused the only problem - I was passing through Santa Rosa and only had time for one, and they had sold out of 22s. Legendary.
Great beer, love the ethos of Russian River, just wish it was in stock more of the year.

Nice light orange color with a one finger head. Aroma is tropical fruits, citrus and slight pine. Taste is well balanced between citrus, bitter and sweet. A great IPA.

Bottle from my friend from his vacation in USA. Smell is very hoppy and grassy. Pours clear orange with a medium white head. Very nice taste. Very hoppy and very sweet. The high ABV is not noticeable and the beer places itself nicely in mouth. Overall a really nice beer which lives up to the hype and its myth.

From bottle. First time Ive actually every got to try it. Found it (from back) at local grocery store. Wanted to know if it would live up to all the hype - of course it couldnt. Great beer, nice hoppiness, but mellow finish. Dont know that its worth over $5 per pt. in a bottle, but its a definite top 10 for me.
On tap. Deep yellow cloudy pour with a nice thin lacy head. Aroma of vanilla, both citrus and faint piney hops. Extremely drinkable despite the high ABV. Earns its reputation.
Overrated. Green Flash West Coast IPA and especially Maharja are way better than this. Too much hype, not that good.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2015 Have had many times in bottle only. Great color on pour - a golden orange sunset. It's a great double IPA with a thunderous amount of hops. However, it's an overrated IPA. Nice hop profile - citrus and pine. Not enough head (carbonation). Great lacing on the glass. Light malt body that disguises the alcohol well.
Draught & bottle at Russian River. Deservedly ranked as one of the best, nice piney aroma, really drinkable for the ABV. Top class stuff.

Draught > Russian River. God damn this is good. It's not La Cumbre Dank but it's f'ing good. Right up there next to Maine Lunch. Dry as hell and light. Pretty darn easy drinker.

Found it on tap when out with a good friend from out of town. It was nice to share the experience of drinking one of the best beers in the world - it lived up to the hype

This Imperial IPA is excellent. Excellent citrus aroma. Dry finish and and incredible drinkability. In my first time, I drank This Beer at Russian River Brew Pub and it was a unique e experience. Fresh hops and a perfect blend.

Draft in Philly at Monk's Cafe. Yellow gold. Big bitter Grapefruit and pine note up front with just a slight malt character to balance the hops. The overall taste is that of a hoppy big dipa but, the standout factor is the dry finish and incredible drinkability. Super smooth for this style. This is a perfect dipa all around!

Just perfect.... not in your face flavor like must triple ipa nor lack in taste like a single ipa, but just right... Simply well balance. It has the perfect punch of bitterness, sweetness, hoppiness, and citrus. Great piny hint also...just refreshing...
had on tap at brewery. this beer was everything you here about and more. a great inviting hop nose. a smooth and balanced taste.hard to believe this is a dipa. easily on my top 5 of beers

Light orangish almost strong tea like color. Hops smell is strong. I ventured to San Francisco to get this on tap to do it right. Tastes extremely hoppy but finishes smooth. I believe this is where the magic is with a hyper hopped but balanced beer.
