It had a light pineapple and a light pine. Pale malt and lightly breaddy. Hop resins even on the nose. Hop floral and a sweet honey with the malt. There was no alcohol on the nose but there was a nice deep round hop scent. 

Taste was silky and smooth. The malt is soft but firm and very well done. it had a lightness to the body and a sweet bread that never took center stage away from the tremendous hop qualities. Fruits were fleeting on the palate. The pineapple gave way to tart grapefruit, then a little apple and pear showed up to add crispness and a touch of sweetness. Right in the middle it became bone dry and chalky. It had the taste of astringency or of an aspirin you chewed by mistake. Bitter hops flourished and this was delightful. They had a tiny bit of oil to deposit them along the palate and reside finally at the back. Light pine and a touch of malt. The resins are also light and they do their job keeping all those flavors lingering for a nice full aftertaste of a substantial bitter and the sweetness of the fruits. There was an alcohol warmth at the back of the throat but nothing hard from it on the palate. 

This beer was great but in my opinion it did not live up to all the hype. It was rousing with a well done bitter, it had a malt that was one of the best I have seen but it lacked definition in the fruits. It couldnt have been prettier to look at. Not the best I have ever had but I am glad I tried it and would drink it again but I wont kill myself trying to get more. It was stronger then you might expect and I liked that. Was perfectly fresh as this was bottled on 8/16/13.

I work in the industry where I have peeps asking me for Pliny all day, every day. I drink a fresh one every month, with that being said I have not let the "hype" ruin this amazing IIPA for me. It varies every month, but one thing that stays the same is the fruity dry finish. Pliny is an incredible elixir, well balanced and different from most IPAs.
Bottle @ Man in the Moon. Amazingly well balanced, not so hoppy but the balance between the bitterness, the sweetness and the fruity aromas is just brilliant. Well done!

On tap at falling rock on a nice Sunday evening. A nice amber color, completely clear and effervescent. Excellent lacing and head retention. Aroma is clean and pleasant, but not very big. Medium to heavier in body, surprisingly. Taste is excellent. All the pine and bitterness I love in an ipa, but really balanced. Love this beer

Golden when poured! Smells like a true hopped up IPA and taste is phenomenal! The only reason I didnt give this a superior rating is due to the fact that I have to be in the mood for a really strong (imperial) IPA when selecting this beer. Great thirst quencher and a treat to sip!

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2015 Super overrated.  If you want a similar, oniony, dank, cat pissy IPA, just get Hop Stoopid from Lagunitas.  Same aroma profile, same flavor profile, similar ABV, similar IBUs.  We did several blind taste tests, and no one could measurably tell the difference.

Unbelievably smooth. Its easy to see how this has gained its popularity. Super clear and crisp. If I were to give one criticism, (I know, the nerve!), I would just wish it were a tad hoppier. I finally found it on my California trip after about 2.5 weeks, coincidentally at stone brewery liberty station. All hail stone (and the all elusive Russian river).
Bottle. Awesome hop aroma. The taste has some strong citrus. Not too much bitterness. A very mild astringency in the aftertaste. Lacking in complexity. Excellent overall.
best IPA ive had, incredibly smooth and high in alcohol, it lived up to all the hype

Trade from Shrubber85, thank you good sir! Amber pour with a white head. Aromas of citrus and floral hops with the malt being noticeable as well. Flavor is big hop presence at first but then a super smooth finish. Notes of citrus peel after the beer leaves your mouth. Incredibly well-balanced. Few beers can truly live up to the hype but this one delivers in every way. The best DIPA I have had to date by far. A true work of art.

It's hard to live up to the hype but Pliny delivers. After being a stowaway on a flight from CA to GA I got to enjoy one of the Holy Grails of the East coast. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2014 Bottle, massive thanks to Mike, the best trading partner in the world ;) Pours golden with white head. aroma of pine, citrus, resinous. Similar taste, very resinous, pine and grapefruit, some honey. Oily texture with a bitter finish. Tasty 8.4.8.4.17 = 4.1  Bottle thanks to Paul for sharing. Clear pale golden with white head. Massive aroma of resinous pine, citrus, peach, orange. Taste follows suit, a pure hop explosion, pine and tropical fruit. Nicely bitter. Much better experience and this bottle was a week older than the other one when consumed. 9.4.9.4.18

Poured a cloudy yellow/light golden color with a nice and thick white head. Aroma is of grapefruit, citrus, and floral notes. Flavor is of big time fresh hops with some copious caramel malt. Nice citrus quench with a satisfying and lasting bitter taste that is thick and chewy. One of the most balanced DIPAs Ive ever had. Theres definitely quality coming out of this brewery.

Pours clear orange with a small light beige head. Smells strongly of tropical fruit and light citrus. Taste very fruity with some smooth, silky bitterness. Medium-bodied with a smooth texture and soft mouth-carbonation, Russian River Pliny the Elder finishes with a mild fruity lingering bitterness.
Poured from a bottle it is a clear golden color with a large head. It has a citrus aroma and the taste is very sweet and citrus. That lingers on the table

A - Not quite the hop-bomb I was expecting. Complex citrus, not a huge amount of pine but there. Balanced

A - Clear and amber, what can you expect?

T - Brillantly balanced and dry, a huge long delay before the bitterness comes in. Not overwhelming. A beer to be savoured but one that wants to be drunk

Palate - Lingers exceptionally - never had an IPA that has such a long finish.

O - Just brilliant. So well balanced. Only thing to do would be to make it more punchy.

Clear...brassy gold with a tall white head....
Orange/grapefruit peel aroma....flowery...
Flavour is crisp citrus, orange/grapefruit, lime....
Wonderfully balanced sweet vs. bittering...incredibly smooth and bright....
Superb...about as good as it gets.

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2014 Bottle, from 071113, finally, thanks to mverity! Pours a clear golden orange with thin cap of off-white head that leaves light lacing. Aroma is resinous west coast hops, piney and citrus, nice caramel pale malt back. Taste follows with a bitter finish and no hint of the alcohol. Very nice, amazing balance, but not as good as I was hoping...maybe I?m spoiled by awesome IPAs.

Draught. Finally got to taste this amazing beer. Aromas of pine, hops, some soapy grapefruit. Molasses-brown with fine lacing and thin head. The palate was incredibly clean and perfectly balanced and carbonated. Finished like a dream. 
Flavours of clean deep hops, resin, malt, toffee, grapefruit. Great, but much hoppier than I expected. Flavours were all first class, but the standout was its polish. Perhaps because of its fame I came to it expecting it to pack a punch, but was retrained rather than refined. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured a light see through amber copper color with a nice white head. Grapefruit, pine, citrus dominate smell and taste. Perfect carbonation and a medium to light mouthful.

Boiler up!

Pours golden orange with a beige head and sweet aroma of hops and citrus. Taste is bitter sweet, lots of citrus, pine, hops, and grapefruit hit the palate leading to a clean, dry, bitter, citrusy finish. Excellent DIPA, great flavor and drinkability

Ordered from San Diego, California. Pours a deep orange color with a small head. Nose is absolute sweet citrus, and alarmingly pleasant. Taste is citrus, bitter sweet and Pliney is piney. Finish is dry, sweet and smooth. A wonderful DIPA. Quaff Score 9 / 10
Pours gold with a good head. Nice floral, earthy hop aromas. Very well balanced with a bit of sweetness. Ends with muted resin flavors -- just enough.
Smells hoppy, tastes sweet, builds bitter on the palate. Good stuff. In the name of the bandwagon- this beer seems perfectly balanced in every way.

On tap at Toronado. Very floral on the nose. Pours surprisingly light and clear. Huge hops, unfortunately the tap was a little flat. Good finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2016 My first Pliny. Poured from a bottle. Clear gold with white head. Outstanding aroma - floral, citrus and pine. Taste is well balanced. Hops are incredibly presented - flavorful, but not over the top. Medium body with crisp carbonation. Great beer; sought this one out for a long time. Glad I finally got to try it.

550ml bottle. Pours clear golden with a two inch bone white head that has excellent retention. Medium carbonation and a crisp but ample bodied mouthfeel. The aroma is extraordinarily enticing with notes of pine, grapefruit, and fresh mown grass. The taste is an explosion of hops in the mouth which deliver on the promise of the aroma but which balances the diverse and complex hop bitterness with a sweet malt backbone. The finish is long and savory but not oppressive, sustaining the best aspects of the impressive hoppiness of this brew leaving one yearning for another sip. I am not a huge fan of IPA's, much preferring Stouts and Porters, but this beer is amazing. I rank it in the top ten of beers I have tasted. I am now lusting to try Pliny the Younger.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Thanks mark. Where to start. Best dipa Ive had by far. Pours clear light gold. Big fluffy white head. Aroma is an awesome balance of pine,citrus/hop. Taste is also a wonderful balance of mainly hop and pine. Very very smooth. No bitterness left in mouth.
Bottle. Bright gold with a frothy off white head. Balanced caramel, malt and hops. Nothing dominates. Really impressed.

A glorious work of art. Surprisingly light and pale in colour though, but with a healthy white head that stays and laces the glass and brings out the great aroma of flowers and citrus. Taste is incredibly smooth for aomething that ends with a mediium-strong bitter.

Almost the perfect beer. Intense aroma, balanced taste, fantastic texture beautiful marriage of floral citrus hop flavors. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Citrus aroma; golden appearance; hoppy with a touch of pine; light fizz and with a bit of slickness on the palate; overall, a tremendous beer with a fantastic hoppy flavor with subtle undertones and that slickness on the palate that marks it as unusual 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From notes: Draught @ Strangeloves in Philadelphia. Poured clear orange-amber with a 3-finger white head. Orange and grapefruit citrus aromas. Body was medium, with a mildly oily finish. Flavor of citrusy hops with notes of citrus peel. Nicely balanced by a touch of caramel underneath. Very good.

Bottle from a bottle share. Thanks Brian Ge! Well the hype has made me want to try this one...and finally I have. Poured a clean golden-orange with thin white head into a snifter. Very pretty beer. Aroma strong on the pine, citrus, earth and malts. The taste was very good indeed. Extremely well balanced hops and malts with a strong pine and citrus taste. The earthiness of the hops balanced with the heavy malts makes the body medium to full. The finish is lasting pine and slight bitter hops. Mouth is smooth. I really liked it...maybe not quite to the hype but certainly a very good II ipa.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2014 The hype around this beer was destined to end in disappointment, but I admit it?s incredibly smooth and balanced. Was bottled 3 weeks ago and brought back to Canada from the RR brewpub. Overwhelming pine and earth. Definitely balanced, definitely smooth and drinkable. Very unique from the plethora of ipa?s that make their way into Canada, but certainly not what I was anticipating from what I?d read and the clone recipes floating out there. Edit - my original 2 tastings were from a tulip glass, it was much more pleasant from a standard pint glass. Second review from growler 2014. Biggest difference I have noticed is a much more prevalent grapefruit smell, and a lingering almost rosemary-like herbal aftertaste.  No strong lingering bitterness, but definitely a dry herbal aftertaste.  Much more enjoyable this time around!!!!
Bottle 7/22/13. Dark Golden pour with a white head. What beer should taste like.
Not overly hoppy, perfectly balanced and delicious. Very good, one of my favorites

aroma of pure sour citrus and pine in that order,you can detect malts if you sniff long and hard..golden clear liquid with a slight amber hue,pure white foamy head (the hallmarks of a hop bomb)..flavor..I was right..grapefruity,lemony,minty,piney,delicious and refreshing..tingly and perfectly carbonated with a sour bitter finish..overall..as the other ratings and mine show it doesnt get much better than this
A truly fine IPA , medium body, medium hops, very easy to drink and gets better with each subsequent sip. I can easily see why this gem ranks so high.

A clear, golden pour with a large, frothy white head. It has a nice aroma filled with sweet caramel, pine, and floral hops. The full body has a thick, creamy texture with average carbonation. The taste is bittersweet with some long tingling bitterness in the finish.

Poured from bottle into snifter. Clear yellow body with a white head. Smells of grapefruit, hops and floral notes. Extremely smooth and well hopped. First Pliny and hopefully not the last. Dangerously easy to drink.

Big thanks to Kenric! Super fresh bottle poured into a tulip glass. Caramel color with a small white head. WOW! Nose is Caramel, grapefruit, tangerine, piney, but unlike anything else out there. Smooth would be an understatement! This is truly a world class beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Possibly the best beer I've ever had. Smooth and flavorful, very well balanced 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
My first Pliny! Wow, the initial impression is "this is an imperial?" Very drinkable, almost refreshing. Super fresh. Lots of hop aroma, but not super bitter. This is really exceptional.

got this bottle in a trade with robloc303. bottled on 6/17/13

great aroma, malty but still piney and citrus hop aroma. poured a golden slight haze. medium frothy head, with great lacing. I was blown away by the taste, full bodied, sweet, but not over powering with malt flavor, but great hop presence. Very floral, citrus flavor, with a piney finish. flavors just danced on my tongue . I wish I had more access to this beer. Over all my favorite DIPA to date. I love CCBs style of IPA as well as Stones IPAs but this takes the cake for my favorite.

Bottle on holiday courtesy of my brother-in-law! Pours golden amber with thin white head. Aromas are big citrus, pine, spruce, a bit of toffee. Flavours deliver. Bitterness is well-balanced with the hint of sweet finish. Medium carbonation. Tastes the strength, if that makes sense. Overall, a very good beer.
Hands down one of the best beers out there. Great hops,citrus,floral,piney,flavor everthing a hophead wants in a great brew.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2015 Bottle. Pours clear golden with a lasting lacy white head. Aroma is grapefruit, pine, citrus and hops. So good! Flavour is medium sweet with a strong bitter aftertaste. Very good balance with both malts and hops. Works great together. Full bodied. Simply amazing.
Great aroma and taste. Head fades quickly. Probably one of my top three beers. Hard to find outside of Sonoma county.

Pours a hazy golden colour with a beige frotty head, with thight bubbles. Head disappears rather fast. Aroma is tons of citrus, grapefruit, piny. Taste is bitter, grapefruit, sweet malt backbone, well balanced. Nice lingering aftertaste that is bitter and dry and biscuity. Medium body, medium carbonation.
Everyone's favorite beer is now one of mine. It's not the best beer I've ever had but it's up there.

Deep bid smell. Good head. Taste of pine nuts and wood. Very good beer overall. 

---Crozier
On tap at Beechwood BBQ. Lots of hype for Pliny. Got citrus, roasty, spruce. Excellent!
The head is robust, the body golden and clear. It smells fruity, aromatic, a bit citrus. The taste is hoppy, creamy, aromatic, fruity. citrus, nice. 12/12/12/12/11/12

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2013 Got this through a trade with whatsupstairs. Pours a beautiful golden orange. Very hoppy on your nose. Nice carbonated fizz mouth feel. Tastes of hops grapefruit and notes of caramel. Not too bitter Not too sweet. Dry finish. This one lives up to the hype.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2013 Pours a crisp golden amber color with frothy white head. Aromas of hops, grapefruit, pine and sweet caramel malt. Lots of piney, citrus hop flavor as well as caramel and malts. Medium body and very easy to drink. Good bitterness throughout with a bitter citrus finish. There is a lot of hype that surrounds this beer but its not without reason. Worth a try.

Half pint at the brew pub. Deep Bronze with white head. Citrus/Grapefruit bise. Great hop bite all around, but not much malt. Its a very good beer but somewhat standard compared to other "elite" ipas.

I tried not to buy into the hype, but this was so good. On tap at Belmont Station, pours a clear amber-orange with a big, fluffy white head. Aroma for days: sharp pine needle, tangerine, lemon peel, just a suggestion of caramel malt, and juicy grapefruit. Superb mouthfeel (almost like mild Pop Rocks), fleshy citrus, floral, more pine. Dry finish, quite drinkable. Dangerous in a full pint.

Got lucky and got a bottle from Holiday Wine Cellar, Escondido, Calif. Thanks Rick! Bottled on 6/25/13, drank it on 7/6/13. Fresh! Brilliant golden appearance, with good lacing. Fragrant pink grapefruit followed by pine aromas. A harmonious arrangement of earthy citrus and pine flavors mixed with sweet malts and the perfect bitter balance. Very smooth. What makes this so good is the way its balanced. It even tastes good after I burp.

A golden, brilliantly clear ale with sparkling carbonation and a medium white rocky head with long retention. Smells of light caramel resinous hops. Tastes of resinous hops, caramel, white grapes and a very light roast. Medium bitterness, but balanced by a pleasant malt background. Relatively dry. A slight alcohol warming, no astringency, slightly creamy, zingy carbonation. Very enjoyable IPA, a wonderful example of the style.

Bottle 4/17 - trade with panicaholic...thanks man! Pours medium golden color with nice fluffy white head. Decent lacing on glass. Aroma of floral and piney hops and is same in taste, with a bit of citrus and earthyness. Nice bitterness with a perfect balance of malt to finish. Great mouth feel and aftertaste. Waited a long time to try this one and it was worth the wait. All I can say is.....I want another!

Floral aroma. Very nice. Balanced flavor. Not to bitter, but very full flavored. Great overall

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Golden with little head; dank hop aroma hints of oil; Flava is hop over the tops of my taste buds, into my palate and then my sinuses; finishes long dry and hoppy; feels medium and fizzy foamy, glides down the chute.

Golden yellow with thick fluffy white head. Aroma is flowery piney hops with citrus notes and some malt yeastiness. Mouthfeel is a touch sticky. Taste is resinous pine and bright bitter citrus on the follow through with a good malty backbone. Aftertaste is delicious lingering hoppy bitter goodness. Overall excellent balanced double IPA that goes down like a single IPA. Is it the best? Taste is subjective.....you decide! As for me, I love it!
Aroma is full of hops with lots of pine. Pour is clear amber color with a thin white head. Taste is refreshing, but not too bitter. Very good DIPA.
Pours a dark golden. Dank and piney and aromas along with some ciitrus too. Nice bitter flavours...pine, grapefruit, smooth hop finish. Excellent.
Great hoppy aroma, lots of pine. Pours clear amber with a thin head. Taste is refreshing and bitter.

Bottle, great pour with nice aroma and very smooth to drink a near perfect balance of hops and malt.

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Bottle share. Clear gold. Not enough can be said about this. Such a great beer that I've had multiple times but finally review. Pretty much a perfectly balanced impy. 90min is still my cockring impy ipa tho.
Had to travel out west to finally try this beer. It was great. I dont know if it is possible to live up to the hype that it receives but certainly a damn good beer.
Nice aroma, very smooth and excellent hoppyness. Really grows on you after first SIP...

510mL bottle into a snifter. Pours a clear golden orange with a frothy white head, leaves some thin lacing. Aromas of pine and sweet and citrus fruits. Very piney hops upfront blended with citrusy fruits and sweet malt. Balanced perfectly. Soo good.
Bottle out into snifter. Gold with thick light head. Floral smell and nice hoppy flavor

Excellent DIPA. Pours a translucent orange yellowish color with a clean white head and huge hop aroma of pine and citrus. Taste is a perfect balance of sweet malt and heavy pine and citrus from the hops, lots of grapefruit notes. Awesome stuff.
The perfect double IPA. Complex hop profile consisting primarily of moderate citrus, heavy pine, and bright tropical fruit. Just enough malty sweetness to serve as a backdrop for the hops.
Bottled 5/27. Hearty malt, hops galore. More juicy than I remembered; still quite piney with a touch of earth. A darn tasty DIPA that is, thankfully, not super hard to acquire.

Stong pine with a bit of citrus aroma. Clear golden color with a pillowy white head. Hop maltiness at first then a mellow almost tart mouth feel. I. Love.It. Its an amazing beer i dont think i can properly put into words worthy of its greatness. Thank you Russian River.

San Francisco, Ca. - Coit Liquors - 510 ml bottle - brought back by my son for Fathers Day! Medium golden pour, soft white head with some nice bubble action and light lacing. Fresh light spruce aroma, some pleasant floral notes. Flavor is seductively pleasing with light subtle grapefruit bitterness, caramel sweetness, some syrupy papaya-like fruity sweetness in the back end. Mouthfeel has a nice rich thickness to it. Pretty damn solid.

Draft at 16 Tons Taphouse, Eugene. Pours a medium golden color, little to moderate head. . Aroma decently strong, some resin, some grapefruit. Lighter aroma that is strong without being overbearing. Body deliciously light, almost to the point of being easy-drinking. Love it!

Hazy orange with medium white head. Aroma citrus and pine and some malt. Medium body, light carbonation, minimal alcohol. Flavor is very well balanced and complex hops flavors with perfect amount of malt. Bitter but not extreme. Hard to say if this is the best thing ever, but very very good and impressive to pack in so much flavor while remaining so smooth and drinkable.

Got this in a trade from my buddy Farhaad. Thanks man!! Bottled 6/06/2013. Bottle into glass, golden Amber pour with a healthy thick white head that laces all the way down. Nose is citrus, grass, some sweetness. Taste? Grass, grapefruit, citrus, bright clean and crisp. Long piney malty finish. Its bitter, but not overpowering in any way. Very balanced and a true winner of an ipa. Best ipa? Not sure, Im more of a stout guy, but I can sure say Id drink this whenever I have the chance.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2013 Bottle from Ales Unlimited in SF.
Ive had this beer multiple times now and it still hasnt quite lived up to the first time I had it on draft at Cheeky Monk in Denver.
Definitely going to sound cliche but the most balanced IPA you will ever taste. Pine and grass notes dominate the aroma with a bit of hop aroma as well. Immediate taste is so smooth with nothing but flavor. Finishes with a mild hop taste. Honestly hard not to chug it tastes so good.

Truly an excellent IPA.

The Aroma being pine and citrus.

The taste of Pine, Grapefruit, Tangerines, and some malt kick. ULTRA balanced though.

Very good beer. Something everyone and their mother should try once!

Glad I got to try this beer
Yellow, cloudy from the bottle. Aroma of citrusy hops. Balanced hop taste and bitterness. Excellent.

Saw this beer was being sold at a local liquor store and wanted to taste the hype all over the Internet.  The pour was an impressive clear amber. Smell was a strong ipa scent on the nose with some piny notes.  Taste.    Eh.     The hype killed this beer for me.  Good ipa.   Not great.

Got in a trade with TopsecretWaffle.  510 ml bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 5/27/2013.  Pours lightly hazy golden amber color with a 2 finger dense off white head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers.  Spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass.  Aromas of grapefruit, tangerine, orange zest, lemon zest, floral, pineapple, honey, light caramel, bread, and floral earthiness.  Damn nice aromas with good balance and complexity of hop and malt notes; with good strength.  Taste of grapefruit, orange zest, lemon zest, tangerine, floral, pineapple, grass, pine, honey, light caramel, bread, and floral earthiness.  Fair amount of earthy pine bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of citrus, citrus zest, pineapple, honey, light caramel, floral, grass, pine, bread, and floral earthiness.  Awesome balance and complexity of hop flavors with a moderate malt balance; and zero cloying flavors after the finish.  Medium carbonation and body; with a fairly creamy, sticky, and lightly crisp mouthfeel that is nice.  Alcohol is very well hidden with only a small warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is a highly excellent DIPA!  Great hop flavor complexity and moderate malt balance; and very smooth to sip on.  A highly enjoyable offering; but certainly not near the hype it gets.

Hazy orange-gold with a moderate white head. Subtle blend of grapefruit, citrus, peach, and pale malt in the aroma. Hoppy, mild bitterness, and medium-bodied. A clean, crisp finish with little alcohol presence.

Finally got to try the legend, and boy did it live up to the hype.Amazing aroma of fresh cut grass, light hay and pine on the nose. Taste is sweet at first then builds in complexity with multiple taste layers on the back end. Awesome!
Perfected IPA. What can you say. Super complex while being very accessible. Thank you Vinny! You have never done me wrong.
Golden pour. Huge tropical fruit and citrus aroma. Medium bodied, actually surprisingly light given the alcohol. Quite impressive. A looong lingering piney bitterness. Great depth and complexity.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2015 Bottle from big johns market. Pours a very clear golden, light orange color with a quickly dissipating off white head. Aroma is a beautifully pungent blast of piney, citrusy, tropical fruit hops with a mild caramel malt background and a hint of alcohol. Taste is quite bitter with strong citrusy hop character and a mild fruity sweetness. Bitterness lasts long into the finish, leaving behind fruity notes. Top 50 beer for a reason. Spot on. Always a good day to be drinking a Pliny.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2013 Bottle. Pours a clear bright gold. Medium white head with decent retention and lacing. Smells of strong pine and grapefruit, medium pineapple, subtle malt and yeast, boozey but very tangy. Taste is explosive, pine, grapefruit, pineapple, a balance of malt but hop heavy. Insanely smooth finish. High carbonation but slightly silky. Incredible.

I guess Im officially not a big IPA guy. The citrus aroma is awesome!  The pour is very cool orange w/ a thin white head that leaves some lacing. The taste is a good balance between citrus & hops. The beer is quite smooth at 100 IBUs. Its very, very good!

Lots of grapefruit, citrus and tropical fruity hops in the nose. Pours a nice light copper with a good clarity and a hefty head that leaves after a minute. The taste is a hop explosion of citrus and pine with a dry malt back bone that is not very sweet allowing the hops to assault you up front.  Very smooth bitterness with a dry mouth feel. Overall this beer lives up to the hype.  Taste great every time, never get tired of my pliny!

Dark gold pour with a medium white head. 
aroma is piney hop, lighter citrus
flavour is medium malt backing a nice piney and grapefruit hoppiness .
Very well balanced on the palate and the alc is well blended.

I, for one, dont quite get the hype. Tried at the Santa Rosa brew pub. Im not even sure Id call it a good regular IPA let alone a good double IPA. Just barely serviceable, like a watery Samuel Adams offering. But because its offered by some hip California brewer, were supposed to be in love? Emperors clothing! This is way over-rated! And only 8 percent ABV. Weak, weak, weak. Cut the hype, guys.

I received this in a trade from stumpyiliz.  The box arrived in my office and I wanted to drive home immediately and crack it open.  Luckily, I am a man of restraint.  I took it home and put it in the fridge for drinking later that evening.  Pours clean and golden with an ample white head.  The scent is all pine, but the flavor seems slightly citrusy.  This effervescent beer finishes sweet, which, to me, separates the great IIPAs from the merely good.  Count me in as a Pliny Fanboy.  Bottle - Trade from stumpyiliz
Ohh wow. Beautiful Pour, great big fluffy head and head retention. Perfectly balanced, every flavour and part of this beer seems to work together. Cannot get much better than this.

bottle shared by mathieuc, thanks mate! pours clear pale golden with a nice creamy white head, some retention and lacing. doughy and lightly sugary malts, fresh graininess. candy floss, tons of grapefruit, resin. soft carbonation, medium body - oily, medium long grapefruity finish. good balance! excellent brew - lives up to its reputation.
Bottle from Kyle, thanks! Pours Clear golden with nice white head. Aroma is , pine, citrus, floral.  Taste is floral flavor, grapefruit, pine, very hop forward but balanced. Great Brew

Golden with a substantial white head. Pine resin is the prevailing aroma. Malt with a hint of breadiness is enveloped in an amazing hop embrace. For all its intensity it remains relatively light bodied. Both the malt and the hops are up close and personal yet maintain their distinction. A great example of intensity and balance

Pours a clear copper with white head and nice lacing. Aroma of grapefruits, pine, light sweetness. Taste has some pine, citrus, pineapple, a bit of sweetness. Full body and medium carbonation. Very good.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2013 This what other DIPAs should be measured up against. Phenomenal beer that is surprisingly smooth for its bitterness. Citrus notes really add to the beers taste and makes bitterness hardly noticeable.

Beautiful clear amber with a white head - lots of white lacing. Ive had this a few times, but always enjoyed it faster than I could rate it! Sweet and floral nose. Taste is a perfect balance between sweet malt, fruity hops and just a little bitterness in the finish. Its the real deal.

Pour is clear dark gold. Head is two fingers and off white. Nose is beautiful with pine, floral notes and pineapple. Taste is smooth with nice hop burst but not too bitter. There is good malt character to even it out. Hop notes are sweet pine, mango and citrus rind. Mouthfeel is medium and somewhat viscous. Very good. I can see why it's  top shelf. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This beer has just enough, citrus notes to blend with the bittering hops, making it a great all round beer. Easy to drink when it is hot or cold, but only for the double IPA lovers.

Pours a lovely, clear, golden ale with not much  of a head but good lacing. Great, sweet aroma of mangoes and papaya. Very tropical fruit in depth with a hint of pine finish. 

The taste of sweet tropical fruits with peppery notes and grassy towards the end. The finish is excellent with a lingering flavor of hops that makes you want to take another sip. The balance of this beer is remarkable and the smoothness of the palate makes it extremely drinkable.

It is usually far better on tap though this bottle (6 weeks old) is still pretty darn good. Would have to review it again when had on tap.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Admittedly not my favorite style.  Smoother than youd expect from such a hoppy beer.

Pours a slightly cloudy yellow, lighter in color than many other doubles. Nice white head with lasting and lacing. Citrus aroma, not overwhelming. Well balanced hop and slight malt taste that impresses but doesnt linger. Makes you want more.

Well balanced with good citrus and floral notes. Very smooth for an 8% beer. Easy to drink, and a definite gateway beer for those new to DIPAs

- Drink & Give Thanks to The Lord

Pliny the Elder ou Pline lancien fut embouteillé le 10 avril 2013. Tout a été dit et redit de cette bière, inutile de faire la description de la dégustation point par point. Cette bière est ma 2500ème que je ferai un commentaire sur le site et elle est tout simplement sublime. Je pourrais dire quelle est facile à boire pour lalcool quelle contient, je pourrais aussi dire comment je suis reconnaissant que slovaksniper a partagé cette bouteille avec moi. Je pourrais parler de la pluie et du beau tempsmais je vais seulement dire que cette bière nest aucunement surévaluée, elle est tout simplement superbe.
Smell, looks and tastes great what more can you say about this one.  One of its kind and in a league of its own.

Bottle. Aroma is pineapple, tropical fruit, tangerine. Appearance is crystal clear light copper with a white head. Good lacing. Taste is tropical fruit, pineapple, piney hops, and a touch of sweet malt. Great carbonation, medium light body. Overall a world class ipa.
Bottle(2 weeks fresh):Nose is sweet fruity hops, tropical fruits, nice mix of hop flavors, bubblegum..Taste is sweet, bitter, juicy hops, fruits.
Cerveja perfeita do estilo perfeito, a melhor Imperial IPA que degustei até hoje, uma comunhão de álcool e lúpulo, vibrante, viciante, inesquecível !

Aroma-Not to overwhelming like most DIPA's. the traditional pine scent comes out very clean

Appearance-Not a bright bold orange, but still a crisp orange brown reflection. Very pleasing to the eye.

Taste-Simple mouthwatering perfection. If I could put this in a CamelBak and drink a liter a day, I would. What sets PTE apart is how smooth but subtlety intense it is. It's a toss up b/w PTE and Hopslam as the best readily available/bottled DIPA on the planet. With that said, I have Headytopper and Dreadnaught coming in this week.

Palate-Like liquid velvet pine scented grapefruit. The 8% isn't even noticeable. My palate told me afterwards that he almost died from euphoria!

Overall-it's PTE and about as perfect a beer can get! With that said, it's not my #1, but it's darn close.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone so go have a DIPA!

Bottle compliments of Bergzilla. 510 ml split 3 ways. Amazing hop nose. Giant resin flavor and mouthfeel. This is a ground breaking beverage!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2014 Bottle at home. 1 month old. Shared with Mathieu87.
Appearance: clouded blonde beer, nice white stable foam, lots of carbonation noticeable. As a good IPA should look.
Nose: spices, lots of oranges, very fruity, nice hops. For me this is the perfect IPA nose!
Taste: very dry, rather fruity, taste doesnt last all that long though. You get a sort of dry out effect when drinking, which builds up a little when swallowing the beer.
Nice IPA, but not really living up to the hype in my opinion.

Pours clear gold with white head and nice lacing.  Aroma of sweet citrus and pine.  Taste is even better.  Tons of hoppy grapefriut with a strong malty backbone that blends nicely with the bitter finish.  This might be the ideal DIPA.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2014 Perfect peach look. Aroma is grapefruit and citrus. Taste is the same with a spot on sweet resin bitter finish. Perfect balance between grapefruit and piney flavours. Orange tangelo and lots of tropical fruits come out as warms. Palate is a sweet tang. Overall, a brilliant and smashable double ipa. Not too sweet and fruity, but not crazy bitter. Lovely.

Thanks to AZ crews excellent driveway tasting to be reunited this with great beer.  I ahd a few years back at GABF but was too drunk to rate and to be honest probably borderline that point again this time.  Anyways this is amazing brew as everyone knows.  Huge nose of tropical fruits and citrus.  delicious grapefruit, pine, and light malts.  so juicy and leaves you wanting more

Apple cider color, smells beautiful, fruit and pine, like a fall harvest festival. Tastes amazing, Almost the same at the nose, but with more pine. Finish is long and woody. Last glass poured at Hawthornes. Success! Soy sauce

Une bouteille née le 10 avril et bue le 2 mai.  Pline lAncien a 22 jours de vie.  Une fois versé, le liquide qui apparait fait belle figue.  Tout est plaisant dans ce regard : la couleur orangée de sa robe, la ténacité de sa tête mousseuse et la dentelle qui décore mon verre.  Le premier nez nest pas totalement explosif.  Il faut attendre quelques secondes pour que le spectacle débute.  Je suis frappé par ces parfums profondément complexes et alléchants.  Il est si facile de se prendre dans cette toile tissée par les agrumes, les fruits du verger, les fruits tropicaux, les herbes, les fleurs et les conifères.  La première gorgée et les suivantes me confirment aussi que je suis devant une démonstration de beauté et déquilibre.  Tout est mis en place ici pour rendre mes papilles heureuses.  Je suis bouche bée devant cette merveilleuse stupeur houblonnée.  Autant de saveurs dans une si petite bouteille.  Jaime ce profil amérisant qui privilégie la finesse au détriment dune intensité mal contrôlée.  Je suis impressionné par la justesse de cette base maltée.  Je savoure chaque parcelle de caramel et de miel.  Cet amour fusionnel entre les céréales et les houblons est renversant.  En bouche, ce modèle presque idéal montre un corps sculpté comme une athlète accomplie.  Son pétillement, conçu pour mon palais, ne fait que prolonger le plaisir provoqué par les saveurs.  Sa texture légèrement huileuse confirme sa perfection.  La finale,  inspirée par la tropicalité et le gazon fraîchement coupé, est une ode véritable à la forêt de conifère du littoral pacifique là où le climat océanique est parfumé par la pruche de louest, le cèdre rouge de Californie, lépicéa de Brewer, le pin dOregon et les rhododendrons.
Poured a clear golden with a large frothy white head. Aroma of huge citrus hops. Medium body, flavour of sweet caramel malt and grapefruit. Well balanced.

Bottle at CBC 2013, huge thanks to tkrjukoff. Clear golden beer with a rich lasting white head. Hoppy fruity aroma, pine needles, citrus, mango, pine apples, grassy, floral, pears, earthy notes, hay, hay notes, grapes. Hoppy floral flavor, grapefruit, pine needles, mango, citrus, grapefruit notes, pine apples, hay, herbal notes, grapes, some grass. Just wonderful! Hoppy fruity floral finish with mango, grapes, citrus, earthy and herbal notes. Amazing!!!!

One of (If not) the best DIPAs I have ever had the pleasure of tasting.  Massive Citrus hop hit balanced with a good malty backbone and a heady alcohol sweetness.  Exceptionally well balance for its type.  Ive only taken points away so that I can potentially give Pliny the Younger full points when I finally try it!  Pliny is a hop-heads right of passage!
Bottled 04/10/13.  Pours a clear amber with a mild frothy head.   Floral, hoppy aroma with a medium lasting bitterness that leaves the palate mildly sticky.

Poured from bottle into a tulip glass... 2 inch head (fairly large as I was not focusing and running on 2 hours of sleep).  The color was surprising light, as I expected a more orange hue rather than a clean, golden yellow (just an observation based on past DIPAs).  Aroma was that of grapefruit, other citrus, and floral/grasslike.  Taste hit you with a nice bitterness expected with a DIPA, and ended with a great malty sweetness.  Overall, and excellent DIPA that rivals the best I have tasted.

Bottle, poured a golden yellow color with aromas of tropical fruit, pineapple, citrus, light lemon and some resin with pine.  Flavors are resin and tropical fruit, wow, a great DIPA, I need more bottle of this, I could drink this stuff all day, inside or outside by the pool or griping out, a damn fine beer overall.

Bottled. Aroma includes tropical fruit (pineapple?). Pours clear rich gold with vigorous but not over-the-top carbonation. Definitely hoppy, with long lasting but not overpowering bitterness. A solid high-gravity IPA.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2014 (2013):Probablement la ipa de 8% la plus croustillante que jai croisé, je me souviens pas vraiment du profil aromatique mais cétait assez délicat, pas le monstre auquel je mattendais. Buvabilite gargantuesque. (2014): Bouteille fraiche de 15 jours, un nez ridiculement résineux et coniféreux qui ne laisse aucun doute. En bouche cest hyper collant avec une amertume pénétrante qui assèche minutieusement. Les céréales sont presque mielleuses et hautement fruitées, toute une combinaison!

Pours gorgeous golden tinted yellow with a big white head that fades nicely. The aromas are classic WC style IPA/DIPA (as this and RR BP are the grandfathers of the style big surprise) massive grapefruit, minimal grass and just a slight hint of pine. The taste comes on with awesome citrus hop flavors, balanced malts in the background, and just a slight bitter hop aftertaste. The mouthfeel is light if I compare it to what the style has evolved into, but judged against this beers other values, this light mouthfeel fits nicely. Overall this is the perfect DIPA. Its not huge like most in this style seem to be heading (super heavy, with big abv and sometimes overly malty); this is the king of the DIPA world, pure perfection!

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2014 On tap at the Mayor of Old Town.  Deep golden and clear with a white head.  Pungent fresh citrus and floral hop aroma.  Medium body with a soft creamy feel.  Exceptional balance of flavor with a light malt backbone keeping the hops in check.  Dry finish.  Overall, fuck yeah!  Update: 510 ml bottled 22 days ago, purchased from Biggie Wine & Liquor and poured into a pint glass.  Golden clear appearance with a fluffy, lingering white head.  Aroma of fresh hops, tropical fruits, citrus zest, pine, resin and light toasted grains.  Similar flavor, medium to heavy bitterness with a little malt sweetness.  Medium body with a dry feel and a lingering bitter finish.  Overall Id say this bottle is in the 3.9 range 848415.  A great IPA, perhaps a little overrated but I think it is better on tap, which Ive had several pours of over the years.  This is only my second time having it from the bottle, however.  I will leave my original rating of 4.2 for now
would be an outstanding IPA however as a DIPA its decent, not great IMO.  showing its age there are better DIPAs from norcal out there..

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2013 The buzz around this beer is real. Such a perfect balance of malt and hops that is so smooth you don?t even notice the high ABV. Its like marajuana in a glass the aroma is pure pot and the bitterness backs it up.

Appearance: beer is a rich golden pretty much orange color, very clear, has a thick off white head that recedes relatively quickly, laces nicely Aroma: very strong hoppy aroma, pine, grass, spicy, citrus, it smells good Taste: initially kind of mild, then pine, grass, citrus, can get hints of malt too, a spicy finish and a lingering butter aftertaste Palate: moderate to slightly above average c02 burn, some froth on the tongue, feels full bodied Overall: a very enjoyable beer, itâs predominately a hoppy beer, but does not over do it, I like how you also get hints of the malt with this ipa ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Exactly what beer should taste like. Exactly what beer should taste like. Exactly what beer should taste like.

510 ML bottled 041013 @ 50° and warming into Zwiesel 14.7oz Cognac snifter; crystal clear golden amber body beneath a 1.5" bright white, very tightly structured head, nearly cool whip, falling to a solid sheet and ring leaving a wall of polka dots and one large horizontal peninsula of lace; hypnotic tropical, grassy, and citrus aromatics, exceptionally balanced, so potent, yet rounded and mellow; taste follows on a mml, silky smooth body delivering an extended silky smooth, clean drying bitterness with an echo of hop spice; this is loaded with beautifully balanced hops, but to me what really sets it apart is how remarkable clean and smooth the 100ibu is delivered

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2013 500ml bottle. Pours a clear deep golden color with a thin fluffy white head. Aroma is citrus and tropical fruits. Big grapefruit with some sweet malts. Taste follows the nose spot on! Perfect balance between the sweetness of the malts and the bitterness of the hops!

Pours golden crystal clear with thin white head nice lacing down the glass.  Aroma of sweet malt and citrus hops more grapefruit notes than anything.  Taste is amazing!!!! It has a great malt background that is just sweet enough with a perfect hop balance.  The hops are have a nice earthy, grassy, but citrus grapefruit taste that leaves you wanting another sip.   Overall a great 2X IPA that is hard to believe it is 8% abv and very smooth clean beer.

Gold, clear, thin white head. Aroma of huge citrusy hops, tangerines, a little fruitiness. Flavor of grainy malt with some caramel, resiny bitterness, finishes with some lightly grassy fresh hop notes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

One of the most aromatic beers I've had. Clear golden color, medium head with fair retention. Lightly malty taste, overwhelming wonderful aroma of sweet hops mixed with citrus. I'd rather smell it dry than drink it. Amazing!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 15, 2013 Aroma has slight malt undertones of hay and cereal. Hops are present but not overpowering and mix well with floral and fruity aromas. Slight hint of doughy yeast in aroma as well. VERY balanced combination of hops, malt, and yeast aromas. Appearance is orangish and very clear. Again, Palate is nothing overpowering here. Very balanced. Light to medium body with a lively carbonation. Hops dominate but do not destroy any other elements. The finish is long and bitter. Freaking Delicious!

On draught at the Monks Kettle in San Francisco.  Clear orange, fizzy and with a creamy head.  Tastes smooth, fruity hops, pleasant and has a citrus after taste.  Lovely fruity hop aroma, grapefruity.  Goes down very well.
UPDATED: SEP 19, 2016 Pours amber gold, frothy white head. nose is piney, resinous, grassy hops. More grassy hops in the flavour. Mouthfeel is light and lively. Quite bitter in the finish.

bottle dated 03.21.13. clear sparkling apple juice body with a small off-white head of medium-sized bubbles and no sustainable lacing.  a lot of orange oil and pine resin in the nose along with the mango / melon and pineapple character of the hops.  the malt is nicely soft and the body is almost as smooth as a bottle-conditioned beer, thats the highlight, though there is some wateriness in the finish that I dont remember from years before. bitterness as you expect: heavy but not too brash and grating.  flavor emphasizes pine resin and orange oil hops. I remember this being fruiter and more floral and soft in the nose, as recently as one year ago, but those batches were around mid-3 at the time. Ive become more sensitive to the grating resin quality of excessive, so this is something like having a taste-test of wood sealant at McGuckin.  the body is certainly better than most IPA or hop-forward beers on the market right now, and aroma-wise its a little better than most, but the flavor is pretty common.
UPDATED: AUG 1, 2013 Great IPA.  Citrus aroma taste was very balanced.  This is a great beer and recommend it to anyone that is able to get it.

Ive waited a long time to try this one and it has been worth it.  Beautiful, golden pour with medium-thick head.  Lively, inviting nose with a spicy pine note dominant.  Nice, medium-heavy palate that is fairly lively with carbonation.  Flavor is excellent with simcoe and centennial notes of pine and citrus throughout, followed by a lasting bitterness.  Damn good double ipa that clearly has set the bar for many others.  Maybe the best double below 9%.  Thanks Bill!
This is by far one of the best beers Ive ever had! Its smooth yet choppy. Gas a nice citrus and carmel  taste to it.

Made the trip from Atlanta to Mecca just to try this bad boy, and I gotta say it doesnt disappoint. Rating pint #2-
Amazing bouquet of citrus with just a bit of pine. Actually, it mostly smells like fresh hops. Its a gorgeous amber with lovely white lacing. If I could give the taste an 11, I would. Its got some definite grapefruit characteristics, in flavor, mouthfeel and aroma, but again, its mostly just fresh hop flavor. Its green, and I dont know a better word to describe it. I know that giving this beer a perfect score makes me a fanboy, but Im honestly not sure where to discount it. This beer is worth the pilgrimage.

Tasted from the bottle, 01/04/2013.
Looks just astonishing, pure amber, crystal clear color with a living head.
Aroma is sweet and fruity upfront, then a huge mix of piny and citrusy notes.
Taste is immensely citrusy/piny, with a hint of tropical fruits in the end.
Aftertaste is heavily bitter, but in such a pleasant way!
Just the best you could get from an ipa, with no doubts, 
Recommended++

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a copper golden color with a huge, fluffy, white head. The head seems to have a life of its own and taunts the would be consumer with contempt. Its like a watched pot that never boils. Ive never seen a head retain so well. You think youre taunting me beer? Well, guess what, Im reviewing you on BA, so Ive got time. In keeping with the theme of this weekend past, the bouquet is as if a golfer at Augusta National had missed the fairway and ended up in the pine straw. While he waited for his partner to hit his ball, he dropped the big, juicy grapefruit he was eating into the pine straw. Hints of biscuit malt come through as well. The mouthfeel is nearly perfect for this style. The oiliness is very pleasing and complimentary to the flavor/aroma. This is a masterfully balanced IPA. Everything works together to deliver a whole-is-greater-than-the-sum-of-its-parts experience. It not only involves, it demands the attention of your sight, olfactory, taste, and tactile senses. Pine up front, then some orange citrus, and finishes with some grapefruit. Just a wonderful beer.
Great aroma, great color, smooth with a mild finish. This is one of the best ipa I have had

UPDATED: APR 1, 2016 Bottle. Clear gold with a large, foamy, off white head that lasts and laces. Aromas of grapefruit, pine, biscuit, light citrus and peach and caramel. Flavor is the same, citrus and bitter pine with a malt backbone. Medium bodied, smooth with a dry, bitter end.

I split a 16.9oz bottle with Chad of Chadz Beer Reviews (thanks, Chad!).  This was my first time trying Pliny and I was worried that it wasnt going to live up to the monumental hype.  I consider myself a hophead, and I tend to love the big, juicy, citrusy IPAs, so I knew that this could very well be the perfect beer for me.

Appearance: Its a beautiful, crystal clear golden color with a nice white fluffy head.  It looks great in a glass.

Aroma: A big grapefruit juice bomb on the nose, this beer has a huge tropical fruit basket aroma that welcomes the drinker in.  There is a touch of pine, but not much of one.

Taste: The aroma carries through into the palate, bringing that giant grapefruit and tropical fruit bomb in force.  The initial hit is a mammoth bitterness, almost all grapefruit, and it dries out a little in the finish and in the aftertaste, with a touch of a pine resin flavor coming through in the end.

Mouthfeel: It was not as carbonated as I expected, but I wouldnt go as far as to call it tepid.  The drinkability is off the chart.

Overall: Pliny is fantastic.  In my review video, I made note that it may not be the best beer Ive ever had in my life, but its certainly in the pantheon of amazing beers.  I may go as far as to say its one of my favorite DIPAs ever; its that good. 

Score: 10/10

On tap at Capone's and Blue Dog in southeast PA. Great IPA? Yup. Third best beer in the world? That's a stretch. Still, pick it up if you have the chance. It's nearly identical to the Younger, except with a weaker aroma and smaller alcohol content, which can cause it to taste watered down when drinking them side by side (which is insane at 8% ABV).

Unbelievable beer! Great hop notes. Crystal clear, small white head. Mouth feel was consistent with a great ipa. This was a moment I won't forget! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2013 Bottle at a bottle share. Pours a clear light amber color with a moderate head. Nose and taste are both quite bitter and hoppy; this was a fairly fresh bottle, so it was amazingly crisp and clean to drink. Great brew.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2015 Poured from a Growler filled at RR. Pours clear gold-amber with a generous white head leaving moderate lacing. Aroma is dominated by hops with notes of citrus, lemon, grass, pine resin, and grapefruit. Flavour is citrus, bread, grapefruit, lemon, and pine resin on the finish. Light body. Crisp hops on the finish. This is the mother of California IPAs. Awesome.
Dark fruit nose molases licorice raisins smoke earthy. Smooth pallet not thick. Taste creamy alcohol is def present. Some pepper nice beer. Will come back for more.
On tap at Monks. Deep golden hay color with thin white head. Aroma of straw and tropical fruits. Tastes like pineapple and sweet malts. Super balanced and light for a 2xIPA
One of my all time favorite, semi-readily accessible beers. Fantastic example of the style.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2015 An nice golden brown beer poured out of a bottle too long on my shelf. It still has a nicely bitter taste and aroma. Nice texture to satisfy the palate. I love it. And I want more.

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2014 On draught at Apex 3/16/13. A full, hop forward aroma. Smooth, floral grassy aroma and taste. So incredibly light for an IPA, makes hops the least bitter component ever. On draught at Roscoes Fifth Annual IPA Summit 3/28/14. Sweet citrus and pine aromas. Very prominent resinous pine and lightly tart citrus. Caramel malt sweetness balances the dense hoppiness.

Great Double IPA but not the best Ive had. The greatest issue with this beer is the legendary status and hype. Im sure when it first came out it was unparalleled. The aroma was piney and floral. The color a clear amber and the weight was medium with good carbonation. Balance is what defines this beer for me and the fact that it covers the 8% ABV so well. There was a hop bite up front that seemed a slight bit acidic that I dont recall from the first time I had this. Always worth a grab if found on tap.
500ml Bottle at Chow. Intense hoppy bitterness but so well balanced. I love this beer.
Pours a golden hay color. The nose is cilantro, and floral grapefruit. The flavor is mainly floral grapefruit. Very balanced and drinkable.
Aroma was mild and fruity. Taste was a bit sweet, but not overly syrupy like Pliny the Younger. I enjoyed this beer more than its younger cousin.
Citrusy n hoppy. Excellent. #BeerSnob

(poured into a tulip glass)
 This beer pours an absolutely gorgeous golden hue with some nice, white head.  Some quality lacing on the glass.  Some caramel notes in the nose.  Lots of resin on the front of the tongue.  Good malty backbone.  I wouldnt mind a bit more bitterness and a little less malty sweetness.  Overall, a textbook example of the style.
UPDATED: APR 18, 2013 A bit below the younger in my book, but a fantastic beer every time. Ive had this at many a poker night and a few times at RR. Never disappoints

Huge Thanks to joeneugs for this beer.  I have been wanting to try this for a while and he came through like a champ.  Beautiful orangish clear color with a decent white head.  Taste is up fron with hops and citrus with a nice malty aftertaste.  Not too overpowering just a great balance of all flavors.  Medium moutfeel with a bitter aftertaste.  Great beer

Pours amber with a fantastic pine/earthy aroma.  Great tasting, lots of hops with strong pine, citrus,  and slight grain notes as well. Very smooth and flavorful, it is evident that this beer has been carefully crafted throughout the years. An excellent beer: refreshing, filling, and complex. Definitely lives up to the hype

Bottles on 021913. Pours a super clear orange yellow color with a small one finger head that disappears quickly. Smells or pine, tropical fruit, slight malty caramel, and sweet pineapple. Really nice. Taste follows with the piney resin and tropical fruits. Nice bit of bitterness and a really nice clean mouth feel. Lingering pine and tropical feel after the sip has been consumed. I think this lives up to the hype. Glad I got to try it.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2013 Pours light amber color with a finger of frothy white head that slowly dissipates to a thin film.
Nose is bold hops, with notes of grapefruit trying unsuccessfully to mask the delicately sweet malted grain.
Perfect marriage of mellow grains and citrusy hop bitterness. 
Mouthfeel is much fuller than I expected for a light colored beer. Lively carbonation and creamy viscosity.
Incredibly good beer and its not even my favorite style.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft beer.  Beautiful gold color, medium head, nose of spruce, very hoppy but with noticeable malt.  Well-balanced, full-bodied.  A really good ale, but really high in alcohol.  If the flavor could be maintained with a lower alcohol level, this would definitely be one of my favorites.

Light amber in color, nose is amazing with grapefruit, peach, pine and lemongrass. Taste is fantastic with explosions of tropical fruit, lemongrass, pine. Aftertaste is hoppy, hoppy, hoppy with copious amounts of bitterness but not overly so. Ridiculously well balanced!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Orange/gold, fluffy white head. Nose is big mango, other sticky tropical fruits, pine. Taste is more big sticky tropical fruits, creamsicle, hop oils. Very smooth, oily mouthfeel. Lasting bitter finish.

One of my all time favorite beers. Always great, crisp and clean. Heavy hopped without over doing it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Its a really great beer. Anyone would agree even if u dont like beer.  I rated it a great beer even though its not in my top five.  Sorry the hype and unavailability to brew enough beer so everyone can sell it. And drink makes pliney the elder fall out of my top five

Floral notes of rose, hints of orange blossom, and peel. Caramelized malt collides with the fruitiness of the hops and you are in IPA heaven.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great amber pour and nice tan head.  Smells of citrus fruits.  Taste is similar with a nice malt backbone.  Great but not the great that the hype would leave you to believe.
Awesome and unique double IPA. Not overly bitter like most and very fruity. Very smooth and enjoyable. Great beer!!

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2014 Balanserad är det första jag tänker på. Bra bärs. Kul att äntligen få prova denna raritet

------   Provas halvblint. Färsk ananas. Svagt gräsig med svag ton av klorofyll och hemmaodlad marijuana (som jag har fått det beskrivet att sådant doftar). Bra kropp utan stickig maltsötma. Perfekt utjäst med nice och crisp avslut. Flaskad för 19 dagar sedan. Provas mot Hopocalyps och jag håller denna som den bättre av de två. Hos Wallén, nyligen hemkommen från san Fransico.    

-----
Ca 6v och på det stora hela står föregående rate fast. Elegant och balanserad så man häpnar. Välbevarad och pigg. (Thanks Biggsbowler)

When you get the one in a lifetime (for us europeans anyway) opportunity to sample Pliny The Elder you kind of  have premade ideas about it. Itś going to be massively bitter, a pure hop monster! The good news, it is not. This bottle proved me wrong in so many ways. Perfect golden looks, firm film of a head. Massive massive aroma of fruits, mainly tropical fruits, mango. Taste was a fruit bomb, so incredibly fresh and balanced. Incredibly tasty, more fruits with a giant long finish. Not many beers can stand up to their reputations but this one does incredibly well. Iḿ not biased when I say this is among the very best IPAs Ive sampled
Piney aroma pours light, white head. Great taste, not to hoppy not to bitter perfect. Citrus flavors on the palate. So far best beer ever

Aroma is weaker but a complex hop aroma of pine, citrus and orange. Flavor is initially clean with heavy hops and sweet malt. The backend is a nice dry bitterness and clean hops. Mouthfeel is full and carbonation is average. Overall this is a great beer.

The Holy Grail of Beers doesnt even begin to describe it. If I could drink one beer for the rest of my life, this would be it. I prefer it even to Pliny the Younger. PtE packs a bigger, hoppier punch and is tempered with that incomparable pine and citrus aromatic blend. It gives me a good, pleasant buzz and is always a treat.

great if you love the west coast big hopped beers. This is very grapefruit like beer in the bitterness. I think the grain selection is very typical but its made up for by the great Hops aroma. I love replicating this beer at home.

2 days shy of a month old and I can tell it is a bit less vibrant.

A: Crystal clear gold with a substantial foamy white head.  Great retention and lacing.  Just gorgeous

S: Biggest components: juicy sweet grapefruit, big pine, decently resinous.  Assortment of other ripe fruits and caramel sweetness.  

T: Not as intricate as the nose, but still delicious. Mildly bitter, sweeter than expected.  Grapefruit, pine.  Very dry

P: Incredibly smooth and refreshing.  Light to medium body with fitting carbonation. Leaves a great fresh hop taste in your mouth.  Very dry

O: So glad I finally got to try this iconic and historically important beer; but, judging as just a beer it is excellent, plain and simple. Would love to have a few 500ml bottles in the fridge at all times, but so is life.

After many years of wanting to savor this I have finally got the chance! Thanks to Greg for the trade!! Pours a golden color with thin white head. Nose is piney at first, tropical fruit notes as well. Tastes grapefruity and pineapple, resinous. Rather light bodied. Extremely well balanced. Not overly bitter, just right. long finish, This was well worth the wait!! One of the finest DIPAs Ive had.

Golden with a substantial white head. Pine resin is the prevailing aroma. Malt with a hint of breadiness is enveloped in an amazing hop embrace. For all its intensity it remains relatively light bodied. Both the malt and the hops are up close and personal yet maintain their distinction. A great example of intensity and balance.

On tap @ HopYard Pleasanton and First Street Alehouse in Livermore.  Orange, clear, thick white head.  Aroma and taste of pine, citrus, resin, and big and delicous hops.  Very clean, fresh, and no hint of alcohol for 8%.  Im a DIPA fan so its really my favorite go-to beer - and the one all others are measured by.  Long live Pliny!

Tap at brewery.. 10.28.12. Pour is a nice amber wit thick, white, fluffy head. Smell is grapefruit, lemon rind, pine, floral, perfume. Taste is bitter.. grapefruit, pineapple, malt, mango. Slight oily and sticky.. Incredible IPA.. def a west coaster.. good good beer.

On tap poured a golden hue w/ a large white frothy head w/ excellent lacing. Big aromas of citrus and pine. Initial flavor is a faint sweet followed by a heavy bitter finish that is one of the longest lasting finish durations Ive had in a beer. Taste is hop heavy citrus and pine. It tastes like Russian River Brewing has increased the hop at the expense of the balance Ive had before. Still a great Imperial IPA. Medium body, dry texture, and soft carbonation.

Rating #500!  Bottle graciously sent in a trade - thanks Angelo!  Pours a very clear orange with a hint of pink tint and a thick white head that settles slowly, leaving heavy lacing along the sides of the tulip glass.  Aroma is quite enticing - lively - citrus hops seem to come to the forefront, in particular grapefruit and other tropical fruit, but lots of piney/foresty hops come along for the ride...good level of sweetness is evident as well - plenty of dimension here, even if the hops are obviously center stage.  Flavor is surprisingly a bit more one-dimensional...forest hop bitterness comes through in a serious way.  Some citrus notes do join the parade, but I must say I expected a bit more of a malt backbone.  Resinous and chewy palate, this remains quite easy to drink despite the very high level of bitterness - alcohol is completely hidden.  Did this one live up to the hype and my quite lofty expectations...sort of, but not completely...  Is this a fine IIPA - definitely so - Id happily drink these on a regular basis (which is awesome, since I have two more in wait)  Prost!
UPDATED: AUG 27, 2013 Bottle in a trade from mwbrady12. Definitely glad I got to try it. Floral hoppy aroma but slightly on the bitter side of balanced. I think Enjoy By tops this one just a bit.

Best beer around --if you can get your hands on it!  We frequent a restaurant in West Seattle -Circa-and its the only place we can find it---on occasion !  Its just a great --not overly hoppy--double IPA !

Pours dark golden. Aroma is pine and citrus and malt. Taste is excellent , one of the best IPAs Ive had. Citrus, pine, honey. Perfect palate feel for the style and excellent finish. Well done IPA and among the best.
This is why this beer is rated #1 year after year. My only complaint is they need to make more of it and not just for their restaurants.

Bottle from mikem409 and his amazing generosity. Pours translucent golden amber with a thick foamy slight off white head thats leaves intricate lacing pattern. Nose of grapefruit, pine, and tangerine. Taste adds a canned peaches. Solid malt body.

Had this one on tap a few times and it always has been a very tasty brew but never rated it. this came to me at a beer tasting in bottle. Big hoppy brew with a peach aroma. tasty brew with a real juicy fruit note and a resinous quality, classic IPA and tasty stuff.

Pours a crisp clean golden color with a three finger sticky foam that laces and sticky nicely. On the nose its focused and inviting with bright hop notes; citrus, pine, spruce and a bit of sweet pineapple and cracker malts. The palate is well balanced and focused. Nice beautiful mouthfeel from start to finish with light caramel sweetness that mixes wonderfully with the front end of the hop flavors... then turning earthy with traces of woodsy spice and resinous sap... clean on the finish !

Consumed one month after bottling.  Aroma is weaker but a complex hop aroma of pine, citrus and orange.  Flavor is initially clean with heavy hops and sweet malt.  The backend is a nice dry bitterness and clean hops.  Mouthfeel is full and carbonation is average.  Overall this is a great beer.
The aroma is amazing and sweet, malty in feel, it has citrus and pine flavors and also has my ideal balance of a strong but smooth hoppy bitterness.

Clear pale yellow with a small pale head. Aroma is passionfruit, honey, tropical fruit, hint of pine. Medium bodied, bitter on the palate with a pretty good balance, hides the ABV pretty well. Taste is passionfruit, pine, honey. I think this is a little over-hyped, Ive had IIPAs with a better balance.

Backlog rating 12-13-08. (Bottle)  This beer poured a small white head that mostly diminished, fair amount of lacing, very little carbonation observed, and a straw hue.  The Aroma is hoppy, citrus and grapefruit.  The Flavor is hoppy, slightly bitter, grapefruit, malty, and some alcohol.  The Palate is tingly and this is a medium bodied beer.  Overall, this is more than worthy of a try, a beer for hopheads and a beer I would drink again.

Great IPA. But by far not the best. After all the hype I was expecting the holy grail of beer but it was just another awesome IPA. Light and brilliant gold color with an amazing hop aroma. Clean and smooth with a beautiful briggt white head and lacing. Amazing IPA, but dont think Ill go an hour out of my way for another.
Taste reminds me of a Stone Ruination or Stone ipa. Great color, smell and taste but a slight letdown. It was built up to mythical status, so I expected a lot more. Very good though none the less.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2013 2010 ... yes, the seller aged this IPA. Golden glow, foamy head and particles galore.  Aroma of malty, bread, earthy hops and maybe ginger.  Mouthfeel is ultra-smooth, with a decent hop bite -- pretty mellow for an IPA, but this makes it drinkable.  Citrusy earthy hops on the taste. Very good.  Would love to try it fresh.

Went on a search for this one on Napa wine trip and not easy to find.  Finally able to purchase at grocery store in Healdsburg CA and poured into wine glass at hotel room.  Nicely balanced IPA with great mouth feel.  Mild hops and pine with some citrus. That being said, not sure that all the hype is warranted as there are other IPAs that compare favorably.   Definitely worth trying though.
Suposo que no fa falta cap presentació. Tot el que sha escrit sobre ella és veritat. Molt gran!
This is an amazing double IPA. Stong hopps with a great aroma.  Definately recomend.

Pliny is by far one of the best beers I have ever had.  Annually one if the WORLD'S best beers

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hey look at that, a beer I rated on paper 9 months ago and it was just too darned special to enter right away.... so here goes for 2400!
A bottle bottle generously bonused to me by ineedbeer within maybe a week or two of its bottling date! 
The beer pours a golden color with a big fluffy white  head and a nice lacing on the glass.

The aroma is piney and herbaceous. There are some fruit forward elements like pine and orange-peel, a little mild alcohol character slips in there as well. The beer is remarkably aromatic and hoppy. 

The flavor is piney with some big citrus character. The bitterness is fairly high, but its not unbalanced, astringent or unpleasant in any way. Lots of grapefruit flavor, the alcohol character is very mild and some nice flavors of melon rind and honey are very light but complimentary to the whole. 

The mouth feel fairly prickly & the beer does that tongue bracing sensation that really great hoppy beers seem to do.  


And now for a bonus rate: 
My brother-in-law Dwain crushed this beer with me. Dwain is a Budweiser enthusiast who recently gave me a call to let me know about the new "Budweiser Black Crown"... when Dwain saw me writing notes he asked me to take down a few of his own. So here goes....
Aroma:
This beer smells like pine.

Flavor: 
Really piney. Sort of salty, might be a good beer to add a little salt to.

Overall:
Im just shocked at how good this beer tastes. This isnt even a lager! 


And now for a Lushawn bonus rate: 
Im totally shocked at how good this beer tastes. And by shocked I mean completely unsurprised in any way, shape, or form.

Not very hoppy because the malt helps hide it. The malt gives it a sweetness. Smooth finish making it easy to drink despite the high %ABV. It's good but I wouldn't consider it a Top 5 beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dont really get all the hype about Pliney. I had it at RR, and on tap at Mcnears in Petaluma. Seems to be lacking in the hop dept for my taste. 
It is a nice tasting beer but nothing to write home about.

Huge thanks to Josh up at Sweet Grass Dairy! Golden pour with a sudsy white head that laces. Aroma is super fresh tropical fruit hops, grapefruits, pineapple and peaches. Bright, vibrant  hops character throughout the whole beer with a long lasting bitter finish. Damn tasty beer. Having Heady Topper first I still like it better.

this is said to be an even better IIPA than heady topper, does that possibility even exist? lets find out ! 
thanx to douglas for trading me this long-time-wanted bottle ( its not even that rare yet its very hard to get ... )
pours very clear, orange, small white foam. very hoppy smell, nice ! 
hmm... very fruity as well ! just like HT . soft carbo makes it realy drinkable ! aftertaste is more bitter. lasts long. damn fine beer! yet in my opinion, heady was even more ectremely hopped, and had even more aftertaste. this IS a damn good IIPA, but im afraid it will come second in my list of favourites of the genre... 
maybe its slightly to old? im guiessing 3-4 weeks ... all the HT i had was 1,5 weeks max... 
but still, pliny proves to have a rightious place in the top 50

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2013 Pours gold color, huge pillowy head that?s sticks around for a while. Aroma is sweet hops citrucy piney floral some orange peel and grapefruit. Taste is sweet hops citrucy very piney resiney floral not bitter but a sweet kind of bitter and just enough malt to finish the sip but hoppy all the way back. Has a slight funk barnyard to it that is uniquely good a bit gamie in a good way. Hard to discribe. Nice smooth mouth feel medium body great lacing. This lives upto all the hype no doubt. One of the best tasting beers I?ve had so far.

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2013 Bottle from trade with michaelinwa.  3 weeks since bottled date.  Pours a clear, bright golden orange color with a perfect 1 inch head that fades slowly and never completely goes away.  Very oily aroma packed with hop resin, citrus, pine, and flowers.  Taste is good.  Nice balance of flavors throughout.  Strong bitterness balances nicely with the fresh citrus, pine, and floral hops.  Strong malt backbone.  Oily mouthfeel.  While this is not my favorite DIPA its still pretty solid.

This is truly an amazing IPA. 

Pour into a snifter with one finger head. The brew is clear as day. You can see right through it.

The nose is upfront. Sweet and citrusy.

Taste is crisp and cool. Grapefruit notes.

Mouthfeel is smooth and thin. Perfect IPA body.

I'm so happy I got a chance to savor this Cali IPA!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2013 Draft. Always been one of my favorite ipas on the planet. Decided to wait for the best batch I have ever had and I think that was yesterday at Monks cafe. Pours a hazy golden with medium sized fluffy white head, amazing lacing. Aromas and taste of heavy pine, grapefruit, lemons and a touch of malt to counteract the copious amounts of hop goodness. Perfect amount of bitterness in the finish. This beer is so zesty and dank. My go-to ipa in the city when its available. Cheers Vinny. Re rate, after trying the best Alpines and Hill Farmsteads or anything from VT for that matter, I have decided to reduce my rating a good margin. This beer just doesnt cut it anymore for a hop head. Still solid when super fresh but lacks the dankness some other brewers are putting out.

On tap into a tulip glass. One finger of head on a medium straw colored body.
Its aroma is pine and lemon in a wonderful blend.
The taste has a big malt backbone with moderate bitterness, lemon.
Smooth texture with moderate carbonation and medium body.
Obviously its a good drink.

Had this before.. was amazed.. now I am on rate beer so I decided I needed to rate it. Amazing.. aroma is like clean pine. Taste is nice hope pine with a clean finish. The thing that I love about this beer is a strong hop in the front with a so smooth clean finish. Love the pale ale line of beers and this is the champ for me personaly.

One of the best Imperial IPAs I have ever tried. Had this on tap at the RRB brewpub and also in bottle. Amazing both times. Aromas of citrus and pine. Very good balance between hops and malt. Amazing beer.

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2013 Bottle at home. Pours a remarkably clear yellow. One finger head with beautiful lacing. Aroma is stunning grapefruit and pine. Taste is of floral hops, sweet malt - fantastic balance, especially for a double IPA. Muted bitter finish, dry and clean. Very well crafted - lives up to its rep. Id be in trouble with better availability.

Pours golden with white head.  Aroma is citrus and dank hops.  Taste is floral, citrus, and bitter hops with a nice sticky hop note left on the palate.  Just enough sweetness to balance it.  Was sad when the glass was empty.

Bright translucent orange with a small white head and light messy lacing.  Aroma is floral and fruity. Flavor is great,  just a bit bitter with amazing citrus fruity hops. Nicely balanced with light malts makes it very smooth drinking.

Bottle from 12.27.12. Consumed 1-13-13. 

A; Clear golden yellow with champagne bubbles. Nicely carbonated head. A quick swirl leaves a treacly cascade.

N: Blend of citrus and pine. Medicinal, grapefruit, pineapple, mango, and earth. Grass and minor levels of biscuit. 

T: So incredibly balanced and tasty. Pine and earth. Pineapple, mango, grapefruit. Has a lush deep fragrance of hops backed by a hint of malt sweetness. Peppercorn and more spruce. Quite bitter, but deliciously so. 

M: Dry, sticky, and refined. No alcohol. This is sublime.

O: Still the standard DIPA. As the hops arm race continues, its a good reminder to us that we still need the all around complete version that doesnt succumb to over hopping or exotic varietals. Drink it, enjoy it, love it.

Draught @ green dragon Portland or.  You know the deal.                                 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thanks russ for sending these as extras

Clear golden, very good carbonation.  Flavor was bright, pine, citrus and beautifully hopped.  drank both back to back, great representation of the style, highly suggest

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2013 An unreal beer experience on a trip to the West Coast. Draught at Monks Kettle in San Francisco.  Intensely hoppy with the best aroma in a beer I have ever had; grassy, grapefruit; tropical fruits; incredibly intense.  Initially bitter, there is huge notes of grapefruit and pine resin and a wonderful finish. Terrific beer.

Clear golden color with tight, big head and great lacing.  Big citrus aroma that is crisp and fresh.  Citrusy flavor with just enough malt sweetness to keep it from being to sharp.  Some pine also present and resiny bitter aftertaste that becomes more palatable for me the more I drink.   I can see why this is so acclaimed.  Perfect representation of the style.  Even though its not my style, I can really appreciate it and liked it more than other imperial IPAs I've had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Wonderfully complex hop aromatics with citrus, pine, and tropical fruit notes. The malt backbone has just the right amount of sweetness and biscuit and toffee character.  Intense hop flavor, but no overpowering bitterness. Intriguing and intense, yet quite sessional. I wouldnt change a thing.

Citrus and pine smell.  Pours golden color with half finger head.  Taste is citrus and pine.  Good lacing with a bitterness that was not as overwhelming as I was anticipating.  Not my favorite style but not bad.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
