Good stuff after trading for a bottle on these forums.  Drank about 1 month after bottle date.  Comparable to my local favorite Surly Abrasive.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2015 Fresh in trade from IBrew2or3. Thanks! Bottled 12/27/12, drank 1/11/13. Decided to make this my 50th DIPA tried. Pours a nice golden color with one finger head. Aroma comes off this thing like heaven. Floral pine notes abound, with a zesty citrus on the nose. Thr flavor is a piney orange bite with a lot more body than I had expected. Citrus aftertaste balanced nicely with the malt backbone that still highlights that great hop flavor. Medium resiny mouthfeel. Very smooth. Hop candy for sure. Highly rated for good reason. I think there are a few I like better in the style, but this is awesome.

Bottle. Clear golden pour, average head. Fresh hop aroma - citrus (but not grapefruit), peach, apricot, grilled pineapple, and mellow caramel in the distance. The body is light for the IBU and ABV, carrying the fresh hop flavors perfectly. The finish is dry and bitter and fruity. The benchmark for the style, for sure.

On tap at russian river, pours gorgeous copper orange little soapy suds. Good lacing. Smells floral, pineapple, and piny. Tastes bomb citrusy, pineapple, resinous, beautiful light biscuity and carmel malt flavors. The hops stand out and are well complimented with the subtle malt flavors.

Ringing in the New Year with a true gem.  Bottle->snifter.  Hazy gold with faint head.  Aroma of grapefruit, pine, hops.  Deep and pleasant.  Tastes of sweet malt and hops, with citrus and floral notes.  Smooth finish.  Outstanding.

Nice pour. Clearer than i expected. Aroma is pine, fresh cut grass, hint of malt. Taste starts floral and bitter, sweetens, then finishes piney with bitter hops. Clean yet complex enough. Very drinkable. A standard for a DIPA. Hits all the points it should and in the right amounts.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2013 Bottle through RB user kaufmanised bottled on 25/11/12 drank 27/12/12 so still quite fresh; pours golden yellow/orange almost lager like, white head, juicy grapefruit tangerine aroma, fruity hop forward taste, big piney hit, resinous mouth feel, malty goodness kicks in which is perfectly balanced with hops, quite bitter not sure of the IBUs Id put it around 85. This is an awesome beer hope to meet again.

Bottle from friend in the USA; bottled on 25/06/13 drank 14/07/13, drank from a Russian River tulip, the extra week of freshness from our previous meeting meant the hop were more pronounce, the leapt from the bottle of pouring, great amount of grapefruit, mandarin beautifully balanced with malts, no sweet toffee that you can get with some big American DIPA, drank 4 bottles on the evening.

Really nice DIPA.  Not sure its clearly far and away better than all the others, but its right up there. I would certainly buy it often if it was readily available.  At $5.99 for 16 oz, its a very reasonable value.

This was just okay.  Dreadnaught and Jai Alai are much more memorable beers.  It was good, crisp and clean, bit after all the hype and all the reviews, it was good, not amazing.  I was looking for more.

My first Russian River beer! Pours a classic sunset orange color with a two finger off white head that dissipates slowly and leaves great lacing. Great carbonation coming off the glass. Pungent, dank hops as soon as the bottle is opened. Get grapefruit, mango, peach, and lots of tropical fruit like a papaya, guava, or pineapple. Slight sweet bready malt in the background. Taste is insane. Starts with a ton of sweet, fruity flavors from the hops: peach, mango, grapefruit, some pine. Then get some bread from the malt, as well as some carmel sweetness that balances it slightly. The finish makes this beer. Lots of resinous tropical fruits like the papaya or guava mentioned earlier, as well as more grapefruit, pineapple, mango, pine. Very dry and bitter finish that lasts on the palate. Some alcohol but goes well with the flavors. Tastes very much like a fruit salad in my opinion. The carmel, bready malt does last through the finish to try to balance the enormous amounts of hops. Pretty full body with a creamy and sticky mouthfeel with nice refreshing carbonation. Lives up to the hype in my opinion. A hopheads dream beer and one of the most flavorful double ipas Ive had in recent memory.

Initial citrus taste. Very smooth. Appealing aroma.  Alcohol not readily apparent.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Happy Christmas to me, not my first Pliny... but my first review of therin for Happy Christmas nonetheless. Ha. Bottle to Duvel tulip, a lovely orange hue that is crystal clear with a huge pillowy/cloudy 3 finger head. Grapefruit/Citrus fruit blast to the face, fucking beautiful aroma. Aggressive hop profile without ever being too bitter, tons of depth of complexity. Grassy, tangy, floral, citrus, every hop charachteristic you could ask for masterfully blended. This beer lives up to the hype without question, medium to full mouthfeel, low but perfect carbonation. Great lacing as it goes down, finish is smooth and long and linger-ery. This beer is DIPA tops for a reason and I whole-heartedly concur! Seek this beer out and drink it fresh. (mine was dated 11.25, right around a month not to shabby, especially since it made it to Michigan) Word!
UPDATED: JUL 31, 2013 Well with all the hype about this beer it lived up to all of it. Has the perfect amount of hops with a great malty backbone. Must try if you can find it.

500 ml bottle courtesy of my secret santa joeneugs. Bottled on November 26, 2012 so less than a month old. Pours tiny hazy golden with a big frothy white head that slowly dissipates while leaving lots of sticky lacing and trace on the glass. Smell is fruity and very hoppy fresh with crackers, grapefruit juice, pine needles, papaya, unripe pineapple, dried flowers, orange zest, dried apricots, blackcurrant leaves, freshly cut grass, lime leaves and hints of star fruit. Taste is fruity, floral and hoppy fresh with crackers, grapefruit juice, papaya, star fruit, freshly cut grass, lemon zest, strawberries, white bread, blackcurrant jam, lemon grass and hints of lychee and alcohol. Mouthfeel is dry, round, tiny hoppy crisp, very tiny astringent, tiny boozy and medium bodied. Finish is dry, fruity and tiny herbal with crackers, grapefruit juice, freshly cut grass, tangerines, white bread, black currant jam, star fruit, papaya and hints of alcohol. Amazingly balanced and elegant. Im very happy to have tried this and very happy Joe got it here fresh. Thank you very much and Merry Christmas!
The smell really sets this DIPA apart from others that I have tried. Just a great beer and well worth the effort to get

Cloudy orange look, floral and citrus smell, more of a grapefruit scent. Awesome taste, perfect balance for an IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2013 Serving: from tap at Brouwers Cafe.

Aroma: heavily hoppy, floral.

Appearance: average-sized, creamy, white, initial head with fair lacing and fully diminishing longevity.  Clear, flat, light-amber body.

Taste: heavily hoppy, lightly bitter initial flavor and finish and long duration.

Palate: medium to full body with watery texture and flat carbonation

Overall: very hoppy aroma without an excessively bitter taste.  Lives up to its reputation.  Truly outstanding.

Waited a long time to try this one  Orange gold color. Large head. Aroma is floral hops, fruity and sweet. A medium to full bodied Imperial IPA. Malts are fruity and sweet. Hops are grapefruity, piney, floral and citrusy. A remarkably well-balanced IPA. Malts and hops clash and balance with every sip. Hoppy and bitter yet fruity and sweet. Great hop signature. Creamy full mouthfeel. NICE beer. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is bitter.

Bottle from cannon. Thx cannon.  Very aromatic. Bottled 11/26. Grapefruit taste as well. Crisp and bitter. Lingers. Some white lacing. Cloudy. Really nice and the allure of the beer makes it special. I've had dipa's that are just as tasty but its like a Cuban cigar. It's hard  to get and makes it better. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft - I cant believe after so many bottles and taps I havent rated this yet.  Smells like a pine forest, over the top hops in an absurdly fantastic way.  Pale clear with a thin but persistent head.  Tastes of grapefruit and has a nice bitterness to back it up.  Nice oily mouth feel.  Is it as good as the hype, in a word yes.

Evrything you want in an IPA...  Dark gold copper in color.   Strong citrus and pine aroma.  Assertive malt backbone with a fruity banana minty pine flavor.  Overall... What else do you want in an IPA?

Pint on tap.  Golden yellow color, laces well, bubbly head fades down.  Aroma is clean, not too strong.  Tastes like citrus, hops, fresh greens...a whole lot of flavor, and great mouthfeel.  Both dry and bitter, but surprisingly warm.  Highly recommended!

This one is as good as beer gets.  Pours with plenty of white frothy head.  More hops than you I thought was possible to fit in one beer yet it still manages to posses hints of citrus flavor.  Many layers of flavor and quite frankly a little challenging to put you finger on just one. As good if not better than any beer I've tasted.

Bottle.  Pours amber with some sediment, with a thick white head.  Great tropical fruit aroma.  Taste was sweet and smooth; honey, malt, fruity hops, with a slightly burning bitter finish.  A perfectly balanced double IPA, and a real treat - thanks to Michelle and Eric for sharing this one with me!

Poured from the bottle at home.  This has a very clear and still, bright golden body with a fair amount of foam and some lacing.  The aroma is pine hops and a bit of malt.  The flavor is complex.  The hops hit big up front, and then theres a mellow mix of tones... buttery malt, a little caramel.  Theres citrus in the nose that lingers after each sip, inviting the next one.  I enjoyed it.  I dont believe Ill bust my ass to get it again, but Id buy it if it were readily available.

On tap at Breakwater Brewing. Aromas of grapefruit, pine, more citrus and a little apricot. Pours a light gold with a hint of amber. Great lacing but little head. Taste is big pine and grapefruit with subtle pine resin and spice. Finish is dry with an enjoyable astringency and slight sweetness. World class beer by definition.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2013 Pours a slightly cloudy deep gold. Incredible, fresh citrus notes from the start. Perfectly balanced DIPA, pretty much says it all. Not malty, not sweet, just enough bitterness. Wish I had more than one! Prost!

22 oz. bottle from my secret source.

Too good for words.  I get pineapple, hops and malt...all in perfect balance.  


Too good.
This beer is the best in my opinion. Russian River did an outstanding job. It almost has an apricot after taste that really compliments the initial taste once it hits your palate!

Very smooth, super well balanced, and incredibly fresh IPA. There's a fresh citrus taste that is not as pronounced in other IPAs. Not overly bitter or hoppy -- I.e., not an "extreme" IPA. I'd love to see a triple version of this, and now want to try the Younger. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Strong tropical fruit aroma, especially pineapple. Its fresh tasting and offers a good balance of the sweet, fruity elements and the bitterness of the hop in the finish.

Pours amber gold, frothy white head. nose is piney, resinous, grassy hops. More grassy hops in the flavour. Mouthfeel is light and lively. Quite bitter in the finish. The quintessential American hoppy IPA.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2012 Wow definitely the best double IPA I have had the pleasure If sampling.  Incredibly well balanced and essentially the archtypical double IPA.  Juicy and sweet bready malts with a massive citrus based hop profile.  Yum.  Definitely a treat to have a draft at Monks.
This is obviously one of the best on the beer market. The aroma is amazing, the taste is amazing. This is in my top five beers!

510ml shared bottle,thanks Shaun.This is a clear golden beer which pours with a thin white head.Strong aromas of pine,grapefruit,lemon and a bit of peach too.Strong hop aromas in there as well..Nicely carbonated.The taste is very hoppy,almost too hoppy.Grapefruit comes through quite strong with the lemon,resin and pine in there as the nose suggests.Well balanced and the strength of 8% is well hidden.Glad i had the oppurtunity to try this one.

510ml bottle, 21 days old based on bottle dating. Nice gold pour, filtered, goo head and lacing. Aroma is sweet grapefruit and malt. Taste is a wonderful balance between sweet and bready malt plus citrus and pine hops. Body is thick and just a little sticky. Alcohol strong enough to make my lips numb. Overall, wonderful stuff. Shame I live on the opposite side of the continent from it.

Half a pint from the tap at City Choice Butcher in Fort Collins.
Hazy golden color with a nice white head.
Tropical fruit dominate the nose with lots of pines, pomelo and grapefruit.
Clean juicy malt, citrus peels, fresh grass and high bitterness.
Med-full body, medium finish, very good but somewhat overrated.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2013 Citrus, herbal hop aroma. Fruity (grapefruit, apricot, tangerine) and spicy hop flavor. Nice balance of malt sweetness. Dated 031413; drank 4/1013.

Strong hop aroma, nice hop flavor. Good malt backbone; not too sweet, some bready flavor that goes well with the hops. Dated 12/28/10; Drank 5/23/11.

Random on tap at the Pine Box. Pours yellow-orange with a small white head leaving great lacing. Perma-cling! Aroma has citrus pine and that burnt bacon overhop smell. T: follows the aroma; spicy pine, bitter citrus and burnt bacon. Balance is highly overrated anyway. Quite syrupy. No noticeable alcohol. Finishes mostly bitter and more bitter. And makes you notice it is bitter. Over the top hops. Wheres the negative here ...
great hop aroma and really not all that bitter for a DIPA considering some of the others. This is inline with my preference of strong citrus and green hop aromatics IPAs

a grapefruit cocktail drink,nothing more/nothing less.i had part of 2 bottles,one 37 days old and one 18 days old and could not taste any (freshness) difference.
i am not looking for attention or want feedback about my scores,so i will grade this in line with others as i "clearly" do not get this beer.if i were to give an honest score,it would be low because this is not what i call beer!

Bottle. Aroma is hoppy, but also floral. Nice looking golden beer. The taste a nice hop flavor with a very balanced floral flavor. Great palate for an ipa. Overall, prolly the best double ipa i have ever had.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2012 Appearance was clear amber gold with creamy diminishing off white 1 finger head, spotty lacing. Aromas are citrusy hops, sweet caramel, honey, crystal malts with candi sugars in background. Taste was sweet malts backbone then hoppy apricot, orange, lemon, resin, pine, no alcohol present. Palate was smooth creamy CO2 with meduim body, then average length hoppy sticky sweet finish. A wonderful IIAP...vintage 2011.

First, Im rating this about a month after Ive had it, but I felt like this is the perfect time to do so... right after a bad rating by Dennrat.Aroma is one of the most pleasant IPA floral bouquets that I had the privilege of smelling.  There are some that are comparable, but this is right there at the top of the list.Appearance: Just what a double IPA should look like.Taste: The Simplisty of this Double IPA is what makes it so good.  It is perfectly balanced and to the exact opposite of what Dennrat says the bitterness is at the beginning and smooth the rest of the way.  Obviously Dennrat has not had many IPAs or DIPAs.  If your taste buds havent adapted to the bitterness yet I could see Pliny being bitter.Palate:  It is very drinkable and smooth, but in its simplicity I wish it would linger a bit longer.Overall: I loved it and appreciate it for what it is.  When I see it again I will buy as many as they let me :)

PS. Sorry to single you out Dennrat, but you obviously are not an IPA fan.  Just dont understand why you would rate one of the best DIPA when it is not what you like?

Does it live up to the hype?No. I guess Im the odd man out.  The Emperor is wearing no clothes. Aroma is good, sweet and astringent, apricot/orange and orange peel.The appearance is fine. The taste is unbalanced. The bitterness bubbles too strong to the back of the mouth leaving an unpleasant 
aftertaste. The palate is fine. Overall for my taste, sweetness and bitterness should have been blended better.  Being a new beergeek, Im not that sophisticated yet, so Ill take a Dogfish Head 90 Minute over "The Elder"
any day.
Got from a Cali trade. Best Russian river. Large head with citrus aromas. Tastes like grapefruit, orange, and lemons
Best beer ever RR is one of the best brewery base on this beer in my humbled opinion.
I love this beer . I wish Russian River would Brew more !! Like a fresh grapefruit in a pint !! Yummy !

Nice golden color and a little white head, pretty. Citrus lemon pine smell, nothing you wouldn't expect to smell from an IPA. Taste is very smooth and the bitter is very subtle a nice pine taste and very little after taste. Not an IPA man but not too shabby. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

17.25oz bottle, thanks to Ron for bringing this back to me. Bottled 10/1/12, enjoyed 10/29/12. Clear orange gold color. Good thin white head, leaves good lace. Resiny, piney hop nose. Mmm...  Yep, this is a good DIPA. Big pine, grapefruit, light pineapple, grassy flavors. Definitely fresh-tasting. Big hop flavor, impressive even for 8%. Good bitter taste, some zest. Smooth, lighter carbonation, dry texture. Crisp. Easy to drink, but supremely flavorful. Very long, wonderful aftertaste. Its got that assertive light hop bite in the finish, love it. Great DIPA, and love the 17.25oz bottle size... But was still wishing I had more once I finished it off

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2013 OK - people said this beer was as good as the Heeady Topper... Well, I have to be honest, I like the Heady Topper a tad better. This being said, this still is one of the best DIPAs that I have tasted. Bottle from the Brewery itself; Pours orangy yellow wuth a nice white head, disappearing after some minutes. Aromas are lots of exotic fruits, especially peach and pineapple, a bit of citrus, eucalyptus and smoke. Full creamy body (this is where the difference with the HT is biggest) with perfect balance between sweet and bitter up to the bridge, after the sweet wears out and the bitterness becomes very subtle up to a looooong dry finish. Impressive! Taste is stoved peach and smoky bacon crisps.

Enjoyed on draft at Stone Brewing in California. Pours a bright gold with a thick, lacy head. The bright smell of hops is astonishingly strong. The taste is of wet and juicy California hops - surprisingly not very dry at all. The hops/citrus flavor lingers in the aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from bottle.  Nice hazy light gold color.  Nose is a bit subdued compared to Heady.  Pine forward, tons of simcoe hops in this one.  Orange and pine.  Taste is really balanced for the style.  Little cereal malt with bitter orange peel and long pine notes.  Really nice oily mouthfeel.  A great brew.
The mother of all Double IPAs.  The finest of its style.  This was the beer that turned me into a hop head and will always be my desert island beer!
Really, what can I say about this golden nectar of the gods that hasnt already been said?? Damn. Good. Beer.
Unreal. I hope I get to taste this beer again. Hands down the best DIPA Ive had. Ever. Thanks, RRB.

Bonus (!) from a trade with Westy84, thanks Scot! Pours a nice and light golden with a pretty small head. Smells like grapefuit and peaches, were in for a treat! Flavor-wise it translates into a piney goodness with a little more peaches! Malt is low profile but its there, making the experience ever more pleasing. Bitterness is never distracting even if it stays for a long while in the aftertaste. Believe the hype, this one is for real!

Review #250

500 ml bottle split three ways, served in a Surly Darkness snifter. Big thanks to my girlfriend who got this for me for Christmas.

A: Pours a clear golden straw color with a very lively body. A fluffy pure white head forms on the pour and recedes to a thick collar that leaves lots of lace down the glass.

S: Subtle fruits are present, mostly pears and apples, with a little bit of grassy hops thrown in for good measure. The solid caramel malt backbone is well integrated.

T: Malty body with some subtle citrus type fruits. Follows the nose pretty well. There are some herbal/grassy qualities as well.

M: Off the charts drinkability. I can drink this like water. Its so smooth, just the right carbonation level to keep you interested. Buttery mouth feel.

O: Well its not a game changer by any stretch of the imagination, but its insanely drinkable. The drinkability and the taste reminds me of a tamed Ephraim from Hill Farmstead.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 01-01-2012

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2012 Pretty clear deep orange color. One finger white head. Aroma is piney, grapefruit, sweet malts, orange, fruits, sweet. Taste is spicy malt, pine, grapefruit, orange, really balanced DIPA, orange lemon, A very awesome balanced DIPA. Good but I dont see where all the hype comes from. There are more easily accessable DIPAs out there just as good! Still: one of the best ;)

OK! Having had this several times on Cali and at the brewpub I will upgrade my rating! This is one hell of an DIPA! Love this beer to death!
This is one of my absolute favorites but I think its mostly the satisfaction of putting this delicious beer up to my lips after searching for weeks to find it.
On draft at toronado bar in san diego. Pours a medium amber with a slight white head. Big aroma with grapefruit citrus hops. Subdued bitterness.  Very tasty.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2013 510mL bottle from Sherman Oaks whole foods. Medium clarity tan/yellow pour. White head settled to 3/4 inch or so. Strong scent. Sweet pineapple, plum and orange citrus. Medium light body with medium (appropriate) carbonation. Flavor is pretty light for the style in my opinion. Really well blended between malt and hops. Juicy citrus hop flavor, very juice-like. Finish is malty bitter, a little grapefruit soda too. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Review number 75 cheers and Happy National drink a beer day! Pours a golden copper color with a thick fluffy off white head with awesome lacing. Smells of grapefruit, orange, pine, and floral notes from the hops. Tastes of all the same things mentioned above with a really good hop bite on the back end. As it warms flavors get even better. Mouthfeel is amazing for a double ipa great chewyness and carbonation with a dry finish. This is only the fourth time I?ve had it and its been amazing every time. Overall it is well balanced and is definitely worth driving out of the way for if you can get your hands on a bottle or 2. It?s a toss up for me for the best tasting double ipa between this and 90 minute Ipa, but this gets an edge hop wise.

On tap Toronado. Deep gold pour, little hazy. Little head. Ring of lace. Loaded down with grapefruit and spruce. Just enough caramel maltiness to hold it all together. Much the same on the palate. Quite light in body for the style.
Bottle pour.  Pours golden amber with a huge white head.  Aroma is hops, pine, floral.  Flavor is pine, citrus and huge hops.  Finishes bitter.  Very good.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2014 A drinkable ale with a very stiff bitter, hops finish. Floral, a bit of citrus. Not overdone like some Double IPAs, but it?s no hack, it?s done well, balanced beer with a tilt towards bitter hops. The beer itself has nice flavor, well balanced. I remember it pouring golden with a bit of red and slightly dry on the tongue.

Bottle from Windy City Liquor----> nonic.  Pours red orange with small white head and great lacing.  Aroma is sweet candied orange and grapefruit.  Taste is muted floral hops with very mild bitterness on the back end.  Very smooth palate with little carbonation.  Probably a top 10 DIPA, but not the best Ive had.

Pours attractive gold, soft off-white head. Intense and complex hop aroma: resin, pine, floral. Soft carbonation. The flavor is dominantly piney and woodsy, with resinous, citrus supporting notes and a quiet supporting malt bill. Finishes dry and bitter but not overbearing. Still my favorite IPA, lives up to the hype and manages to be unique and distinctive, which is becoming rarer in the flooded IPA market. A brewing triumph.

Faint aromas of grapefruit and pine.  Very smooth, not too bitter.  The flavor is much weaker than most double IPAs ive had.  Lighter on the hops than I was expecting.  Considering all the hype, this was one of the bigger dissapointments Ive had.  Shared with my dad and brother.  We followed with Dreadnaught immediately after, all 3 agreed Dreadnaugt was significantly better.  I would classify this as a very good IPA, by no means one of the best beers in the world.
Tap - average size thick head, dark copper color, nice big pine hop aroma and flavor, fair size alcohol kick

Yeah, so, um, this stuff is amazing.  I finally got my hands on one and thank God because it was worth the hype.  Deep gold in color with slight head that leaves nice lacing.  Hops hit my nose as soon as I opened the bottle (citrus/pine).  Full mouth feel, the head is even a bit creamy, very awesome.  This is one of the best beers Ive ever had.  I have to give it perfects all around.

Thanks to bytemisis for this one. Pours a clear deep gold with a small head that doesnt hang around for long and some nice lacing. Aroma is dank pine and a bit of citrus, the Simcoe hops are up front. Taste is dry and bitter with more of the piney hoppiness, normally I prefer more of a malt backbone on IPAs but I think this really lets the hops come through in a great way. The mouthfeel is light and has medium carbonation with a finish that sticks around (my burps taste like Simcoe). Overall this bottle lives up to the hype, this is my second and the first one didnt impress me as much. Funny things may have happened during shipping, but if this is how Pliny is supposed to be than Californians are lucky.
Its a great beer, lots of hype but it is still awesome.citrus, amber, white foam, full body, lively,
16oz bottle picked up from brewery.excellent all around.  Lives up to reputation... Wish I had bought a few cases.  Great finish for a strongly hoppy beer.

Can't say enough about this special brew. Such a clean and smooth IPA that has the perfect bitter *punch* after each sip, without being too hoppy and overabundant. Highly, highly recommend. 

--- Follow me on twitter @NeedMoreHops
Perfect except for the chill haze (maybe it is just this bottle though).  Earthy aroma and spruce flavor.  This beer lingers on the tongue for quite some time so as not to be forgotten.

Thanks Dennis for the bottle. Pours a golden orange with a bit of white head that lingers. Smell is amazing, lots of hops, some pine, some citrus, even a tiny bit of sweetness. Palate is medium bodied and has good carbonation. Taste is bitter, lots of hoppy bitterness with a good rounded mix of hops. Aftertaste is also all hops. Overall, really good, a really nice example of the style.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2014 Growler pour.  Golden color, white head.  Light nose, bit of floral hops.  Flavor is light and crisp, some floral hops.  Good body, good carbonation.  I remember liking this a lot more from a bottle, will re-review when I get a bottle again.

Rerated from bottle, 4/23/14
Yeah its good. A bit overrated due to its cult following. But a very good 2X IPA. The best thing about it is how well it goes with a bunch of carrots and ranch!

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2012 Great if Fresh.Piney grapefruit aroma.Loses it flavor after a week.Hopslam.Sculpin and Ruination holds flavor longer.Still,the one beer you want if stranded on and island! The standard!
Dont take a whiff looking for nuance in this beer... its like opening a hop bag.  And with a pleasant alcohol warmth and medium-full body, this hop nectar is one of the best.

Bottle from Palme, many thanks for that! Lovely hazy orange coloured with a somewhat short-sized and -lived head. Huge on American hop aroma, striking in depth. Pine, white grapes, gooseberry, citrus and above all tangerine, just slightly more intense than the mango in here. Harmonic, deep and complemented by a soft maltiness. Full malty body, velvety carbonation, crisp tangerine-tropical hoppiness and a strong, citrus peel bitterness. Nicely hidden alcohol, lots of tangerine retronasal. Velvety carbonation, almost oily texture and a skillful interplay between the sweet and bitter elements. An example in harmony and depth. Obviously fantastic!

Wonderfully huge aroma, initially citrus and pine though as it sat, malt and a hint of yeast came through as well.   The flavor has a good mix of pine, citrus, and malt.  There is a hint of sourness and yeast, but it adds to the complexity rather than takes away from the flavor.  Very nice.

Very nice beer. Golden copper color. Creamy off white head. Great hop aroma. Taste is very balanced. Good malt character with the hops winning out in the end. If they were people I'd love to see a fight between Pliny and 90 Minute. 

---Rated via iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2012 1) [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ brewpub, Santa Rosa, CA, 13/08/12. Brilliant gold frilled with lace. Spliff and peach aroma. Punch-in-the tongue bitter with softening  rose, melon, red apple, Fruit Salad and grapefruit juice. Just the right tweak of countering biscuit- virtually none. Lean, biting and zesty with stewed and spliff-like notes. Ace.
2) Bottle at home, 18/12/12. A real lesson in hops for me this. Just 6 months has turned this to a peach bomb Im afraid. Soapy peach and orange Smartie aroma. Sweet floral and honeyed flavour thick with prefab peach flan notes. On this evidence, deeply average IPA. 737414

Poured into an English pint.  Medium amber with a crisp white head.  Aroma is pine and citrus hops.  Flavor is caramel malt with a lot of pine/spruce hops.  Palate is medium bodied with nice astringency.  Overall a dynamite IIPA.

Classic, textbook "West Coast" style... Skunky herbs, grapefruit rind and hints of pine on the nose. Smooth, balanced palate, with a hoppy bitter edge. More grapefruit, citrus and herbs on the finish, with elegant lingering notes citrus and subtle notes of caramel. The subtle textures and complexities of this beer give it an edge over many other West Coast IPA's, though the hassle and price to experience are big drawbacks. 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

On tap @ RR.  Most hyped craft beer ever?not over hyped though. I think pliney lives up to it.
Superbly crafted and balanced, hoppy with some malt backbone ties it all together. Outstanding beer-one of the all time greats.
Very good beer. But I expected more with all the hype. It's got lots of grapefruit citrus hops. And easy to drink at 8%. Overall great beer.

Hoppy and floral aroma and thick golden appearance with strong but balanced malt & hoppy taste.  Smooth drinking beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Great beer, Russian Rivers other beers are worth trying too.      

Blind Pig is to brandy as Pliny is to Cognac.




---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2013 RBAG Summer Session 2012. Pours a beautiful amber gold with a fluffy white head. Aroma, WOW, earthy, herbal, floral, all the archetypes of hop odours. Grapefruit is very prominent. Bitter and sharp, soft creamy mouth feel. Keeping this rating short as I think this bottle was a touch old and I want to re-rate fresh whenever I get that chance.

I don't even need to say anything about this one.  If you can get a hold of some, get it!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured into a tulip glas:  Great fluffy white head retention and lacing, nice gold/copper color and clarity.   Aroma: Evergreen/pine, tangerine,  honey. Flavor: Pine and grapefruit with a solid malt background.  Long finish of grapefruit, lingering sweetness.  Wonderful flavors, but what strikes me most is the extraordinary balance between the hops, malt and alcohol as well as the overall mouthfeel.  Im enjoying this immensely.

Bottle from ChiTownPackFan
Poured into a glass.
Poured a hazy orange/copper color with white, fluffly head. Solid lacing and the head lasted as I drank the beer. Smelled of nice hops, floral and citrus. Great hop flavor, incredibly well balanced. Excellent beer.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2012 Bottle. Clear dark gold pour with lacy white head, really pretty. Aroma is quite piney, lots of citrus as well, grapefruit, lemon peel. Taste is certainly bitter but the hops are actually quite sweet tasting, notes of honey and citrus. Palate is a bit "heavy" but finishes ok dry. Tasted side by side with Heady Topper and the east coast took this cake. 

On tap at Monks 30/08/12. Rating pretty much unchanged, highly drinakble for 8%, very hoppy and not too bitter. Very good, maybe my expectations were too high.

Bottle into a tulip..bottled on 7/25..so fairly fresh.nice orange color..1.5 finger head, active carbonation and pop indicating a fresh offering. Nose-resinous,citrusy goodness, tangerine dominant, very solid aroma. Quite smooth, leaving a wonderful mouthfeel and very little presence of the alcohol at all. Extremely happy to score a few fresh bottles of this. A terrific double, is it the best? To each his own, I think a few contenders from the Green Mt State easily edge this out...

On tap @ both Apex & Horse Brass. 16 and 10iz pour, respectively. Pours apple juice, white foamy head, good lacing. Aroma is heavy hops, grapefruit, little piney I guess. The most outstanding aspect of this beer is that initial flavor just after you swallow: its like a fruity bouquet of awesomeness explodes in your mouth-- like Fruit Stripe gum. Amazing smooth for 100 IBU, alcohol is amazingly well hidden. I feel like this could be a session beer, if not for the cost... And ABV. The best IPA Ive had, or likely will ever have.

Bottle: poured a hazy orange copper that cleared up a bit. The head fluffy lacing off white. Aroma is a nice citrus fruit and floral hops. Taste I nice hops front with a soft grain malt balance. Very fresh and drinkable thanks to timfoolery. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared at a tasting at idonis place. Thank you Excellent Little Brother for getting this to me! Pours murky amber with white film. Smells of evergreen and fresh skunk. Tastes of nori seaweed, bitter and sightly salty. Light body, hyssop finish. Amazing and unexpected.

Chased this beer for 2 months. Finally found a 2 week old 500ml Pliny.
Wow! Ive never had a better beer. I cant wait to try Pling the younger if I can find it.

RBAG summer 2012. From 500ml brown bottle. gold pour, very clear. Short white cap with light creamy edges. Grapefruity nose, trace of pine. In the mouth the beer was piney, grapefruity. Good bitter finish that lingers. Medium body, average carbonation.
I do not believe this is the end all be all for Imperial IPAs as most do. I agree this is a great beer but it lacks a certain complexity, while still being very balanced and excellent.

On tap @ Falling Rock in Denver.  Pours a clear, light orange body with a fine, dense, white, sticky head.  Big hop aroma of citrus.  Plenty of grapefruit and tangerine with a little bit of underlying breadiness from the malt.  Some pine is present, too, but its beneath the juicy citrus.  Hop flavors mirror the aroma.  Nice malt presence.  Light crystal sweetness balances the hops.  Medium-light body is fairly dry and keeps the beer drinkable.  Quite bitter without being harsh.  Alcohol presence is very low.  Hoppy finish.  Overall an excellent beer, but I have to admit being underwhelmed.  For me, it doesnt do enough to differentiate itself from the rest of the field.

Bottled 041712. Dank aroma with bright citrus notes. Soft light caramel balances the bitterness. Great drinking beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught at falling rock taphouse Denver CO. Pours clear gold with decent off white head and some lace. Aromas of grapefruit pine grass nuts grains and caramel. Medium light body, generous bitterness and a nice caramel sweetness. Couldnt be more balanced. Medium carbonation, creamy mouthfeel to cut through bitterness right through the finish. Tangy grapefruit lingers. An IIPA benchmark!
Bottle, 8%. Slightly hazy deep golden with small off-white head. Aroma is malt,fruit, hops and citrus. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, little sweet, pine, grapefruit and bitter.

Bottle from Bierkoning. Light hazy orange with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and rather hoppy - peach and grapefruit. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 108812

A good hoppy well-balanced IPA.  Nothing especially spectacular.  I can walk half a mile to nearly a dozen different bars that offer an IPA of similar quality.  Perhaps, Im fortunate to live in such a beer neighborhood.  Perhaps at nine months old this beer is too old.  But most likely Pliny the elder is over-rated.

While I love IPAs I think a beer maker can just do more with more complex and versatile styles such as belgian ales and especially imperial stouts.
Have had it a couple of times.  Just a great IPA, perfect balance.  Huge nose bouquet.  Always a treat when you can find it.
Overall beer IPA perfection. Great balance of flavors. I wish they distibuted to my area.

I saved this rating for my 400th. Recently voted the top beer in America, this beer poured a slightly hazy orange with a pretty white foam. Aroma was spicy, pine, and orange citrus. It was a very good balance without being catty. The malt backbone offered a great base for the hops to shine. Just the right balance of sweetness with a strong hop bitterness and flavor. The citrus and spice finished brilliantly. Bravo.
Bottle. Pours yellowish white heat. Smells not as strong as I thought it would be. Smells of citrus grapefruit mango oranges pine.  Really nice taste A little malt and caramel.
Bottle. Color dark orange with big white head. Aroma malt, caramel, hop, pine, orange. Taste bittersweet, peach, grapefruit, orange, hop.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2013 Thanks to Bruce for this one (drank Mar 12)! Bottled 3 weeks prior to me drinking.

Poured into a tulip glass to a golden amber colour with a decent finger of white head which retained well, it looks a treat almost too good to drink !

Hoppy aroma of grapefruit, pine and to a lesser extent orange. The smell was good but didnt bowl me over have smelt better DIPAs but as for the taste ...

Everything one could wish for in a DIPA!

Hops, pine, citrus fruit, grapefruit, tangerine, orange a little malt and breadiness in the backbone, excellent bitter/dry finish - spot on !

Mouthfeel pitched absoultely to perfection in terms of the correct level of carbonation, body, taste.

Overall a fantastic well balanced DIPA that belies the 8% alochol level in drinkability. This beer deserves the hype! Straight As!

Minor re-rate Dec 12 having brought a few bottles back from the US. Having compared against Boneyard Hop Venom I can no longer give Pliny 10/5/10/5/20. Still love my Pliny but really need to parallel taste this pair to see which comes out on top!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
A-- Yellowish gold color with a huge puffy white head. Got almost 2 fingers of head. Left some very nice lacing on the glass. 

S--Hops and citrus. Lemon seems prevelant. Very well balanced with the 2.

T-- Feel like I am eating cotton! Lots of hops mixed in with lemon. Taste really grows on you after a bit. Once again well balanced.

M-- Get the cotton lining in my mouth from the hops and a little bit of sweetness with a bit of lemon. Same as before it grows on you the more you drink it.

D-- My first Pliny and I admit I am not a DIPA fan but this is a good beer and drinkable. Like how well balanced it is on the hops and the citrus. Could easily drink 2 of these and be happy.
Note: have had several of it when back home in the US and opinion is the beer is a classic. Just moving reviews from other places

Pours a slightly hazy dark orange color with a white head, which after a minute settles into an almost clear appearance. The aroma is full of citrus, some floral notes, and some sweet notes like tangerine/orange, nice and crisp, mostly hops in the nose. The taste is pretty amazing, some of the bitterness can be strong on the first taste but once the malts catch up on the tongue, by the second taste it settles in to be incredibly balanced with sweetness. The malts are nice and caramally (is that a word?) with maybe some breadiness to them. The hops are strong in citrus flavor. The body of the beer falls pretty inline with other double IPAs as a medium bodied beer with moderate carbonation. 

The balance between hops & malts is really key with this beer, then coupled with the incredible aroma, this beer really stands out as one of the best.
Finally got to to try this one at a local pizza place and loved it! The maltiness in the middle was good and the hoppieness at the end was right on point
Really enjoyed this one, finally got to try it thanks to Bevbro. Aroma was awesome the appearance is a golden yellow. The taste is immaculate, hops but not to hoppy very smooth. Perfection!

In this world some things are real and some things are hype.  There is nothing imperfect about this beer - except maybe its lack of availability.  

My local has it on frequently and I never pass it up when its on.
500 mL bottle thanks to Pat: Pours a hazy yellow with a thick white head and lots of CO2 release. Sprucy, floral hop aroma. Smooth sipper, hides strength well. Complex but definitely hop forward.
Poured great, looks great, fantastic palate. I understand why this is a ratebeer favorite, a great beer.

Hazy orange pour with a white foamy head that faded quick.  Great aroma of grassy hops and grapefruit.  Mouth is thick.  Sweet malty backbone of caramel.  Sweet, but not tropical fruit sweet like some DIPAs. Finish is wet and juicy.  Nice hop content.  Too easy to drink.

The aroma is pine oil and earthy soil. Well balanced. Touch of tangerine citrus.

Cloudy dull-orange; carrot colored. Short film of head. 

First sip is heavy amber malt, supremely earthy. The hops are heavy pine oil and a hint of orange peel and citrus. 

Feels fizzy and earthy/dry. I like this beer very very much. Is it top 5 ever? Not sure, but its really goddamn good.

Moderate piney aroma with light grainy malt background.  Appearance is gold and brilliantly clear.  Strong hop flavor (resinous pine).  Well balance between bitterness and malt .  Smooth drinking IIPA!  Well made.  This IIPA is not as aggressive as the newer west coast iipa's.  However, it is easy drinking.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from May 2012, drank 23rd of July. Pours a clear golden colour with a nice, white head that settles into a small lacing. Aroma gets to you when pouring, incredibly hoppy and full of citric notes. Grapefruit, peaches, oak, overall a quite sweet aroma. Flavour is incredible, getting loads of fruity bitterness and finishes of in a light, malty sweetnes. Really easy drinkable, well balanced and haromonized beer... wow.. If it wasnt so expensive I would defintely pick this up again!!
Golden with a bit of white lacing. Grapefruit with a bit of lemon. Fantastic finish that lingers on the back of the tongue
Ok i know 5 but it is good and it sets the margine high for all other beers , i have the pleasure of drinking surly wet when its availalable, and both these beers are grade A well worth it

The beer that sets the mark for IIPAs if not even IPAs as well. Citrus pine resins  hops all over the nose; beautiful pour/lacing on the glass which will stick and eventually solidify. Beautiful amber orange color, hazy with an off white custard colored head. Hops all around, Smooth crisp finish
Awesome beer.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Toronado. Clear orange pour, low carbonation, very low white head.  Aroma is heavy with pine, grapefruit, farmyard quality. Oily with a chewy mouthfeel. Bready malt, dry bitter finish. Really nice balance. ABV well hidden. Very nice.

Definitely the most well balanced IIPA Ive ever tasted.  The bitterness was pretty big but well balanced with hop flavor and maltiness.  The only place it came up a little short in my mind was the aroma, though my bottle was about a month old.

16.9 ounce bottle, about a month and a half old. Brought back from Boulder thanks to beerproject. I think everything that could be said about this beer had been said... its just so well balanced for a double.
Better on trap than in the bottle. The hype really isnt all its made out to be. I could go to Bevmo our the corner liquor store and find something that I like just as much.

Aroma hops, fruits, citrus. Slight bitter taste. Not Bad.

So I would think that this beer is just simply put amazing its got some crazy little bubbles in it if you hold it up to the light you will see what I mean  I received my bottle 2 days after it was bottled at the distributors I drink mine out of the pounder glass that I keep in the freezer and I would say does beer definitely wasnt up to the hype but worthy
Tap. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich flowers, fruits, malt and hops.
16.9 ounce bottle from the brewery. Bottled 06/07/12; huge pine aroma and taste.

Golden in color with creamy white head. Huge hop aroma, floral and fruity. Very tropical. Medium bodied, medium to high carbonation. The malt really comes through in the taste, along with more hops and medium bitterness.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2012 About the Same 7/4/8/4/14[3.7]
 
Pours golden with a decent head, aroma of pine, greeness, lemon grass, flavor is citrusy with lots of pine, lemon, floral notes, pretty bitter and not too sweet, medium to full bodied. Waiting for kerenmk fresh California version ;-) 8/3/8/4/14[3.7]

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2012 Light hazy golden coloured beer with nice firm white head. Rich hop flavour, fresh hops, pine, mango, grass. Fierce bitterness, full body. Very rich flavour. Hint of alcohol. Long bitter aftertaste. An exercise in trying to make this stupid amount of hops balanced. And a quite successful one, I have to admit.
Perfection doesnt exist...Does it ? Maybe ! This brew prove me wrong. Hops in a brillant way. Little dry hop nose. Grassy mouthfeel. Wow, I am blessed.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2014 RE-RATE: less than 2 weeks old. pours a clear, forced carb orange with a white head. Aromas of Tylenol and pine. Some tropical sweet citrus. Flavors of light tropical sweetness but mostly bitter. Pretty average at best. Many breweries are doing this exact same beer, but better. This is average at best nowadays.  Wouldnt seek out again. 3.1 See original rating for my untrained palate rating. 

 ORIGINAL RATE: HUGE thanks to stawn for this trade extra.  Thanks, man!  Pours a clear golden color with an initially large white head that fades into a film rather quickly.  Huge aromas of mango, sweet citrus fruits, pineapple, Juan canary melon.  Taste is initially slightly sweet, followed by a boatload of hop bitterness.  The finish is very long, dry and bitter.  Amazing.  4.4

Poured from a 16.9 ounce bottle into a Duvel tulip. Bottled on June 14, 2012 printed on label. 

Appearance: Pours a clear medium gold with a 2-3 finger fluffy eggshell white head. Nice head retention and lacing.

Smell: Amazing bouquet of hops featuring sweet citrus, grapefruit and pineapple with sweet malt and just a touch of pine and alcohol.

Taste: Ruby red grapefruit, pineapple and tangerine up front followed by caramel malt in the middle before ending with a blast of pine, lemon zest and just a touch of alcohol at the finish. Extremely well-balanced flavor. Aftertaste is bitter and long-lasting. Maybe my favorite aftertaste to date.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied with the perfect amount of carbonation - not too heavy as to be overpowering, but not weak enough to be considered flat in any way. Very smooth and the hop oils really coat the mouth. This beer feels perfect.

Drinkability: Excellent drinkability. This one goes down very easily for a beer with 8% ABV. 

Overall: Amazing beer overall. This beer is incredibly hyped and deservedly so. The only other DIPA that I would compare to it is Bells Hopslam from 2011 (2012 was far too boozy for me and not very balanced, in my opinion). If you see it, try it. If you dont see it, trade for it. Whatever you do, try some fresh Pliny the Elder. From what Ive seen, beer doesnt get much better than this.

Always amazing. I've only had a bad bottle once, and Vinnie sent me 6 more for free in the mail :) The brewery is a must visit, if anywhere near Santa Rosa.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cold 500ml btl poured into Spiegelau snifter. Love the big btl cause I just wanted more of this. Pours bright, radiant, medium golden color, with perfect, fluffy, white foam, leaving some splattered lacing on the glass. Very aromatic on the nose w/ fresh, and refined bright, light, but full floral hop nuances filling the olfactory senses ever-so sweet and seductively.
Taste is a smashingly sweet and bitter hops orgasm in your mouth. Piney, resiny, w/ strong grapefruit, orange & citrus profile, and just the right touch of dryness. What sets this DIPA above the others is the perfect and utterly seamless balance achieved btw the crisp and silky malt foundation and the oh-so elegantly presented hops. This harmonious convergence creates a stunningly smooth and virtually delicate delivery to the palate. Never finished a 500ml so effortlessly and delightfully.  Sublime!  Thanks Chad!
.

Bottled on 5/31/2012.  Thanks to my boss for getting this for me while on a business trip.  Huge hop character in aroma and flavor.  Some malt shines through in the middle only to be washed out with another hoppy wave at the finish.  This beer is intense.  Full bodied.  Medium carbonation.  Probably not something I could drink everyday (Probably blasphemy to most?), but definitely something Im glad I got to experience in the Eastern U. S. of A.

Pliny brings an imensely strong aroma pines and earthy hops. Pours into a beautiful copper gold with a majestic tan foam and nice lacing. The flavor is beyond belief. Strong bitterness from hops with a very subtle bready/nutty malt balancing it out. The bitterness is intense with balanced flavors sent straight from the gods. Nuts, barley, yeast, caramel and spice flavors permeate throughout the flavor of this beer. Overall, this beer certainly lives up to its name with its hugly intense bitterness falling into a plethora of balanced flavors and strong alcohol presence. Id give this an A+ rating.

On tap at Mohawk bend. What do you want me to say? It's Pliny. It is good. The end.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Citybeer, SF, CA.
A perfect hop bomb. Fresh and not overpowering.
Tasty hop and in the background some malts. Well fermented to just give a tuch of sweetness.
This is a almost perfect beer that I would want an unlimited supply of!
theres not much to say about pliny that hasnt been said but thats because its all true. smells great, tastes amazing, is surprisingly strong. GET ON MY LEVEL.

Great nose of floral and fruity hops.  One whiff and you know that this is a big double IPA.  This beer does not disappoint.  A great example of a double IPA that is not too sweet.  After 2 of these, you will be feeling good and hop heads will be very satisfied.  A beer that you should drink whenever you can.

This is The DIPA!

Pours deeply golden in color, with a modest white head. The nose is all citrus fruit and floral notes. Like walking through a florist shop while eating a grapefruit. It is simply glorious. Absolutely no taste of alcohol despite the higher abv, the after taste is crisp and dry, and leaves just enough of a finish for your palate to insist, nay demand another taste. This is a perfect Double IPA. 

I had previously thought that Hercules by Great Divide was the top of the scale. I was wrongI was so very wrong.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2012 My wife brought 10 bottles of this back to DC from Colorado while she was there. They were waiting for me when I got back from the Middle East. :)

A: A Beautiful clean amber color. Id stare it longer if it didnt make me so thirsty.

S: Smells beautiful with grandiose aromas of floral and citrus.

T: Fresh delicious hoppy IPA goodness. Wonderful bitterness and fresh hops. This is truly a special beer.

M: Silky smooth, especially for a double IPA. 8% isnt terribly high ABV, but it is completely masked nonetheless. A beautiful hop bitterness in the finish.

D: I could easily drink several of these. I thoroughly enjoy Pliny the Elder, and it remains one of my favorite beers of all time.

Why do I give Pliny the Elder a perfect 5?

Because i drink it the only way its meant to be drunk- perfectly fresh.

I am such the Pliny connoisseur, that I will not drink it if its a month old, and I hesitate to drink it at 2 weeks old. 

Perfectly fresh is best, but 1 week old is still golden- literally and metaphorically.

Then, you get the full-on Pliny True Experience- a perfect score in all aspects. 

Once those hops begin to die, once the "life" of the beer wanes, the MAGIC dissipates... but until then, you get something more from Pliny, something lacking in the vast majority of other, deader beers.

I could go on and on about the tan sheen of Brazillian supermodel ass, the fragrant nose of decomposing Nordic pine needles, the flavors of Afghani copper smelted with diamondback venom-

But the fact of the matter is, Pliny is something to be experienced fresh and only fresh, and then you will FEEL the superb intoxication of a LIVE beer, and the magical intoxication of FRESH HOPS, and understand for yourself.

Pours a glowing pear/honey gold with a finger of sticky, stanky white head that dissolves to form a neat collar and spotty bits retaining in the middle. Slow needlepoint beading persists. A lovely glass of beer indeed.

Dense, fresh wet hops... tropical citrus galore with the support of all things coniferous. Mango, pineapple, spruce, rich pine, for having such a boring label this thing can really tango.

Big and bitter but subtle and smooth. Tremendous hop balance. Lets not even talk about malts... what are malts? Fuck malts, this stuff is crazy dank like the stankiest of the stanky. Its everything you can ask of a hop, all in one beer.

Overall, thanks a TON to schwartzoid for this and many other fantastic beers. Very glad Ive got another waiting for me in the icebox cause this is DIRTY!

Hell yeah.

Bottle. Huge thanks to deeblo for supplying this fresh bottle! Light amber golden color with a massive white head. The nose is big, bright citrus fruit salad. Plenty of mango and grapefruit, pineapple and golden syrup. Great, classic DIPA nose. The taste is just a glorious burst of citrus fruits, sweet sugar and honey. Lightly salty with a floral fresh hop finish. Nicely balanced and so easy to drink. This is 8%? Man, it hides it well. The bodys fairly light and drinkable, smooth and easy. The carbonation is prickly. Overall, a really nice DIPA. Some beers with big reputations disappoint when you finally try them, this isnt one of them. Very good.

Pours a hazy golden color with a 5-inch head. Sexy lacing. Absolutely disgusting esthery scent, and I also get some forward alcohol and marzipan. Off-putting spicy palate, accompanied by raisin and pine. Very light mouthfeel and bitter, bitter finish.
Very smooth with complex alcohol build.. Would never think it was as strong air was!!

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2013 I originally rated this a 4.1 based on two bottles.  I recently had the opportunity to visit RBR and get a growler of this fine beer.  As good as it was bottled, it is so much better from the tap that I had to re-rate it.

Pours liquid gold with a frothy white head that last forever and excellent lacing. Hoppy scents of citrus, apricot and pine. Medium bodied with a hoppy start and smooth finish. A superb balance of malt and hops.  Very good and worth the hype.
Pours a golden yellowish Like this one a tad bit more than blind pig for its a tad bit stronger. Clean and crisp as well and taste of pine, citrus attack your palate.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2012 I was waiting for this one for months and had it special shipped from California. I dont know if I got a bad batch but Id rather drink even a generic beer. Standard IPA taste, not much body or flavor at all. Nothing to write home about. 
-------- have since tried this again and it looks like I might have received a bad batch originally. I still wouldnt rate this a 10/10 but its a great IPA with well blended hops citrus with some unobtrusive cacao nib notes

Incredible. Glad to finally find this on tap. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

poured from a bottle into a snifter. huge hops out of the bottle and in the glass. this bottle must be quite fresh. taste is all hops, strong citrus (mostly red grapefruit), light bitterness, but full flavor. bitter but very balanced. smooth in the mouth, lightly carbonated. little head when poured. if this was available, i would drink often, very often. i now understand the hype.
Reviewed on: 08-16-2008
Loved this beer, happened to be in Napa Valley and took a 1hr ride just to try this, wasnt dissapointed.  I cannot get this in the Midwest so I just got lucky.

bottle. no doubt a well balanced hoppy beer. Probably a good standard to judge the style by but not unique or interesting in any way. I can think of about 10 imperial IPAs Id grab out of the cooler first. I think a bunch of band wagoners have inflated the rating on this one.

Grapefruit citrus floral explosion. Absolutely wonderful. Pours amber color with thin quickly dissipating head. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at 38 Degrees Alehouse.  Pours a hazy orange with nice white head.  Good lacing.  A great piny and floral aroma.  Similar on the taste, with great malt balance.  Pretty much the perfect beer.  Love it.

Wonderful citrus and pine scents, pours a light amber color with a thin lasting head. Taste is a nice strong bitter that fades quickly, rather smooth.

Pours a deep straw, with a white head.
Fruity, hoppy aroma, apricot, mango, passion fruit, spruce, lime peel.
Off-dry, medium bodied, high bitterness, balanced CO2.
Hoppy, fruity taste, mango, resin, spruce, grapefruit, yeast, caramel.

Re-rated on bottle 2012-06-27. Same general impression, not an overwhelming beer, but the balance is magnificent.

Not sure what all the hoopla is about this IPA. Yea it's good, but I don't know why people travel far and wide for it and buy out all of Whole Foods stock as soon as it comes in.

Flavour filled with grapefruit, grass, flowers, pine and a touch of lemon. Tasty.

I poured the bottle into a snifter.  It poured a hazy golden with about two fingers of white head.  The aroma twas very strong pine.  However the taste was sooo smooth.  The pine was really not evident in the taste.  The hops were up front followed by a sweet Carmel flavor.  This beer lived up to the hype.

Had it from the bottle and from the tap at the brewery. A flawless beer that deserves all the accolades.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours light orange...minnimal head...  pine aroma..taste is pine grapefruit hopps...awesome..super smooth...wish was easier to get

Tap into a pint glass.
I get grapefruit aroma but nothing else. It pours clear amber with a nice head and ample lacing; nice to look at. A quite nice hop beginning and it washes over and coats the tongue with its wonderful hoppyness. One of the best IPAs I've ever had.
A perfect IPA, in my humble opinion. Beautiful orange color, piney, citrus aroma and balanced mouthfeel and palate. Wow

Bottle. Pours amber with nice head retention. Pine and citrus in the nose. Medium full mouth-feel, lots of floral and citrus notes in the palate. Finishes with a pleasant slight-bitterness. Incredibly  well balanced

16.9 oz bottle poured into a tulip.  Pours a nice golden amber with a creamy 1 finger head.   Taste is grapefruit,  pine,  citrus with a tad bit of bitterness at the end.   Excellent mouth feel,  so smooth.   No trace of the 8%,  awesome brew,  wish it was easier to find.

Pours a deep gold with real good carbonation, the head fizzles out pretty quick though. The nose is heavy hops, citrus, floral, earthy, lemon, orange and some bananas. Very crisp, and refreshing, a dry finish. Flavors of immediate banana, then lemon. I am not a hop head, but the hops are not overwhelming although they are noticed. Not my favorite style of beer, but this was good for its style. I do have to say considering all the hype, I was expecting this to blow my mind, but it was an average drinkable beer, which is good for its style.

Aroma- big tropical fruits, pineapple, nice hop profile
Appearance- pale yellow with a fantastic white head and superb lacing
Taste- big ripe tropical fruits, massive hop bite, more fruit juices, cleansing hops on the backend
Palate- nice body with a crisp, refreshing mouthfeel
Overall- Maybe the best DIPA that Ive ever had.  It is certainly the most well-blended DIPA that Ive encountered.  Everything right, nothing wrong.  Fantastic brew.

Bottle (11 days old). Pours a slightly hazy, golden straw color. Aroma of heavy pine and fresh-mown hay.  The taste is so clear and crisp from the start with a perfect hop balance (not overboard like so many other double IPAs) and a lovely, lingering finish. It doesnt drink like a DIPA, which is what makes it awesome. Ive tried Pliny twice before and was never terribly impresses, but this fairly fresh bottle comes a lot closer to living up to the massive hype.

Bottle. Pours a becoming clear golden, with a big, thick, lightly coloured head. The aroma is very nice fruity, almost perfectly balanced with the sweetness of tropical fruits and honey, yet at the same time the bitterness of lemon and orange peel. A full, fairly thick body, with average carbonation. Flavour has a good hoppy bitterness with notes of orange peel, excellently balanced by a nice, almost fruity toffee. Long bitter finish.

resin, floral, spruce, bread, golden, hazy, minimal head, white foam, medium sweetness, very bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation. Quite light coloured compared to other DIPAs. Some nice bitterness, but quite balanced. Not as in your face as some other DIPAs. Good, but maybe I expected too much because of the rage. Maybe it is because it is a couple months old as you cant get this fresh in the Netherlands.

Draught @ Hamiltons, San Diego. Nice golden hue. Grapefruit, pineapple, malts, lemon, bitter hops. Some spices towards the end. Decent body, bitterness carries around the palate. To be honest, many of the other West Coast IPAs do much, much more than this one, which I find constrained by tradition, not bold.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2013 Pliny the Elder has a clear golden color with a nice foam head. The aroma is of grapefruit citrus, hops, lite pine, and very faint malts. As for flavor I noticed yeast, hops, a citrus bite, and malts. The finish is mildly bitter and leaves a malt, yeast, and hoppy after taste. Overall this is a very solid beverage.

Poured into a ccb pint glass. Golden and translucent, two finger head with lots of lacing. Aromas of citrus and pine in the hops with malt in the background. Taste follows the nose, very hoppy, some malt bitterness is high. it doesnt seem as complex as the hype around this beer, its a great dipa just not as great as all the hype.
The best IPA out there. Plain and simple. Absolutely unbelievable on fronts.

With all the hype and chasing this beer all over Denver to get one I did! Great Ipa maybe not as good as the hype but great beer, pours golden hops hit right up front alcohol is well hidden enough malt to notice but clearly a hop driven beer, of you find one buy it and consume ASAP 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours light golden, well filtered with thin but lingering head. Hops, right off the bat. The flavor is... hops. Fresh, floral, piney. Just enough malt to let the hops shine without dominating. Perhaps overrated (could any beer really live up to this hype?), but just consistently excellent.

Thanks for sharing Jason! Nice and fresh...pours a light honey color with a smallish head that goes to a thin wisp and ring. Smells of light malt underneath with grapefruit, a little pine. Taste follows nose - very nice. Crisp dry ending with slight bitterness. Light plus body with delicate carbonation. Obviously a world class brew.

Thanks to jhenry04, little over a month old , so fresh as fuck when it comes to imports in Belgium !! 
Head: small, off white, bubbly 
Colour: light mber gold, clear 
Smell: slight peppery, little bit of irony and malts, quite exotic with notes of mango, pineapple, lemon peels and apricots 
Taste: start is a bit malty but quickly makes place for a load of hops and bitterness, al very balanced tough ! flavours of oranges bitter hops and slight yeasty bitterness, overall this beer is very refreshing with a serious amount of bitterness where i actually cant say where its from and what it actually taste like ... as far as i can taste and tell the bitterness just tastes like BITTERNESS LOL :p. end is again a bit malty and grassy fresh aftertaste is zeste.

All the great things had been said about this beer. Seems most people say that this is a very drinkable beer, and it sure the fuck is. The most present flavors are pine, grass, and  a touch of tropical fruits (grapefruit and pineapple) with enough malt to balance things out but not to make it sweet. Finishes dry with some low to medium bitterness. One of the few downfalls of this beer is it does go down hill rather quick, my advise, drink within two weeks of the bottleling date. The best PtE I ever tasted was two days after the bottleling date which I found in Bristol Farms in Manhattam Beach, that was a badass find.
Pours a light amber with a big fluffy head that fades to light lacing. Sweet citrus aroma. tastes of citrus and bubble gum. resinous mouthfeel that goes dry.

This is the best IPA in the USA. It is an amazing blend of citrus, hops, and a bunch of alcohol. Russian River's flagship beer is one that should be considered the gold standard for IPA's

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Old rating...thanks to my sister who smuggled this delicious contraband from Denver to Georgia. So maybe not the freshest specimen, but still glad to get to try it. The hype preceded it, so it is always hard to tell where it ends and tastes begin, but wow, what a great beer! Golden pour. Delicious complex aroma...pine, grapefruit, lemon. Taste follows with a  great crisp hoppy pine taste and nice spicy after. A really subtle but present malt sweetness. Alcohol taste no where to be found. Mouthfeel is a fine thing. The balance and complexity really make this beer stand apart. Just a great experience to drink. Thanks again, sis.

So many people have reviewed Pliny, I don't need to reiterate what has been said thousands of times. All I will say, is that it lives up to the hype! I live in Florida, so this beer was VERY had to get! But I can't wait to drink it again!

Bottle. Nose of pine, citrus & hops. Pours a clear golden color with a foamy white head and some lacing. The flavor starts like a pine forest with some citrus and ends with peppery (good) bitter hopiness that rolls into a long finish.

Bottle. Pours a clear golden orange with a white head that left nice lacing.Big hoppy aroma with pine, grapefruit, grass, and floral hops. Flavor was intense and hoppy with fresh grapefruit, pine, citrus and sweet malts with a nice malty backbone.   A great ipa
UPDATED: MAY 6, 2012 A little less sugar, a little less hops than its big brother the Younger. Still a delicious bold IPA from the brewery that does the best ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From bottle to tulip. Pours a crystal clear golden color with a bright white frothy head. Smells of citrus grapefruit, resiny floral hops, and a hint of caramel malts. Taste is much of the same but very complex with a very nice clean finish. MF is average with good medium carbonation. Overall this is delicious DIPA.

Beautiful to pour, beautiful to smell, beautiful to drink.  Probably the most balanced IPA I've tasted. Not overly floral or citrusy, just the wonderful aroma and flavor of abundant hops.  Consistent all the way through - slightly sweet...the hops just linger on your palate for what seems like forever.

50cl Bottle at AHBS. Light hazy golden orange colour, white head. Aroma of pine and citrus, loads of lovely hops. Flavour is light sweet, malty, dry, pine, light fruity, citrus, firm bitter dry citrus finish with some pine. Medium bodied. Highly drinkable DIPA, great stuff.

En botella cortesia de theoncle en Rosses i Torrades.
Color dorada cristalina buena espuma, magnifica retencion.Aromas a pino, resina, pomelo con notas florales.Sabor intenso y embriagador .Perfectamente equlibrada en amargor y carbonatación.Muy muy aromatica incluso con la botella vacia.

From the bottle, pours a beautiful amber gold with a fluffy white head. Aroma, WOW, earthy, herbal, floral, all the archetypes of hop odours. Grapefruit is very prominent. Bitter and sharp, soft creamy mouth feel. Amazing.

Originally reviewed: 4/1/09. Bottled on 3/9/09, so it is very fresh. Pours a murky, cloudy orangish gold. Huge frothy white head billows on the top of this beer. Gorgeous. Great fluffy retention. Some globs present on the glass edge. Little whisps left behind as well. Really a beautiful beer.

The nose on this is like no other. Just a perfect bountiful smack of pine, grapefruit, pineapple, hibiscus, and a nice spicy finish. I just wanted to dip my nose in deeper and deeper. I could snort this froth. Mouthfeel is nice and crisp, clean, and slightly wet. Very easy to drink. Not thick, not thin. 

This beer packs the punch on the flavor, no doubt about it. Huge grapefruity hop presence that finishes with a hint of burnt toast. Slight alcohol zip mixed in as well. Just an absolutey magnificent beer! This is dangerously drinkable as well. Much more so than the Younger. With the alcohol value where it is, this could do some damage for sure. Im glad I got 3 bottles; I just need to spread them out a bit. This beer lives up to the hype.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2013 Bottle 510ml.
Pours golden with medium white head. Nice lacing. Aroma is of tropical fruits, resin, pine. Taste is of tropical fruits, pine, citrus. Palate: Light-medium body. Very nice balance. Overall: Awesome hops. Very impressive DIPA. Aromatics are unleashed. Bitterness not too harsh. Outstanding.

[Former rating 4/29/2012: 8/4/8/3/15]
Bottle 510ml.
Pours clear golden, with white head. Some lacing. Aroma is of citrus (grapefruits), pine, hops, some other fruits. Taste is of citrus, fruits, alchool. Bitter finish, nicely balanced. A very good beer, but i had better double IPAs...

Botle 500 ml. Pours nice and clear golden blonde. Lasting white head with a good lacing. Aroma: citrus is very present, along with American hops. Taste is great and well balanced, fruity with just enough bitterness.
Bouteille 500 ml. Belle robe blonde dorée. Collet blanc persistant et beau "lacing". Arôme: les agrumes sont très présentes, accompagnées de houblon américain. Excellent goût bien balancé, fruité avec juste assez damertume.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2013 Bottle (510 ml). 3 weeks old. Thanks to NorCalAussie for this one. Clear bright golden with a medium mostly lasting white head and good lacing. Aroma if a burst of tropical fruits along with citrus, light resinous notes and light malt. Taste is slightly sweet with tropical fruits, light resinous notes, light malt and light to moderate bitterness. Alcohol is completely hidden. Light to medium body (which is incredible for 8 % abv Double IPA). Good carbonation. Oily mouthfeel. Dry finish. Almost perfect balance here, which is the main reason why this beer is so good. Super refreshing and drinkable. Nice aromatic features.

One of the best IPAs money can buy! Not too sweet and not too hop forward.

Golden colour, white head. Grassy, piney aromas, booze well hidden. Great DIPA
What can you say about this beer? It lives up to the hype and more. One of, if not THE best beer, Ive ever had.

Shared with yiannos.
FIrst of all it has a gold color, not the one you expect from a DIPA.
Amazing aromas: pine&grass. Same features in taste with a long aftertaste and a strong alc presence. One of the best beers I ever had, bad not an easy one. Thanks yiannos.

Bottle to oversized snifter (thanks Chris). Looks good;burnt-orange with thin lacing. Smells great; nice hop scent. Tastes good, but not like Dreadnaught or Heady Topper. It is a month old though. Still, damn good beer!

Golden with a white head - a lot of hopsin the aroma - very strong hop flavor in the body and in a very nice way, olso good malt to support the hop bitterness - long lingering hoppy finish - this was very good

On tap at fathers office. Top two ipas. So smooth but also so flavorful. Great aroma. Pine

20/04/2012 500ml bottle, shared by Tim (thanks dreadnord!). Ambrata scarica, limpidissima, bellissimo cappello di schiuma bianca, molto persistente. Aroma complesso ed equilibrato di malto, luppolo (agrumato, resinoso, floreale). In bocca è perfettamente equilibrata, malto e luppolo si sposano in maniera magistrale. Corpo medio, grande bevibilità, carbonazione corretta. Birra equilibratissima.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2013 The double IPA by which all others should be judged. Pliny in a bottle is a wonderful experience from the first sweet, citrusy smell to the last drop of wonderfully grapefruity goodness. Some doubles are a little over the top, but Russian River provides us with a wonderfully balanced beer with strong hop notes. Pliny on tap is the IPA that I have always been waiting for. I have the lucky fortune of living a two hour drive from the brewery and make the pilgrimage regularly to pick up a growler or two. RERATING after I have tried MANY MANY more DIPAs. Pliny is still great, but others have caught up, with many making DIPAs as good, or in some cases better. Based on the standards of today, I would have to dock pliny a touch for a bit too much bitterness and harshness.

My go to beer. Solid IPA with no issues.  Great beer and great value. Plus it's local!

Pours a dark orange color with an off white head. Aroma is like walking to a pine forest. Taste has wonderful balance of piny hop bitterness and malt sweetness with a full mouthfeel.

A lovely amber and gold color with a white foamy head and lacing. The aroma has plenty of citrusy hops and malt with some pine and floral aromas. The taste has lots of forward hops with a malty backbone and a smooth, sweet aftertaste.
